35  @brief Implementations of expression classes

45 #include "llvmutil.h"
46 #ifndef _MSC_VER
47 #include <inttypes.h>

50 #define PRId64 "lld"
51 #endif
52 #ifndef PRIu64
53 #define PRIu64 "llu"
54 #endif

57 #include <set>
58 #include <stdio.h>
59 #if defined(LLVM_3_1) || defined(LLVM_3_2)
60  #include <llvm/Module.h>

81 // Expr
82 
83 llvm::Value *
84 Expr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
85  // Expressions that can't provide an lvalue can just return NULL
86  return NULL;
87 }
88 
89 
90 const Type *
91 Expr::GetLValueType() const {
92  // This also only needs to be overrided by Exprs that implement the
93  // GetLValue() method.
94  return NULL;
95 }
96 
97 
98 llvm::Constant *
99 Expr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
100  // The default is failure; just return NULL
101  return NULL;
102 }
103 
104 
105 Symbol *
106 Expr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
107  // Not all expressions can do this, so provide a generally-useful
108  // default implementation.
109  return NULL;
110 }
111 
112 
113 #if 0
114 /** If a conversion from 'fromAtomicType' to 'toAtomicType' may cause lost
115  precision, issue a warning. Don't warn for conversions to bool and
116  conversions between signed and unsigned integers of the same size.
117  */
118 static void
119 lMaybeIssuePrecisionWarning(const AtomicType *toAtomicType,
120  const AtomicType *fromAtomicType,
121  SourcePos pos, const char *errorMsgBase) {
122  switch (toAtomicType->basicType) {
123  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
124  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
125  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
126  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
127  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
128  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
129  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
130  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
131  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
132  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
133  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
134  if ((int)toAtomicType->basicType < (int)fromAtomicType->basicType &&
135  toAtomicType->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL &&
136  !(toAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT8 &&
137  fromAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8) &&
138  !(toAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT16 &&
139  fromAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16) &&
140  !(toAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT32 &&
141  fromAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32) &&
142  !(toAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 &&
143  fromAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64))
144  Warning(pos, "Conversion from type \"%s\" to type \"%s\" for %s"
145  " may lose information.",
146  fromAtomicType->GetString().c_str(), toAtomicType->GetString().c_str(),
147  errorMsgBase);
148  break;
149  default:
150  FATAL("logic error in lMaybeIssuePrecisionWarning()");
151  }
152 }
153 #endif
154 
155 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
156 
157 static Expr *
158 lArrayToPointer(Expr *expr) {
159  AssertPos(expr->pos, expr && CastType<ArrayType>(expr->GetType()));
160 
161  Expr *zero = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformInt32, 0, expr->pos);
162  Expr *index = new IndexExpr(expr, zero, expr->pos);
163  Expr *addr = new AddressOfExpr(index, expr->pos);
164  addr = TypeCheck(addr);
165  Assert(addr != NULL);
166  addr = Optimize(addr);
167  Assert(addr != NULL);
168  return addr;
169 }
170 
171 
172 static bool
173 lIsAllIntZeros(Expr *expr) {
174  const Type *type = expr->GetType();
175  if (type == NULL || type->IsIntType() == false)
176  return false;
177 
178  ConstExpr *ce = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr);
179  if (ce == NULL)
180  return false;
181 
182  uint64_t vals[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
183  int count = ce->AsUInt64(vals);
184  if (count == 1)
185  return (vals[0] == 0);
186  else {
187  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
188  if (vals[i] != 0)
189  return false;
190  }
191  return true;
192 }
193 
194 
195 static bool
196 lDoTypeConv(const Type *fromType, const Type *toType, Expr **expr,
197  bool failureOk, const char *errorMsgBase, SourcePos pos) {
198  /* This function is way too long and complex. Is type conversion stuff
199  always this messy, or can this be cleaned up somehow? */
200  AssertPos(pos, failureOk || errorMsgBase != NULL);
201 
202  if (toType == NULL || fromType == NULL)
203  return false;
204 
205  // The types are equal; there's nothing to do
206  if (Type::Equal(toType, fromType))
207  return true;
208 
209  if (Type::Equal(fromType, AtomicType::Void)) {
210  if (!failureOk)
211  Error(pos, "Can't convert from \"void\" to \"%s\" for %s.",
212  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
213  return false;
214  }
215 
216  if (Type::Equal(toType, AtomicType::Void)) {
217  if (!failureOk)
218  Error(pos, "Can't convert type \"%s\" to \"void\" for %s.",
219  fromType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
220  return false;
221  }
222 
223  if (CastType<FunctionType>(fromType)) {
224  if (CastType<PointerType>(toType) != NULL) {
225  // Convert function type to pointer to function type
226  if (expr != NULL) {
227  Expr *aoe = new AddressOfExpr(*expr, (*expr)->pos);
228  if (lDoTypeConv(aoe->GetType(), toType, &aoe, failureOk,
229  errorMsgBase, pos)) {
230  *expr = aoe;
231  return true;
232  }
233  }
234  else
235  return lDoTypeConv(PointerType::GetUniform(fromType), toType, NULL,
236  failureOk, errorMsgBase, pos);
237  }
238  else {
239  if (!failureOk)
240  Error(pos, "Can't convert function type \"%s\" to \"%s\" for %s.",
241  fromType->GetString().c_str(),
242  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
243  return false;
244  }
245  }
246  if (CastType<FunctionType>(toType)) {
247  if (!failureOk)
248  Error(pos, "Can't convert from type \"%s\" to function type \"%s\" "
249  "for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
250  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
251  return false;
252  }
253 
254  if ((toType->GetSOAWidth() > 0 || fromType->GetSOAWidth() > 0) &&
255  Type::Equal(toType->GetAsUniformType(), fromType->GetAsUniformType()) &&
256  toType->GetSOAWidth() != fromType->GetSOAWidth()) {
257  if (!failureOk)
258  Error(pos, "Can't convert between types \"%s\" and \"%s\" with "
259  "different SOA widths for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
260  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
261  return false;
262  }
263 
264  const ArrayType *toArrayType = CastType<ArrayType>(toType);
265  const ArrayType *fromArrayType = CastType<ArrayType>(fromType);
266  const VectorType *toVectorType = CastType<VectorType>(toType);
267  const VectorType *fromVectorType = CastType<VectorType>(fromType);
268  const StructType *toStructType = CastType<StructType>(toType);
269  const StructType *fromStructType = CastType<StructType>(fromType);
270  const EnumType *toEnumType = CastType<EnumType>(toType);
271  const EnumType *fromEnumType = CastType<EnumType>(fromType);
272  const AtomicType *toAtomicType = CastType<AtomicType>(toType);
273  const AtomicType *fromAtomicType = CastType<AtomicType>(fromType);
274  const PointerType *fromPointerType = CastType<PointerType>(fromType);
275  const PointerType *toPointerType = CastType<PointerType>(toType);
276 
277  // Do this early, since for the case of a conversion like
278  // "float foo[10]" -> "float * uniform foo", we have what's seemingly
279  // a varying to uniform conversion (but not really)
280  if (fromArrayType != NULL && toPointerType != NULL) {
281  // can convert any array to a void pointer (both uniform and
282  // varying).
283  if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(toPointerType))
284  goto typecast_ok;
285 
286  // array to pointer to array element type
287  const Type *eltType = fromArrayType->GetElementType();
288  if (toPointerType->GetBaseType()->IsConstType())
289  eltType = eltType->GetAsConstType();
290 
291  PointerType pt(eltType, toPointerType->GetVariability(),
292  toPointerType->IsConstType());
293  if (Type::Equal(toPointerType, &pt))
294  goto typecast_ok;
295  else {
296  if (!failureOk)
297  Error(pos, "Can't convert from incompatible array type \"%s\" "
298  "to pointer type \"%s\" for %s.",
299  fromType->GetString().c_str(),
300  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
301  return false;
302  }
303  }
304 
305  if (toType->IsUniformType() && fromType->IsVaryingType()) {
306  if (!failureOk)
307  Error(pos, "Can't convert from type \"%s\" to type \"%s\" for %s.",
308  fromType->GetString().c_str(), toType->GetString().c_str(),
309  errorMsgBase);
310  return false;
311  }
312 
313  if (fromPointerType != NULL) {
314  if (CastType<AtomicType>(toType) != NULL &&
315  toType->IsBoolType())
316  // Allow implicit conversion of pointers to bools
317  goto typecast_ok;
318 
319  if (toArrayType != NULL &&
320  Type::Equal(fromType->GetBaseType(), toArrayType->GetElementType())) {
321  // Can convert pointers to arrays of the same type
322  goto typecast_ok;
323  }
324  if (toPointerType == NULL) {
325  if (!failureOk)
326  Error(pos, "Can't convert between from pointer type "
327  "\"%s\" to non-pointer type \"%s\" for %s.",
328  fromType->GetString().c_str(),
329  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
330  return false;
331  }
332  else if (fromPointerType->IsSlice() == true &&
333  toPointerType->IsSlice() == false) {
334  if (!failureOk)
335  Error(pos, "Can't convert from pointer to SOA type "
336  "\"%s\" to pointer to non-SOA type \"%s\" for %s.",
337  fromPointerType->GetAsNonSlice()->GetString().c_str(),
338  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
339  return false;
340  }
341  else if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(toPointerType)) {
342  // any pointer type can be converted to a void *
343  goto typecast_ok;
344  }
345  else if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(fromPointerType) &&
346  expr != NULL &&
347  dynamic_cast<NullPointerExpr *>(*expr) != NULL) {
348  // and a NULL convert to any other pointer type
349  goto typecast_ok;
350  }
351  else if (!Type::Equal(fromPointerType->GetBaseType(),
352  toPointerType->GetBaseType()) &&
353  !Type::Equal(fromPointerType->GetBaseType()->GetAsConstType(),
354  toPointerType->GetBaseType())) {
355  if (!failureOk)
356  Error(pos, "Can't convert from pointer type \"%s\" to "
357  "incompatible pointer type \"%s\" for %s.",
358  fromPointerType->GetString().c_str(),
359  toPointerType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
360  return false;
361  }
362 
363  if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
364  goto typecast_ok;
365 
366  if (toPointerType->IsSlice() == true &&
367  fromPointerType->IsSlice() == false)
368  goto typecast_ok;
369 
370  // Otherwise there's nothing to do
371  return true;
372  }
373 
374  if (toPointerType != NULL && fromAtomicType != NULL &&
375  fromAtomicType->IsIntType() && expr != NULL &&
376  lIsAllIntZeros(*expr)) {
377  // We have a zero-valued integer expression, which can also be
378  // treated as a NULL pointer that can be converted to any other
379  // pointer type.
380  Expr *npe = new NullPointerExpr(pos);
381  if (lDoTypeConv(PointerType::Void, toType, &npe,
382  failureOk, errorMsgBase, pos)) {
383  *expr = npe;
384  return true;
385  }
386  return false;
387  }
388 
389  // Need to check this early, since otherwise the [sic] "unbound"
390  // variability of SOA struct types causes things to get messy if that
391  // hasn't been detected...
392  if (toStructType && fromStructType &&
393  (toStructType->GetSOAWidth() != fromStructType->GetSOAWidth())) {
394  if (!failureOk)
395  Error(pos, "Can't convert between incompatible struct types \"%s\" "
396  "and \"%s\" for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
397  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
398  return false;
399  }
400 
401  // Convert from type T -> const T; just return a TypeCast expr, which
402  // can handle this
403  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toType, fromType) &&
404  toType->IsConstType() == true &&
405  fromType->IsConstType() == false)
406  goto typecast_ok;
407 
408  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(fromType)) {
409  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(toType)) {
410  // Convert from a reference to a type to a const reference to a type;
411  // this is handled by TypeCastExpr
412  if (Type::Equal(toType->GetReferenceTarget(),
413  fromType->GetReferenceTarget()->GetAsConstType()))
414  goto typecast_ok;
415 
416  const ArrayType *atFrom =
417  CastType<ArrayType>(fromType->GetReferenceTarget());
418  const ArrayType *atTo =
419  CastType<ArrayType>(toType->GetReferenceTarget());
420 
421  if (atFrom != NULL && atTo != NULL &&
422  Type::Equal(atFrom->GetElementType(), atTo->GetElementType())) {
423  goto typecast_ok;
424  }
425  else {
426  if (!failureOk)
427  Error(pos, "Can't convert between incompatible reference types \"%s\" "
428  "and \"%s\" for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
429  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
430  return false;
431  }
432  }
433  else {
434  // convert from a reference T -> T
435  if (expr != NULL) {
436  Expr *drExpr = new RefDerefExpr(*expr, pos);
437  if (lDoTypeConv(drExpr->GetType(), toType, &drExpr, failureOk,
438  errorMsgBase, pos) == true) {
439  *expr = drExpr;
440  return true;
441  }
442  return false;
443  }
444  else
445  return lDoTypeConv(fromType->GetReferenceTarget(), toType, NULL,
446  failureOk, errorMsgBase, pos);
447  }
448  }
449  else if (CastType<ReferenceType>(toType)) {
450  // T -> reference T
451  if (expr != NULL) {
452  Expr *rExpr = new ReferenceExpr(*expr, pos);
453  if (lDoTypeConv(rExpr->GetType(), toType, &rExpr, failureOk,
454  errorMsgBase, pos) == true) {
455  *expr = rExpr;
456  return true;
457  }
458  return false;
459  }
460  else {
461  ReferenceType rt(fromType);
462  return lDoTypeConv(&rt, toType, NULL, failureOk, errorMsgBase, pos);
463  }
464  }
465  else if (Type::Equal(toType, fromType->GetAsNonConstType()))
466  // convert: const T -> T (as long as T isn't a reference)
467  goto typecast_ok;
468 
469  fromType = fromType->GetReferenceTarget();
470  toType = toType->GetReferenceTarget();
471  if (toArrayType && fromArrayType) {
472  if (Type::Equal(toArrayType->GetElementType(),
473  fromArrayType->GetElementType())) {
474  // the case of different element counts should have returned
475  // successfully earlier, yes??
476  AssertPos(pos, toArrayType->GetElementCount() != fromArrayType->GetElementCount());
477  goto typecast_ok;
478  }
479  else if (Type::Equal(toArrayType->GetElementType(),
480  fromArrayType->GetElementType()->GetAsConstType())) {
481  // T[x] -> const T[x]
482  goto typecast_ok;
483  }
484  else {
485  if (!failureOk)
486  Error(pos, "Array type \"%s\" can't be converted to type \"%s\" for %s.",
487  fromType->GetString().c_str(), toType->GetString().c_str(),
488  errorMsgBase);
489  return false;
490  }
491  }
492 
493  if (toVectorType && fromVectorType) {
494  // converting e.g. int<n> -> float<n>
495  if (fromVectorType->GetElementCount() != toVectorType->GetElementCount()) {
496  if (!failureOk)
497  Error(pos, "Can't convert between differently sized vector types "
498  "\"%s\" -> \"%s\" for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
499  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
500  return false;
501  }
502  goto typecast_ok;
503  }
504 
505  if (toStructType && fromStructType) {
506  if (!Type::Equal(toStructType->GetAsUniformType()->GetAsConstType(),
507  fromStructType->GetAsUniformType()->GetAsConstType())) {
508  if (!failureOk)
509  Error(pos, "Can't convert between different struct types "
510  "\"%s\" and \"%s\" for %s.", fromStructType->GetString().c_str(),
511  toStructType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
512  return false;
513  }
514  goto typecast_ok;
515  }
516 
517  if (toEnumType != NULL && fromEnumType != NULL) {
518  // No implicit conversions between different enum types
519  if (!Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toEnumType->GetAsUniformType(),
520  fromEnumType->GetAsUniformType())) {
521  if (!failureOk)
522  Error(pos, "Can't convert between different enum types "
523  "\"%s\" and \"%s\" for %s", fromEnumType->GetString().c_str(),
524  toEnumType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
525  return false;
526  }
527  goto typecast_ok;
528  }
529 
530  // enum -> atomic (integer, generally...) is always ok
531  if (fromEnumType != NULL) {
532  AssertPos(pos, toAtomicType != NULL || toVectorType != NULL);
533  goto typecast_ok;
534  }
535 
536  // from here on out, the from type can only be atomic something or
537  // other...
538  if (fromAtomicType == NULL) {
539  if (!failureOk)
540  Error(pos, "Type conversion from \"%s\" to \"%s\" for %s is not "
541  "possible.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
542  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
543  return false;
544  }
545 
546  // scalar -> short-vector conversions
547  if (toVectorType != NULL &&
548  (fromType->GetSOAWidth() == toType->GetSOAWidth()))
549  goto typecast_ok;
550 
551  // ok, it better be a scalar->scalar conversion of some sort by now
552  if (toAtomicType == NULL) {
553  if (!failureOk)
554  Error(pos, "Type conversion from \"%s\" to \"%s\" for %s is "
555  "not possible", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
556  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
557  return false;
558  }
559 
560  if (fromType->GetSOAWidth() != toType->GetSOAWidth()) {
561  if (!failureOk)
562  Error(pos, "Can't convert between types \"%s\" and \"%s\" with "
563  "different SOA widths for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
564  toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
565  return false;
566  }
567 
568  typecast_ok:
569  if (expr != NULL)
570  *expr = new TypeCastExpr(toType, *expr, pos);
571  return true;
572 }
573 
574 
575 bool
576 CanConvertTypes(const Type *fromType, const Type *toType,
577  const char *errorMsgBase, SourcePos pos) {
578  return lDoTypeConv(fromType, toType, NULL, errorMsgBase == NULL,
579  errorMsgBase, pos);
580 }
581 
582 
583 Expr *
584 TypeConvertExpr(Expr *expr, const Type *toType, const char *errorMsgBase) {
585  if (expr == NULL)
586  return NULL;
587 
588 #if 0
589  Debug(expr->pos, "type convert %s -> %s.", expr->GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
590  toType->GetString().c_str());
591 #endif
592 
593  const Type *fromType = expr->GetType();
594  Expr *e = expr;
595  if (lDoTypeConv(fromType, toType, &e, false, errorMsgBase,
596  expr->pos))
597  return e;
598  else
599  return NULL;
600 }
601 
602 
603 bool
604 PossiblyResolveFunctionOverloads(Expr *expr, const Type *type) {
605  FunctionSymbolExpr *fse = NULL;
606  const FunctionType *funcType = NULL;
607  if (CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL &&
608  (funcType = CastType<FunctionType>(type->GetBaseType())) &&
609  (fse = dynamic_cast<FunctionSymbolExpr *>(expr)) != NULL) {
610  // We're initializing a function pointer with a function symbol,
611  // which in turn may represent an overloaded function. So we need
612  // to try to resolve the overload based on the type of the symbol
613  // we're initializing here.
614  std::vector<const Type *> paramTypes;
615  for (int i = 0; i < funcType->GetNumParameters(); ++i)
616  paramTypes.push_back(funcType->GetParameterType(i));
617 
618  if (fse->ResolveOverloads(expr->pos, paramTypes) == false)
619  return false;
620  }
621  return true;
622 }
623 
624 
625 
626 /** Utility routine that emits code to initialize a symbol given an
627  initializer expression.
628 
629  @param ptr Memory location of storage for the symbol's data
630  @param symName Name of symbol (used in error messages)
631  @param symType Type of variable being initialized
632  @param initExpr Expression for the initializer
633  @param ctx FunctionEmitContext to use for generating instructions
634  @param pos Source file position of the variable being initialized
635 */
636 void
637 InitSymbol(llvm::Value *ptr, const Type *symType, Expr *initExpr,
638  FunctionEmitContext *ctx, SourcePos pos) {
639  if (initExpr == NULL)
640  // leave it uninitialized
641  return;
642 
643  // See if we have a constant initializer a this point
644  llvm::Constant *constValue = initExpr->GetConstant(symType);
645  if (constValue != NULL) {
646  // It'd be nice if we could just do a StoreInst(constValue, ptr)
647  // at this point, but unfortunately that doesn't generate great
648  // code (e.g. a bunch of scalar moves for a constant array.) So
649  // instead we'll make a constant static global that holds the
650  // constant value and emit a memcpy to put its value into the
651  // pointer we have.
652  llvm::Type *llvmType = symType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
653  if (llvmType == NULL) {
654  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
655  return;
656  }
657 
658  if (Type::IsBasicType(symType))
659  ctx->StoreInst(constValue, ptr);
660  else {
661  llvm::Value *constPtr =
662  new llvm::GlobalVariable(*m->module, llvmType, true /* const */,
663  llvm::GlobalValue::InternalLinkage,
664  constValue, "const_initializer");
665  llvm::Value *size = g->target->SizeOf(llvmType,
666  ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
667  ctx->MemcpyInst(ptr, constPtr, size);
668  }
669 
670  return;
671  }
672 
673  // If the initializer is a straight up expression that isn't an
674  // ExprList, then we'll see if we can type convert it to the type of
675  // the variable.
676  if (dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(initExpr) == NULL) {
677  if (PossiblyResolveFunctionOverloads(initExpr, symType) == false)
678  return;
679  initExpr = TypeConvertExpr(initExpr, symType, "initializer");
680 
681  if (initExpr == NULL)
682  return;
683 
684  llvm::Value *initializerValue = initExpr->GetValue(ctx);
685  if (initializerValue != NULL)
686  // Bingo; store the value in the variable's storage
687  ctx->StoreInst(initializerValue, ptr);
688  return;
689  }
690 
691  // Atomic types and enums can be initialized with { ... } initializer
692  // expressions if they have a single element (except for SOA types,
693  // which are handled below).
694  if (symType->IsSOAType() == false && Type::IsBasicType(symType)) {
695  ExprList *elist = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(initExpr);
696  if (elist != NULL) {
697  if (elist->exprs.size() == 1)
698  InitSymbol(ptr, symType, elist->exprs[0], ctx, pos);
699  else
700  Error(initExpr->pos, "Expression list initializers with "
701  "multiple values can't be used with type \"%s\".",
702  symType->GetString().c_str());
703  }
704  return;
705  }
706 
707  const ReferenceType *rt = CastType<ReferenceType>(symType);
708  if (rt) {
709  if (!Type::Equal(initExpr->GetType(), rt)) {
710  Error(initExpr->pos, "Initializer for reference type \"%s\" must have same "
711  "reference type itself. \"%s\" is incompatible.",
712  rt->GetString().c_str(), initExpr->GetType()->GetString().c_str());
713  return;
714  }
715 
716  llvm::Value *initializerValue = initExpr->GetValue(ctx);
717  if (initializerValue)
718  ctx->StoreInst(initializerValue, ptr);
719  return;
720  }
721 
722  // Handle initiailizers for SOA types as well as for structs, arrays,
723  // and vectors.
724  const CollectionType *collectionType = CastType<CollectionType>(symType);
725  if (collectionType != NULL || symType->IsSOAType()) {
726  int nElements = collectionType ? collectionType->GetElementCount() :
727  symType->GetSOAWidth();
728 
729  std::string name;
730  if (CastType<StructType>(symType) != NULL)
731  name = "struct";
732  else if (CastType<ArrayType>(symType) != NULL)
733  name = "array";
734  else if (CastType<VectorType>(symType) != NULL)
735  name = "vector";
736  else if (symType->IsSOAType())
737  name = symType->GetVariability().GetString();
738  else
739  FATAL("Unexpected CollectionType in InitSymbol()");
740 
741  // There are two cases for initializing these types; either a
742  // single initializer may be provided (float foo[3] = 0;), in which
743  // case all of the elements are initialized to the given value, or
744  // an initializer list may be provided (float foo[3] = { 1,2,3 }),
745  // in which case the elements are initialized with the
746  // corresponding values.
747  ExprList *exprList = dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(initExpr);
748  if (exprList != NULL) {
749  // The { ... } case; make sure we have the no more expressions
750  // in the ExprList as we have struct members
751  int nInits = exprList->exprs.size();
752  if (nInits > nElements) {
753  Error(initExpr->pos, "Initializer for %s type \"%s\" requires "
754  "no more than %d values; %d provided.", name.c_str(),
755  symType->GetString().c_str(), nElements, nInits);
756  return;
757  }
758 
759  // Initialize each element with the corresponding value from
760  // the ExprList
761  for (int i = 0; i < nElements; ++i) {
762  // For SOA types, the element type is the uniform variant
763  // of the underlying type
764  const Type *elementType =
765  collectionType ? collectionType->GetElementType(i) :
766  symType->GetAsUniformType();
767  if (elementType == NULL) {
768  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
769  return;
770  }
771 
772  llvm::Value *ep;
773  if (CastType<StructType>(symType) != NULL)
774  ep = ctx->AddElementOffset(ptr, i, NULL, "element");
775  else
776  ep = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(ptr, LLVMInt32(0), LLVMInt32(i),
777  PointerType::GetUniform(elementType),
778  "gep");
779 
780  if (i < nInits)
781  InitSymbol(ep, elementType, exprList->exprs[i], ctx, pos);
782  else {
783  // If we don't have enough initializer values, initialize the
784  // rest as zero.
785  llvm::Type *llvmType = elementType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
786  if (llvmType == NULL) {
787  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
788  return;
789  }
790 
791  llvm::Constant *zeroInit = llvm::Constant::getNullValue(llvmType);
792  ctx->StoreInst(zeroInit, ep);
793  }
794  }
795  }
796  else
797  Error(initExpr->pos, "Can't assign type \"%s\" to \"%s\".",
798  initExpr->GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
799  collectionType->GetString().c_str());
800  return;
801  }
802 
803  FATAL("Unexpected Type in InitSymbol()");
804 }
805 
806 
807 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
808 
809 /** Given an atomic or vector type, this returns a boolean type with the
810  same "shape". In other words, if the given type is a vector type of
811  three uniform ints, the returned type is a vector type of three uniform
812  bools. */
813 static const Type *
814 lMatchingBoolType(const Type *type) {
815  bool uniformTest = type->IsUniformType();
816  const AtomicType *boolBase = uniformTest ? AtomicType::UniformBool :
817  AtomicType::VaryingBool;
818  const VectorType *vt = CastType<VectorType>(type);
819  if (vt != NULL)
820  return new VectorType(boolBase, vt->GetElementCount());
821  else {
822  Assert(Type::IsBasicType(type));
823  return boolBase;
824  }
825 }
826 
827 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
828 // UnaryExpr
829 
830 static llvm::Constant *
831 lLLVMConstantValue(const Type *type, llvm::LLVMContext *ctx, double value) {
832  const AtomicType *atomicType = CastType<AtomicType>(type);
833  const EnumType *enumType = CastType<EnumType>(type);
834  const VectorType *vectorType = CastType<VectorType>(type);
835  const PointerType *pointerType = CastType<PointerType>(type);
836 
837  // This function is only called with, and only works for atomic, enum,
838  // and vector types.
839  Assert(atomicType != NULL || enumType != NULL || vectorType != NULL ||
840  pointerType != NULL);
841 
842  if (atomicType != NULL || enumType != NULL) {
843  // If it's an atomic or enuemrator type, then figure out which of
844  // the llvmutil.h functions to call to get the corresponding
845  // constant and then call it...
846  bool isUniform = type->IsUniformType();
847  AtomicType::BasicType basicType = (enumType != NULL) ?
848  AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32 : atomicType->basicType;
849 
850  switch (basicType) {
851  case AtomicType::TYPE_VOID:
852  FATAL("can't get constant value for void type");
853  return NULL;
854  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
855  if (isUniform)
856  return (value != 0.) ? LLVMTrue : LLVMFalse;
857  else
858  return LLVMBoolVector(value != 0.);
859  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: {
860  int i = (int)value;
861  Assert((double)i == value);
862  return isUniform ? LLVMInt8(i) : LLVMInt8Vector(i);
863  }
864  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
865  unsigned int i = (unsigned int)value;
866  return isUniform ? LLVMUInt8(i) : LLVMUInt8Vector(i);
867  }
868  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: {
869  int i = (int)value;
870  Assert((double)i == value);
871  return isUniform ? LLVMInt16(i) : LLVMInt16Vector(i);
872  }
873  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
874  unsigned int i = (unsigned int)value;
875  return isUniform ? LLVMUInt16(i) : LLVMUInt16Vector(i);
876  }
877  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: {
878  int i = (int)value;
879  Assert((double)i == value);
880  return isUniform ? LLVMInt32(i) : LLVMInt32Vector(i);
881  }
882  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
883  unsigned int i = (unsigned int)value;
884  return isUniform ? LLVMUInt32(i) : LLVMUInt32Vector(i);
885  }
886  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
887  return isUniform ? LLVMFloat((float)value) :
888  LLVMFloatVector((float)value);
889  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
890  uint64_t i = (uint64_t)value;
891  Assert(value == (int64_t)i);
892  return isUniform ? LLVMUInt64(i) : LLVMUInt64Vector(i);
893  }
894  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: {
895  int64_t i = (int64_t)value;
896  Assert((double)i == value);
897  return isUniform ? LLVMInt64(i) : LLVMInt64Vector(i);
898  }
899  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
900  return isUniform ? LLVMDouble(value) : LLVMDoubleVector(value);
901  default:
902  FATAL("logic error in lLLVMConstantValue");
903  return NULL;
904  }
905  }
906  else if (pointerType != NULL) {
907  Assert(value == 0);
908  if (pointerType->IsUniformType())
909  return llvm::Constant::getNullValue(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
910  else
911  return llvm::Constant::getNullValue(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerVectorType);
912  }
913  else {
914  // For vector types, first get the LLVM constant for the basetype with
915  // a recursive call to lLLVMConstantValue().
916  const Type *baseType = vectorType->GetBaseType();
917  llvm::Constant *constElement = lLLVMConstantValue(baseType, ctx, value);
918  llvm::Type *llvmVectorType = vectorType->LLVMType(ctx);
919 
920  // Now create a constant version of the corresponding LLVM type that we
921  // use to represent the VectorType.
922  // FIXME: this is a little ugly in that the fact that ispc represents
923  // uniform VectorTypes as LLVM VectorTypes and varying VectorTypes as
924  // LLVM ArrayTypes leaks into the code here; it feels like this detail
925  // should be better encapsulated?
926  if (baseType->IsUniformType()) {
927  llvm::VectorType *lvt =
928  llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::VectorType>(llvmVectorType);
929  Assert(lvt != NULL);
930  std::vector<llvm::Constant *> vals;
931  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < lvt->getNumElements(); ++i)
932  vals.push_back(constElement);
933  return llvm::ConstantVector::get(vals);
934  }
935  else {
936  llvm::ArrayType *lat =
937  llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ArrayType>(llvmVectorType);
938  Assert(lat != NULL);
939  std::vector<llvm::Constant *> vals;
940  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < lat->getNumElements(); ++i)
941  vals.push_back(constElement);
942  return llvm::ConstantArray::get(lat, vals);
943  }
944  }
945 }
946 
947 
948 static llvm::Value *
949 lMaskForSymbol(Symbol *baseSym, FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
950  if (baseSym == NULL)
951  return ctx->GetFullMask();
952 
953  if (CastType<PointerType>(baseSym->type) != NULL ||
954  CastType<ReferenceType>(baseSym->type) != NULL)
955  // FIXME: for pointers, we really only want to do this for
956  // dereferencing the pointer, not for things like pointer
957  // arithmetic, when we may be able to use the internal mask,
958  // depending on context...
959  return ctx->GetFullMask();
960 
961  llvm::Value *mask = (baseSym->parentFunction == ctx->GetFunction() &&
962  baseSym->storageClass != SC_STATIC) ?
963  ctx->GetInternalMask() : ctx->GetFullMask();
964  return mask;
965 }
966 
967 
968 /** Store the result of an assignment to the given location.
969  */
970 static void
971 lStoreAssignResult(llvm::Value *value, llvm::Value *ptr, const Type *valueType,
972  const Type *ptrType, FunctionEmitContext *ctx,
973  Symbol *baseSym) {
974  Assert(baseSym == NULL ||
975  baseSym->varyingCFDepth <= ctx->VaryingCFDepth());
976  if (!g->opt.disableMaskedStoreToStore &&
977  !g->opt.disableMaskAllOnOptimizations &&
978  baseSym != NULL &&
979  baseSym->varyingCFDepth == ctx->VaryingCFDepth() &&
980  baseSym->storageClass != SC_STATIC &&
981  CastType<ReferenceType>(baseSym->type) == NULL &&
982  CastType<PointerType>(baseSym->type) == NULL) {
983  // If the variable is declared at the same varying control flow
984  // depth as where it's being assigned, then we don't need to do any
985  // masking but can just do the assignment as if all the lanes were
986  // known to be on. While this may lead to random/garbage values
987  // written into the lanes that are off, by definition they will
988  // never be accessed, since those lanes aren't executing, and won't
989  // be executing at this scope or any other one before the variable
990  // goes out of scope.
991  ctx->StoreInst(value, ptr, LLVMMaskAllOn, valueType, ptrType);
992  }
993  else {
994  ctx->StoreInst(value, ptr, lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx), valueType, ptrType);
995  }
996 }
997 
998 
999 /** Utility routine to emit code to do a {pre,post}-{inc,dec}rement of the
1000  given expresion.
1001  */
1002 static llvm::Value *
1003 lEmitPrePostIncDec(UnaryExpr::Op op, Expr *expr, SourcePos pos,
1004  FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
1005  const Type *type = expr->GetType();
1006  if (type == NULL)
1007  return NULL;
1008 
1009  // Get both the lvalue and the rvalue of the given expression
1010  llvm::Value *lvalue = NULL, *rvalue = NULL;
1011  const Type *lvalueType = NULL;
1012  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(type) != NULL) {
1013  lvalueType = type;
1014  type = type->GetReferenceTarget();
1015  lvalue = expr->GetValue(ctx);
1016 
1017  Expr *deref = new RefDerefExpr(expr, expr->pos);
1018  rvalue = deref->GetValue(ctx);
1019  }
1020  else {
1021  lvalue = expr->GetLValue(ctx);
1022  lvalueType = expr->GetLValueType();
1023  rvalue = expr->GetValue(ctx);
1024  }
1025 
1026  if (lvalue == NULL) {
1027  // If we can't get a lvalue, then we have an error here
1028  const char *prepost = (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc ||
1029  op == UnaryExpr::PreDec) ? "pre" : "post";
1030  const char *incdec = (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc ||
1031  op == UnaryExpr::PostInc) ? "increment" : "decrement";
1032  Error(pos, "Can't %s-%s non-lvalues.", prepost, incdec);
1033  return NULL;
1034  }
1035 
1036  // Emit code to do the appropriate addition/subtraction to the
1037  // expression's old value
1038  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
1039  llvm::Value *binop = NULL;
1040  int delta = (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc || op == UnaryExpr::PostInc) ? 1 : -1;
1041 
1042  std::string opName = rvalue->getName().str();
1043  if (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc || op == UnaryExpr::PostInc)
1044  opName += "_plus1";
1045  else
1046  opName += "_minus1";
1047 
1048  if (CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL) {
1049  const Type *incType = type->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformInt32 :
1050  AtomicType::VaryingInt32;
1051  llvm::Constant *dval = lLLVMConstantValue(incType, g->ctx, delta);
1052  binop = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(rvalue, dval, type, opName.c_str());
1053  }
1054  else {
1055  llvm::Constant *dval = lLLVMConstantValue(type, g->ctx, delta);
1056  if (type->IsFloatType())
1057  binop = ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::FAdd, rvalue,
1058  dval, opName.c_str());
1059  else
1060  binop = ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Add, rvalue,
1061  dval, opName.c_str());
1062  }
1063 
1064  // And store the result out to the lvalue
1065  Symbol *baseSym = expr->GetBaseSymbol();
1066  lStoreAssignResult(binop, lvalue, type, lvalueType, ctx, baseSym);
1067 
1068  // And then if it's a pre increment/decrement, return the final
1069  // computed result; otherwise return the previously-grabbed expression
1070  // value.
1071  return (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc || op == UnaryExpr::PreDec) ? binop : rvalue;
1072 }
1073 
1074 
1075 
1076 /** Utility routine to emit code to negate the given expression.
1077  */
1078 static llvm::Value *
1079 lEmitNegate(Expr *arg, SourcePos pos, FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
1080  const Type *type = arg->GetType();
1081  llvm::Value *argVal = arg->GetValue(ctx);
1082  if (type == NULL || argVal == NULL)
1083  return NULL;
1084 
1085  // Negate by subtracting from zero...
1086  llvm::Value *zero = lLLVMConstantValue(type, g->ctx, 0.);
1087  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
1088  if (type->IsFloatType())
1089  return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::FSub, zero, argVal,
1090  LLVMGetName(argVal, "_negate"));
1091  else {
1092  AssertPos(pos, type->IsIntType());
1093  return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Sub, zero, argVal,
1094  LLVMGetName(argVal, "_negate"));
1095  }
1096 }
1097 
1098 
1099 UnaryExpr::UnaryExpr(Op o, Expr *e, SourcePos p)
1100  : Expr(p), op(o) {
1101  expr = e;
1102 }
1103 
1104 
1105 llvm::Value *
1106 UnaryExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
1107  if (expr == NULL)
1108  return NULL;
1109 
1110  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
1111 
1112  switch (op) {
1113  case PreInc:
1114  case PreDec:
1115  case PostInc:
1116  case PostDec:
1117  return lEmitPrePostIncDec(op, expr, pos, ctx);
1118  case Negate:
1119  return lEmitNegate(expr, pos, ctx);
1120  case LogicalNot: {
1121  llvm::Value *argVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
1122  return ctx->NotOperator(argVal, LLVMGetName(argVal, "_logicalnot"));
1123  }
1124  case BitNot: {
1125  llvm::Value *argVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
1126  return ctx->NotOperator(argVal, LLVMGetName(argVal, "_bitnot"));
1127  }
1128  default:
1129  FATAL("logic error");
1130  return NULL;
1131  }
1132 }
1133 
1134 
1135 const Type *
1136 UnaryExpr::GetType() const {
1137  if (expr == NULL)
1138  return NULL;
1139 
1140  const Type *type = expr->GetType();
1141  if (type == NULL)
1142  return NULL;
1143 
1144  // For all unary expressions besides logical not, the returned type is
1145  // the same as the source type. Logical not always returns a bool
1146  // type, with the same shape as the input type.
1147  switch (op) {
1148  case PreInc:
1149  case PreDec:
1150  case PostInc:
1151  case PostDec:
1152  case Negate:
1153  case BitNot:
1154  return type;
1155  case LogicalNot:
1156  return lMatchingBoolType(type);
1157  default:
1158  FATAL("error");
1159  return NULL;
1160  }
1161 }
1162 
1163 
1164 Expr *
1165 UnaryExpr::Optimize() {
1166  ConstExpr *constExpr = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr);
1167  // If the operand isn't a constant, then we can't do any optimization
1168  // here...
1169  if (constExpr == NULL)
1170  return this;
1171 
1172  const Type *type = constExpr->GetType();
1173  bool isEnumType = CastType<EnumType>(type) != NULL;
1174 
1175  const Type *baseType = type->GetAsNonConstType()->GetAsUniformType();
1176  if (Type::Equal(baseType, AtomicType::UniformInt8) ||
1177  Type::Equal(baseType, AtomicType::UniformUInt8) ||
1178  Type::Equal(baseType, AtomicType::UniformInt16) ||
1179  Type::Equal(baseType, AtomicType::UniformUInt16) ||
1180  Type::Equal(baseType, AtomicType::UniformInt64) ||
1181  Type::Equal(baseType, AtomicType::UniformUInt64))
1182  // FIXME: should handle these at some point; for now we only do
1183  // constant folding for bool, int32 and float types...
1184  return this;
1185 
1186  switch (op) {
1187  case PreInc:
1188  case PreDec:
1189  case PostInc:
1190  case PostDec:
1191  // this shouldn't happen--it's illegal to modify a contant value..
1192  // An error will be issued elsewhere...
1193  return this;
1194  case Negate: {
1195  // Since we currently only handle int32, floats, and doubles here,
1196  // it's safe to stuff whatever we have into a double, do the negate
1197  // as a double, and then return a ConstExpr with the same type as
1198  // the original...
1199  double v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
1200  int count = constExpr->AsDouble(v);
1201  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
1202  v[i] = -v[i];
1203  return new ConstExpr(constExpr, v);
1204  }
1205  case BitNot: {
1206  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::UniformInt32) ||
1207  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt32)) {
1208  int32_t v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
1209  int count = constExpr->AsInt32(v);
1210  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
1211  v[i] = ~v[i];
1212  return new ConstExpr(type, v, pos);
1213  }
1214  else if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt32) ||
1215  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt32) ||
1216  isEnumType == true) {
1217  uint32_t v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
1218  int count = constExpr->AsUInt32(v);
1219  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
1220  v[i] = ~v[i];
1221  return new ConstExpr(type, v, pos);
1222  }
1223  else
1224  FATAL("unexpected type in UnaryExpr::Optimize() / BitNot case");
1225  }
1226  case LogicalNot: {
1227  AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::UniformBool) ||
1228  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, AtomicType::VaryingBool));
1229  bool v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
1230  int count = constExpr->AsBool(v);
1231  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
1232  v[i] = !v[i];
1233  return new ConstExpr(type, v, pos);
1234  }
1235  default:
1236  FATAL("unexpected op in UnaryExpr::Optimize()");
1237  return NULL;
1238  }
1239 }
1240 
1241 
1242 Expr *
1243 UnaryExpr::TypeCheck() {
1244  const Type *type;
1245  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL)
1246  // something went wrong in type checking...
1247  return NULL;
1248 
1249  if (type->IsSOAType()) {
1250  Error(pos, "Can't apply unary operator to SOA type \"%s\".",
1251  type->GetString().c_str());
1252  return NULL;
1253  }
1254 
1255  if (op == PreInc || op == PreDec || op == PostInc || op == PostDec) {
1256  if (type->IsConstType()) {
1257  Error(pos, "Can't assign to type \"%s\" on left-hand side of "
1258  "expression.", type->GetString().c_str());
1259  return NULL;
1260  }
1261 
1262  if (type->IsNumericType())
1263  return this;
1264 
1265  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
1266  if (pt == NULL) {
1267  Error(expr->pos, "Can only pre/post increment numeric and "
1268  "pointer types, not \"%s\".", type->GetString().c_str());
1269  return NULL;
1270  }
1271 
1272  if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(type)) {
1273  Error(expr->pos, "Illegal to pre/post increment \"%s\" type.",
1274  type->GetString().c_str());
1275  return NULL;
1276  }
1277  if (CastType<UndefinedStructType>(pt->GetBaseType())) {
1278  Error(expr->pos, "Illegal to pre/post increment pointer to "
1279  "undefined struct type \"%s\".", type->GetString().c_str());
1280  return NULL;
1281  }
1282 
1283  return this;
1284  }
1285 
1286  // don't do this for pre/post increment/decrement
1287  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(type)) {
1288  expr = new RefDerefExpr(expr, pos);
1289  type = expr->GetType();
1290  }
1291 
1292  if (op == Negate) {
1293  if (!type->IsNumericType()) {
1294  Error(expr->pos, "Negate not allowed for non-numeric type \"%s\".",
1295  type->GetString().c_str());
1296  return NULL;
1297  }
1298  }
1299  else if (op == LogicalNot) {
1300  const Type *boolType = lMatchingBoolType(type);
1301  expr = TypeConvertExpr(expr, boolType, "logical not");
1302  if (expr == NULL)
1303  return NULL;
1304  }
1305  else if (op == BitNot) {
1306  if (!type->IsIntType()) {
1307  Error(expr->pos, "~ operator can only be used with integer types, "
1308  "not \"%s\".", type->GetString().c_str());
1309  return NULL;
1310  }
1311  }
1312  return this;
1313 }
1314 
1315 
1316 int
1317 UnaryExpr::EstimateCost() const {
1318  if (dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr) != NULL)
1319  return 0;
1320 
1321  return COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
1322 }
1323 
1324 
1325 void
1326 UnaryExpr::Print() const {
1327  if (!expr || !GetType())
1328  return;
1329 
1330  printf("[ %s ] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
1331  if (op == PreInc) printf("++");
1332  if (op == PreDec) printf("--");
1333  if (op == Negate) printf("-");
1334  if (op == LogicalNot) printf("!");
1335  if (op == BitNot) printf("~");
1336  printf("(");
1337  expr->Print();
1338  printf(")");
1339  if (op == PostInc) printf("++");
1340  if (op == PostDec) printf("--");
1341  printf(")");
1342  pos.Print();
1343 }
1344 
1345 
1346 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
1347 // BinaryExpr
1348 
1349 static const char *
1350 lOpString(BinaryExpr::Op op) {
1351  switch (op) {
1352  case BinaryExpr::Add: return "+";
1353  case BinaryExpr::Sub: return "-";
1354  case BinaryExpr::Mul: return "*";
1355  case BinaryExpr::Div: return "/";
1356  case BinaryExpr::Mod: return "%";
1357  case BinaryExpr::Shl: return "<<";
1358  case BinaryExpr::Shr: return ">>";
1359  case BinaryExpr::Lt: return "<";
1360  case BinaryExpr::Gt: return ">";
1361  case BinaryExpr::Le: return "<=";
1362  case BinaryExpr::Ge: return ">=";
1363  case BinaryExpr::Equal: return "==";
1364  case BinaryExpr::NotEqual: return "!=";
1365  case BinaryExpr::BitAnd: return "&";
1366  case BinaryExpr::BitXor: return "^";
1367  case BinaryExpr::BitOr: return "|";
1368  case BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd: return "&&";
1369  case BinaryExpr::LogicalOr: return "||";
1370  case BinaryExpr::Comma: return ",";
1371  default:
1372  FATAL("unimplemented case in lOpString()");
1373  return "";
1374  }
1375 }
1376 
1377 
1378 /** Utility routine to emit the binary bitwise operator corresponding to
1379  the given BinaryExpr::Op.
1380 */
1381 static llvm::Value *
1382 lEmitBinaryBitOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, llvm::Value *arg0Val,
1383  llvm::Value *arg1Val, bool isUnsigned,
1384  FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
1385  llvm::Instruction::BinaryOps inst;
1386  switch (op) {
1387  case BinaryExpr::Shl: inst = llvm::Instruction::Shl; break;
1388  case BinaryExpr::Shr:
1389  if (isUnsigned)
1390  inst = llvm::Instruction::LShr;
1391  else
1392  inst = llvm::Instruction::AShr;
1393  break;
1394  case BinaryExpr::BitAnd: inst = llvm::Instruction::And; break;
1395  case BinaryExpr::BitXor: inst = llvm::Instruction::Xor; break;
1396  case BinaryExpr::BitOr: inst = llvm::Instruction::Or; break;
1397  default:
1398  FATAL("logic error in lEmitBinaryBitOp()");
1399  return NULL;
1400  }
1401 
1402  return ctx->BinaryOperator(inst, arg0Val, arg1Val, "bitop");
1403 }
1404 
1405 
1406 static llvm::Value *
1407 lEmitBinaryPointerArith(BinaryExpr::Op op, llvm::Value *value0,
1408  llvm::Value *value1, const Type *type0,
1409  const Type *type1, FunctionEmitContext *ctx,
1410  SourcePos pos) {
1411  const PointerType *ptrType = CastType<PointerType>(type0);
1412 
1413  switch (op) {
1414  case BinaryExpr::Add:
1415  // ptr + integer
1416  return ctx->GetElementPtrInst(value0, value1, ptrType, "ptrmath");
1417  break;
1418  case BinaryExpr::Sub: {
1419  if (CastType<PointerType>(type1) != NULL) {
1420  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type0, type1));
1421 
1422  if (ptrType->IsSlice()) {
1423  llvm::Value *p0 = ctx->ExtractInst(value0, 0);
1424  llvm::Value *p1 = ctx->ExtractInst(value1, 0);
1425  const Type *majorType = ptrType->GetAsNonSlice();
1426  llvm::Value *majorDelta =
1427  lEmitBinaryPointerArith(op, p0, p1, majorType, majorType,
1428  ctx, pos);
1429 
1430  int soaWidth = ptrType->GetBaseType()->GetSOAWidth();
1431  AssertPos(pos, soaWidth > 0);
1432  llvm::Value *soaScale = LLVMIntAsType(soaWidth,
1433  majorDelta->getType());
1434 
1435  llvm::Value *majorScale =
1436  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Mul, majorDelta,
1437  soaScale, "major_soa_scaled");
1438 
1439  llvm::Value *m0 = ctx->ExtractInst(value0, 1);
1440  llvm::Value *m1 = ctx->ExtractInst(value1, 1);
1441  llvm::Value *minorDelta =
1442  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Sub, m0, m1,
1443  "minor_soa_delta");
1444 
1445  ctx->MatchIntegerTypes(&majorScale, &minorDelta);
1446  return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Add, majorScale,
1447  minorDelta, "soa_ptrdiff");
1448  }
1449 
1450  // ptr - ptr
1451  if (ptrType->IsUniformType()) {
1452  value0 = ctx->PtrToIntInst(value0);
1453  value1 = ctx->PtrToIntInst(value1);
1454  }
1455 
1456  // Compute the difference in bytes
1457  llvm::Value *delta =
1458  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Sub, value0, value1,
1459  "ptr_diff");
1460 
1461  // Now divide by the size of the type that the pointer
1462  // points to in order to return the difference in elements.
1463  llvm::Type *llvmElementType =
1464  ptrType->GetBaseType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
1465  llvm::Value *size = g->target->SizeOf(llvmElementType,
1466  ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
1467  if (ptrType->IsVaryingType())
1468  size = ctx->SmearUniform(size);
1469 
1470  if (g->target->is32Bit() == false &&
1471  g->opt.force32BitAddressing == true) {
1472  // If we're doing 32-bit addressing math on a 64-bit
1473  // target, then trunc the delta down to a 32-bit value.
1474  // (Thus also matching what will be a 32-bit value
1475  // returned from SizeOf above.)
1476  if (ptrType->IsUniformType())
1477  delta = ctx->TruncInst(delta, LLVMTypes::Int32Type,
1478  "trunc_ptr_delta");
1479  else
1480  delta = ctx->TruncInst(delta, LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType,
1481  "trunc_ptr_delta");
1482  }
1483 
1484  // And now do the actual division
1485  return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::SDiv, delta, size,
1486  "element_diff");
1487  }
1488  else {
1489  // ptr - integer
1490  llvm::Value *zero = lLLVMConstantValue(type1, g->ctx, 0.);
1491  llvm::Value *negOffset =
1492  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Sub, zero, value1,
1493  "negate");
1494  // Do a GEP as ptr + -integer
1495  return ctx->GetElementPtrInst(value0, negOffset, ptrType,
1496  "ptrmath");
1497  }
1498  }
1499  default:
1500  FATAL("Logic error in lEmitBinaryArith() for pointer type case");
1501  return NULL;
1502  }
1503 
1504 }
1505 
1506 /** Utility routine to emit binary arithmetic operator based on the given
1507  BinaryExpr::Op.
1508 */
1509 static llvm::Value *
1510 lEmitBinaryArith(BinaryExpr::Op op, llvm::Value *value0, llvm::Value *value1,
1511  const Type *type0, const Type *type1,
1512  FunctionEmitContext *ctx, SourcePos pos) {
1513  const PointerType *ptrType = CastType<PointerType>(type0);
1514 
1515  if (ptrType != NULL)
1516  return lEmitBinaryPointerArith(op, value0, value1, type0, type1,
1517  ctx, pos);
1518  else {
1519  AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type0, type1));
1520 
1521  llvm::Instruction::BinaryOps inst;
1522  bool isFloatOp = type0->IsFloatType();
1523  bool isUnsignedOp = type0->IsUnsignedType();
1524 
1525  const char *opName = NULL;
1526  switch (op) {
1527  case BinaryExpr::Add:
1528  opName = "add";
1529  inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FAdd : llvm::Instruction::Add;
1530  break;
1531  case BinaryExpr::Sub:
1532  opName = "sub";
1533  inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FSub : llvm::Instruction::Sub;
1534  break;
1535  case BinaryExpr::Mul:
1536  opName = "mul";
1537  inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FMul : llvm::Instruction::Mul;
1538  break;
1539  case BinaryExpr::Div:
1540  opName = "div";
1541  if (type0->IsVaryingType() && !isFloatOp)
1542  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Division with varying integer types is "
1543  "very inefficient.");
1544  inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FDiv :
1545  (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::Instruction::UDiv : llvm::Instruction::SDiv);
1546  break;
1547  case BinaryExpr::Mod:
1548  opName = "mod";
1549  if (type0->IsVaryingType() && !isFloatOp)
1550  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Modulus operator with varying types is "
1551  "very inefficient.");
1552  inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FRem :
1553  (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::Instruction::URem : llvm::Instruction::SRem);
1554  break;
1555  default:
1556  FATAL("Invalid op type passed to lEmitBinaryArith()");
1557  return NULL;
1558  }
1559 
1560  return ctx->BinaryOperator(inst, value0, value1, LLVMGetName(opName, value0, value1));
1561  }
1562 }
1563 
1564 
1565 /** Utility routine to emit a binary comparison operator based on the given
1566  BinaryExpr::Op.
1567  */
1568 static llvm::Value *
1569 lEmitBinaryCmp(BinaryExpr::Op op, llvm::Value *e0Val, llvm::Value *e1Val,
1570  const Type *type, FunctionEmitContext *ctx, SourcePos pos) {
1571  bool isFloatOp = type->IsFloatType();
1572  bool isUnsignedOp = type->IsUnsignedType();
1573 
1574  llvm::CmpInst::Predicate pred;
1575  const char *opName = NULL;
1576  switch (op) {
1577  case BinaryExpr::Lt:
1578  opName = "less";
1579  pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ULT :
1580  (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_ULT : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_SLT);
1581  break;
1582  case BinaryExpr::Gt:
1583  opName = "greater";
1584  pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_UGT :
1585  (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_UGT : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_SGT);
1586  break;
1587  case BinaryExpr::Le:
1588  opName = "lessequal";
1589  pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ULE :
1590  (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_ULE : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_SLE);
1591  break;
1592  case BinaryExpr::Ge:
1593  opName = "greaterequal";
1594  pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_UGE :
1595  (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_UGE : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_SGE);
1596  break;
1597  case BinaryExpr::Equal:
1598  opName = "equal";
1599  pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_UEQ : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_EQ;
1600  break;
1601  case BinaryExpr::NotEqual:
1602  opName = "notequal";
1603  pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_UNE : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE;
1604  break;
1605  default:
1606  FATAL("error in lEmitBinaryCmp()");
1607  return NULL;
1608  }
1609 
1610  llvm::Value *cmp = ctx->CmpInst(isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FCmp :
1611  llvm::Instruction::ICmp,
1612  pred, e0Val, e1Val,
1613  LLVMGetName(opName, e0Val, e1Val));
1614  // This is a little ugly: CmpInst returns i1 values, but we use vectors
1615  // of i32s for varying bool values; type convert the result here if
1616  // needed.
1617  if (type->IsVaryingType())
1618  cmp = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(cmp);
1619 
1620  return cmp;
1621 }
1622 
1623 
1624 BinaryExpr::BinaryExpr(Op o, Expr *a, Expr *b, SourcePos p)
1625  : Expr(p), op(o) {
1626  arg0 = a;
1627  arg1 = b;
1628 }
1629 
1630 
1631 /** Emit code for a && or || logical operator. In particular, the code
1632  here handles "short-circuit" evaluation, where the second expression
1633  isn't evaluated if the value of the first one determines the value of
1634  the result.
1635 */
1636 llvm::Value *
1637 lEmitLogicalOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, Expr *arg0, Expr *arg1,
1638  FunctionEmitContext *ctx, SourcePos pos) {
1639 
1640  const Type *type0 = arg0->GetType(), *type1 = arg1->GetType();
1641  if (type0 == NULL || type1 == NULL) {
1642  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
1643  return NULL;
1644  }
1645 
1646  // There is overhead (branches, etc.), to short-circuiting, so if the
1647  // right side of the expression is a) relatively simple, and b) can be
1648  // safely executed with an all-off execution mask, then we just
1649  // evaluate both sides and then the logical operator in that case.
1650  // FIXME: not sure what we should do about vector types here...
1651  bool shortCircuit = (EstimateCost(arg1) > PREDICATE_SAFE_IF_STATEMENT_COST ||
1652  SafeToRunWithMaskAllOff(arg1) == false ||
1653  CastType<VectorType>(type0) != NULL ||
1654  CastType<VectorType>(type1) != NULL);
1655  if (shortCircuit == false) {
1656  // If one of the operands is uniform but the other is varying,
1657  // promote the uniform one to varying
1658  if (type0->IsUniformType() && type1->IsVaryingType()) {
1659  arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, AtomicType::VaryingBool, lOpString(op));
1660  AssertPos(pos, arg0 != NULL);
1661  }
1662  if (type1->IsUniformType() && type0->IsVaryingType()) {
1663  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, AtomicType::VaryingBool, lOpString(op));
1664  AssertPos(pos, arg1 != NULL);
1665  }
1666 
1667  llvm::Value *value0 = arg0->GetValue(ctx);
1668  llvm::Value *value1 = arg1->GetValue(ctx);
1669  if (value0 == NULL || value1 == NULL) {
1670  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
1671  return NULL;
1672  }
1673 
1674  if (op == BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd)
1675  return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, value0, value1,
1676  "logical_and");
1677  else {
1678  AssertPos(pos, op == BinaryExpr::LogicalOr);
1679  return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or, value0, value1,
1680  "logical_or");
1681  }
1682  }
1683 
1684  // Allocate temporary storage for the return value
1685  const Type *retType = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, pos, lOpString(op));
1686  llvm::Type *llvmRetType = retType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
1687  llvm::Value *retPtr = ctx->AllocaInst(llvmRetType, "logical_op_mem");
1688 
1689  llvm::BasicBlock *bbSkipEvalValue1 = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("skip_eval_1");
1690  llvm::BasicBlock *bbEvalValue1 = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("eval_1");
1691  llvm::BasicBlock *bbLogicalDone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("logical_op_done");
1692 
1693  // Evaluate the first operand
1694  llvm::Value *value0 = arg0->GetValue(ctx);
1695  if (value0 == NULL) {
1696  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
1697  return NULL;
1698  }
1699 
1700  if (type0->IsUniformType()) {
1701  // Check to see if the value of the first operand is true or false
1702  llvm::Value *value0True =
1703  ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_EQ,
1704  value0, LLVMTrue);
1705 
1706  if (op == BinaryExpr::LogicalOr) {
1707  // For ||, if value0 is true, then we skip evaluating value1
1708  // entirely.
1709  ctx->BranchInst(bbSkipEvalValue1, bbEvalValue1, value0True);
1710 
1711  // If value0 is true, the complete result is true (either
1712  // uniform or varying)
1713  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbSkipEvalValue1);
1714  llvm::Value *trueValue = retType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTrue :
1715  LLVMMaskAllOn;
1716  ctx->StoreInst(trueValue, retPtr);
1717  ctx->BranchInst(bbLogicalDone);
1718  }
1719  else {
1720  AssertPos(pos, op == BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd);
1721 
1722  // Conversely, for &&, if value0 is false, we skip evaluating
1723  // value1.
1724  ctx->BranchInst(bbEvalValue1, bbSkipEvalValue1, value0True);
1725 
1726  // In this case, the complete result is false (again, either a
1727  // uniform or varying false).
1728  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbSkipEvalValue1);
1729  llvm::Value *falseValue = retType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMFalse :
1730  LLVMMaskAllOff;
1731  ctx->StoreInst(falseValue, retPtr);
1732  ctx->BranchInst(bbLogicalDone);
1733  }
1734 
1735  // Both || and && are in the same situation if the first operand's
1736  // value didn't resolve the final result: they need to evaluate the
1737  // value of the second operand, which in turn gives the value for
1738  // the full expression.
1739  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbEvalValue1);
1740  if (type1->IsUniformType() && retType->IsVaryingType()) {
1741  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, AtomicType::VaryingBool, "logical op");
1742  AssertPos(pos, arg1 != NULL);
1743  }
1744 
1745  llvm::Value *value1 = arg1->GetValue(ctx);
1746  if (value1 == NULL) {
1747  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
1748  return NULL;
1749  }
1750  ctx->StoreInst(value1, retPtr);
1751  ctx->BranchInst(bbLogicalDone);
1752 
1753  // In all cases, we end up at the bbLogicalDone basic block;
1754  // loading the value stored in retPtr in turn gives the overall
1755  // result.
1756  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbLogicalDone);
1757  return ctx->LoadInst(retPtr);
1758  }
1759  else {
1760  // Otherwise, the first operand is varying... Save the current
1761  // value of the mask so that we can restore it at the end.
1762  llvm::Value *oldMask = ctx->GetInternalMask();
1763  llvm::Value *oldFullMask = ctx->GetFullMask();
1764 
1765  // Convert the second operand to be varying as well, so that we can
1766  // perform logical vector ops with its value.
1767  if (type1->IsUniformType()) {
1768  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, AtomicType::VaryingBool, "logical op");
1769  AssertPos(pos, arg1 != NULL);
1770  type1 = arg1->GetType();
1771  }
1772 
1773  if (op == BinaryExpr::LogicalOr) {
1774  // See if value0 is true for all currently executing
1775  // lanes--i.e. if (value0 & mask) == mask. If so, we don't
1776  // need to evaluate the second operand of the expression.
1777  llvm::Value *value0AndMask =
1778  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, value0,
1779  oldFullMask, "op&mask");
1780  llvm::Value *equalsMask =
1781  ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_EQ,
1782  value0AndMask, oldFullMask, "value0&mask==mask");
1783  equalsMask = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(equalsMask);
1784  llvm::Value *allMatch = ctx->All(equalsMask);
1785  ctx->BranchInst(bbSkipEvalValue1, bbEvalValue1, allMatch);
1786 
1787  // value0 is true for all running lanes, so it can be used for
1788  // the final result
1789  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbSkipEvalValue1);
1790  ctx->StoreInst(value0, retPtr);
1791  ctx->BranchInst(bbLogicalDone);
1792 
1793  // Otherwise, we need to valuate arg1. However, first we need
1794  // to set the execution mask to be (oldMask & ~a); in other
1795  // words, only execute the instances where value0 is false.
1796  // For the instances where value0 was true, we need to inhibit
1797  // execution.
1798  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbEvalValue1);
1799  ctx->SetInternalMaskAndNot(oldMask, value0);
1800 
1801  llvm::Value *value1 = arg1->GetValue(ctx);
1802  if (value1 == NULL) {
1803  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
1804  return NULL;
1805  }
1806 
1807  // We need to compute the result carefully, since vector
1808  // elements that were computed when the corresponding lane was
1809  // disabled have undefined values:
1810  // result = (value0 & old_mask) | (value1 & current_mask)
1811  llvm::Value *value1AndMask =
1812  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, value1,
1813  ctx->GetInternalMask(), "op&mask");
1814  llvm::Value *result =
1815  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or, value0AndMask,
1816  value1AndMask, "or_result");
1817  ctx->StoreInst(result, retPtr);
1818  ctx->BranchInst(bbLogicalDone);
1819  }
1820  else {
1821  AssertPos(pos, op == BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd);
1822 
1823  // If value0 is false for all currently running lanes, the
1824  // overall result must be false: this corresponds to checking
1825  // if (mask & ~value0) == mask.
1826  llvm::Value *notValue0 = ctx->NotOperator(value0, "not_value0");
1827  llvm::Value *notValue0AndMask =
1828  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, notValue0,
1829  oldFullMask, "not_value0&mask");
1830  llvm::Value *equalsMask =
1831  ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_EQ,
1832  notValue0AndMask, oldFullMask, "not_value0&mask==mask");
1833  equalsMask = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(equalsMask);
1834  llvm::Value *allMatch = ctx->All(equalsMask);
1835  ctx->BranchInst(bbSkipEvalValue1, bbEvalValue1, allMatch);
1836 
1837  // value0 was false for all running lanes, so use its value as
1838  // the overall result.
1839  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbSkipEvalValue1);
1840  ctx->StoreInst(value0, retPtr);
1841  ctx->BranchInst(bbLogicalDone);
1842 
1843  // Otherwise we need to evaluate value1, but again with the
1844  // mask set to only be on for the lanes where value0 was true.
1845  // For the lanes where value0 was false, execution needs to be
1846  // disabled: mask = (mask & value0).
1847  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbEvalValue1);
1848  ctx->SetInternalMaskAnd(oldMask, value0);
1849 
1850  llvm::Value *value1 = arg1->GetValue(ctx);
1851  if (value1 == NULL) {
1852  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
1853  return NULL;
1854  }
1855 
1856  // And as in the || case, we compute the overall result by
1857  // masking off the valid lanes before we AND them together:
1858  // result = (value0 & old_mask) & (value1 & current_mask)
1859  llvm::Value *value0AndMask =
1860  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, value0,
1861  oldFullMask, "op&mask");
1862  llvm::Value *value1AndMask =
1863  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, value1,
1864  ctx->GetInternalMask(), "value1&mask");
1865  llvm::Value *result =
1866  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, value0AndMask,
1867  value1AndMask, "or_result");
1868  ctx->StoreInst(result, retPtr);
1869  ctx->BranchInst(bbLogicalDone);
1870  }
1871 
1872  // And finally we always end up in bbLogicalDone, where we restore
1873  // the old mask and return the computed result
1874  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbLogicalDone);
1875  ctx->SetInternalMask(oldMask);
1876  return ctx->LoadInst(retPtr);
1877  }
1878 }
1879 
1880 
1881 llvm::Value *
1882 BinaryExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
1883  if (!arg0 || !arg1) {
1884  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
1885  return NULL;
1886  }
1887 
1888  // Handle these specially, since we want to short-circuit their evaluation...
1889  if (op == LogicalAnd || op == LogicalOr)
1890  return lEmitLogicalOp(op, arg0, arg1, ctx, pos);
1891 
1892  llvm::Value *value0 = arg0->GetValue(ctx);
1893  llvm::Value *value1 = arg1->GetValue(ctx);
1894  if (value0 == NULL || value1 == NULL) {
1895  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
1896  return NULL;
1897  }
1898 
1899  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
1900 
1901  switch (op) {
1902  case Add:
1903  case Sub:
1904  case Mul:
1905  case Div:
1906  case Mod:
1907  return lEmitBinaryArith(op, value0, value1, arg0->GetType(), arg1->GetType(),
1908  ctx, pos);
1909  case Lt:
1910  case Gt:
1911  case Le:
1912  case Ge:
1913  case Equal:
1914  case NotEqual:
1915  return lEmitBinaryCmp(op, value0, value1, arg0->GetType(), ctx, pos);
1916  case Shl:
1917  case Shr:
1918  case BitAnd:
1919  case BitXor:
1920  case BitOr: {
1921  if (op == Shr && arg1->GetType()->IsVaryingType() &&
1922  dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(arg1) == NULL)
1923  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Shift right is extremely inefficient for "
1924  "varying shift amounts.");
1925  return lEmitBinaryBitOp(op, value0, value1,
1926  arg0->GetType()->IsUnsignedType(), ctx);
1927  }
1928  case Comma:
1929  return value1;
1930  default:
1931  FATAL("logic error");
1932  return NULL;
1933  }
1934 }
1935 
1936 
1937 const Type *
1938 BinaryExpr::GetType() const {
1939  if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
1940  return NULL;
1941 
1942  const Type *type0 = arg0->GetType(), *type1 = arg1->GetType();
1943  if (type0 == NULL || type1 == NULL)
1944  return NULL;
1945 
1946  // If this hits, it means that our TypeCheck() method hasn't been
1947  // called before GetType() was called; adding two pointers is illegal
1948  // and will fail type checking and (int + ptr) should be canonicalized
1949  // into (ptr + int) by type checking.
1950  if (op == Add)
1951  AssertPos(pos, CastType<PointerType>(type1) == NULL);
1952 
1953  if (op == Comma)
1954  return arg1->GetType();
1955 
1956  if (CastType<PointerType>(type0) != NULL) {
1957  if (op == Add)
1958  // ptr + int -> ptr
1959  return type0;
1960  else if (op == Sub) {
1961  if (CastType<PointerType>(type1) != NULL) {
1962  // ptr - ptr -> ~ptrdiff_t
1963  const Type *diffType = (g->target->is32Bit() ||
1964  g->opt.force32BitAddressing) ?
1965  AtomicType::UniformInt32 : AtomicType::UniformInt64;
1966  if (type0->IsVaryingType() || type1->IsVaryingType())
1967  diffType = diffType->GetAsVaryingType();
1968  return diffType;
1969  }
1970  else
1971  // ptr - int -> ptr
1972  return type0;
1973  }
1974 
1975  // otherwise fall through for these...
1976  AssertPos(pos, op == Lt || op == Gt || op == Le || op == Ge ||
1977  op == Equal || op == NotEqual);
1978  }
1979 
1980  const Type *exprType = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, pos, lOpString(op));
1981  // I don't think that MoreGeneralType should be able to fail after the
1982  // checks done in BinaryExpr::TypeCheck().
1983  AssertPos(pos, exprType != NULL);
1984 
1985  switch (op) {
1986  case Add:
1987  case Sub:
1988  case Mul:
1989  case Div:
1990  case Mod:
1991  return exprType;
1992  case Lt:
1993  case Gt:
1994  case Le:
1995  case Ge:
1996  case Equal:
1997  case NotEqual:
1998  case LogicalAnd:
1999  case LogicalOr:
2000  return lMatchingBoolType(exprType);
2001  case Shl:
2002  case Shr:
2003  return type1->IsVaryingType() ? type0->GetAsVaryingType() : type0;
2004  case BitAnd:
2005  case BitXor:
2006  case BitOr:
2007  return exprType;
2008  case Comma:
2009  // handled above, so fall through here just in case
2010  default:
2011  FATAL("logic error in BinaryExpr::GetType()");
2012  return NULL;
2013  }
2014 }
2015 
2016 
2017 #define FOLD_OP(O, E) \
2018  case O: \
2019  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i) \
2020  result[i] = (v0[i] E v1[i]); \
2021  break
2022 
2023 /** Constant fold the binary integer operations that aren't also applicable
2024  to floating-point types.
2025 */
2026 template <typename T> static ConstExpr *
2027 lConstFoldBinIntOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, const T *v0, const T *v1, ConstExpr *carg0) {
2028  T result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2029  int count = carg0->Count();
2030 
2031  switch (op) {
2032  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Mod, %);
2033  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Shl, <<);
2034  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Shr, >>);
2035  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitAnd, &);
2036  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitXor, ^);
2037  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitOr, |);
2038  default:
2039  return NULL;
2040  }
2041 
2042  return new ConstExpr(carg0->GetType(), result, carg0->pos);
2043 }
2044 
2045 
2046 /** Constant fold the binary logical ops.
2047  */
2048 template <typename T> static ConstExpr *
2049 lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, const T *v0, const T *v1, ConstExpr *carg0) {
2050  bool result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2051  int count = carg0->Count();
2052 
2053  switch (op) {
2054  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Lt, <);
2055  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Gt, >);
2056  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Le, <=);
2057  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Ge, >=);
2058  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Equal, ==);
2059  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::NotEqual, !=);
2060  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd, &&);
2061  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::LogicalOr, ||);
2062  default:
2063  return NULL;
2064  }
2065 
2066  const Type *rType = carg0->GetType()->IsUniformType() ?
2067  AtomicType::UniformBool : AtomicType::VaryingBool;
2068  return new ConstExpr(rType, result, carg0->pos);
2069 }
2070 
2071 
2072 /** Constant fold binary arithmetic ops.
2073  */
2074 template <typename T> static ConstExpr *
2075 lConstFoldBinArithOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, const T *v0, const T *v1, ConstExpr *carg0,
2076  SourcePos pos) {
2077  T result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2078  int count = carg0->Count();
2079 
2080  switch (op) {
2081  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Add, +);
2082  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Sub, -);
2083  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Mul, *);
2084  case BinaryExpr::Div:
2085  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i) {
2086  if (v1[i] == 0) {
2087  Error(pos, "Division by zero encountered in expression.");
2088  result[i] = 0;
2089  }
2090  else
2091  result[i] = (v0[i] / v1[i]);
2092  }
2093  break;
2094  default:
2095  return NULL;
2096  }
2097 
2098  return new ConstExpr(carg0->GetType(), result, carg0->pos);
2099 }
2100 
2101 
2102 /** Constant fold the various boolean binary ops.
2103  */
2104 static ConstExpr *
2105 lConstFoldBoolBinOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, const bool *v0, const bool *v1,
2106  ConstExpr *carg0) {
2107  bool result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2108  int count = carg0->Count();
2109 
2110  switch (op) {
2111  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitAnd, &);
2112  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitXor, ^);
2113  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitOr, |);
2114  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Lt, <);
2115  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Gt, >);
2116  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Le, <=);
2117  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Ge, >=);
2118  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Equal, ==);
2119  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::NotEqual, !=);
2120  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd, &&);
2121  FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::LogicalOr, ||);
2122  default:
2123  return NULL;
2124  }
2125 
2126  return new ConstExpr(carg0->GetType(), result, carg0->pos);
2127 }
2128 
2129 
2130 Expr *
2131 BinaryExpr::Optimize() {
2132  if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
2133  return NULL;
2134 
2135  ConstExpr *constArg0 = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(arg0);
2136  ConstExpr *constArg1 = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(arg1);
2137 
2138  if (g->opt.fastMath) {
2139  // optimizations related to division by floats..
2140 
2141  // transform x / const -> x * (1/const)
2142  if (op == Div && constArg1 != NULL) {
2143  const Type *type1 = constArg1->GetType();
2144  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type1, AtomicType::UniformFloat) ||
2145  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type1, AtomicType::VaryingFloat)) {
2146  float inv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2147  int count = constArg1->AsFloat(inv);
2148  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
2149  inv[i] = 1.f / inv[i];
2150  Expr *einv = new ConstExpr(type1, inv, constArg1->pos);
2151  Expr *e = new BinaryExpr(Mul, arg0, einv, pos);
2152  e = ::TypeCheck(e);
2153  if (e == NULL)
2154  return NULL;
2155  return ::Optimize(e);
2156  }
2157  }
2158 
2159  // transform x / y -> x * rcp(y)
2160  if (op == Div) {
2161  const Type *type1 = arg1->GetType();
2162  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type1, AtomicType::UniformFloat) ||
2163  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type1, AtomicType::VaryingFloat)) {
2164  // Get the symbol for the appropriate builtin
2165  std::vector<Symbol *> rcpFuns;
2166  m->symbolTable->LookupFunction("rcp", &rcpFuns);
2167  if (rcpFuns.size() > 0) {
2168  Expr *rcpSymExpr = new FunctionSymbolExpr("rcp", rcpFuns, pos);
2169  ExprList *args = new ExprList(arg1, arg1->pos);
2170  Expr *rcpCall = new FunctionCallExpr(rcpSymExpr, args,
2171  arg1->pos);
2172  rcpCall = ::TypeCheck(rcpCall);
2173  if (rcpCall == NULL)
2174  return NULL;
2175  rcpCall = ::Optimize(rcpCall);
2176  if (rcpCall == NULL)
2177  return NULL;
2178 
2179  Expr *ret = new BinaryExpr(Mul, arg0, rcpCall, pos);
2180  ret = ::TypeCheck(ret);
2181  if (ret == NULL)
2182  return NULL;
2183  return ::Optimize(ret);
2184  }
2185  else
2186  Warning(pos, "rcp() not found from stdlib. Can't apply "
2187  "fast-math rcp optimization.");
2188  }
2189  }
2190  }
2191 
2192  // From here on out, we're just doing constant folding, so if both args
2193  // aren't constants then we're done...
2194  if (constArg0 == NULL || constArg1 == NULL)
2195  return this;
2196 
2197  AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arg0->GetType(), arg1->GetType()));
2198  const Type *type = arg0->GetType()->GetAsNonConstType();
2199  if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformFloat) ||
2200  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingFloat)) {
2201  float v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2202  constArg0->AsFloat(v0);
2203  constArg1->AsFloat(v1);
2204  ConstExpr *ret;
2205  if ((ret = lConstFoldBinArithOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0, pos)) != NULL)
2206  return ret;
2207  else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
2208  return ret;
2209  else
2210  return this;
2211  }
2212  if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformDouble) ||
2213  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingDouble)) {
2214  double v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2215  constArg0->AsDouble(v0);
2216  constArg1->AsDouble(v1);
2217  ConstExpr *ret;
2218  if ((ret = lConstFoldBinArithOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0, pos)) != NULL)
2219  return ret;
2220  else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
2221  return ret;
2222  else
2223  return this;
2224  }
2225  if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt32) ||
2226  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt32)) {
2227  int32_t v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2228  constArg0->AsInt32(v0);
2229  constArg1->AsInt32(v1);
2230  ConstExpr *ret;
2231  if ((ret = lConstFoldBinArithOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0, pos)) != NULL)
2232  return ret;
2233  else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinIntOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
2234  return ret;
2235  else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
2236  return ret;
2237  else
2238  return this;
2239  }
2240  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt32) ||
2241  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt32) ||
2242  CastType<EnumType>(type) != NULL) {
2243  uint32_t v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2244  constArg0->AsUInt32(v0);
2245  constArg1->AsUInt32(v1);
2246  ConstExpr *ret;
2247  if ((ret = lConstFoldBinArithOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0, pos)) != NULL)
2248  return ret;
2249  else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinIntOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
2250  return ret;
2251  else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
2252  return ret;
2253  else
2254  return this;
2255  }
2256  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformBool) ||
2257  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingBool)) {
2258  bool v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
2259  constArg0->AsBool(v0);
2260  constArg1->AsBool(v1);
2261  ConstExpr *ret;
2262  if ((ret = lConstFoldBoolBinOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
2263  return ret;
2264  else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
2265  return ret;
2266  else
2267  return this;
2268  }
2269  else
2270  return this;
2271 }
2272 
2273 
2274 Expr *
2275 BinaryExpr::TypeCheck() {
2276  if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
2277  return NULL;
2278 
2279  const Type *type0 = arg0->GetType(), *type1 = arg1->GetType();
2280  if (type0 == NULL || type1 == NULL)
2281  return NULL;
2282 
2283  // If either operand is a reference, dereference it before we move
2284  // forward
2285  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(type0) != NULL) {
2286  arg0 = new RefDerefExpr(arg0, arg0->pos);
2287  type0 = arg0->GetType();
2288  AssertPos(pos, type0 != NULL);
2289  }
2290  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(type1) != NULL) {
2291  arg1 = new RefDerefExpr(arg1, arg1->pos);
2292  type1 = arg1->GetType();
2293  AssertPos(pos, type1 != NULL);
2294  }
2295 
2296  // Convert arrays to pointers to their first elements
2297  if (CastType<ArrayType>(type0) != NULL) {
2298  arg0 = lArrayToPointer(arg0);
2299  type0 = arg0->GetType();
2300  }
2301  if (CastType<ArrayType>(type1) != NULL) {
2302  arg1 = lArrayToPointer(arg1);
2303  type1 = arg1->GetType();
2304  }
2305 
2306  // Prohibit binary operators with SOA types
2307  if (type0->GetSOAWidth() > 0) {
2308  Error(arg0->pos, "Illegal to use binary operator %s with SOA type "
2309  "\"%s\".", lOpString(op), type0->GetString().c_str());
2310  return NULL;
2311  }
2312  if (type1->GetSOAWidth() > 0) {
2313  Error(arg1->pos, "Illegal to use binary operator %s with SOA type "
2314  "\"%s\".", lOpString(op), type1->GetString().c_str());
2315  return NULL;
2316  }
2317 
2318  const PointerType *pt0 = CastType<PointerType>(type0);
2319  const PointerType *pt1 = CastType<PointerType>(type1);
2320  if (pt0 != NULL && pt1 != NULL && op == Sub) {
2321  // Pointer subtraction
2322  if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(type0)) {
2323  Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic "
2324  "on \"%s\" type.", type0->GetString().c_str());
2325  return NULL;
2326  }
2327  if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(type1)) {
2328  Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic "
2329  "on \"%s\" type.", type1->GetString().c_str());
2330  return NULL;
2331  }
2332  if (CastType<UndefinedStructType>(pt0->GetBaseType())) {
2333  Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic "
2334  "on undefined struct type \"%s\".", pt0->GetString().c_str());
2335  return NULL;
2336  }
2337  if (CastType<UndefinedStructType>(pt1->GetBaseType())) {
2338  Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic "
2339  "on undefined struct type \"%s\".", pt1->GetString().c_str());
2340  return NULL;
2341  }
2342 
2343  const Type *t = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, pos, "-");
2344  if (t == NULL)
2345  return NULL;
2346 
2347  arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, t, "pointer subtraction");
2348  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, t, "pointer subtraction");
2349  if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
2350  return NULL;
2351 
2352  return this;
2353  }
2354  else if (((pt0 != NULL || pt1 != NULL) && op == Add) ||
2355  (pt0 != NULL && op == Sub)) {
2356  // Handle ptr + int, int + ptr, ptr - int
2357  if (pt0 != NULL && pt1 != NULL) {
2358  Error(pos, "Illegal to add two pointer types \"%s\" and \"%s\".",
2359  pt0->GetString().c_str(), pt1->GetString().c_str());
2360  return NULL;
2361  }
2362  else if (pt1 != NULL) {
2363  // put in canonical order with the pointer as the first operand
2364  // for GetValue()
2365  std::swap(arg0, arg1);
2366  std::swap(type0, type1);
2367  std::swap(pt0, pt1);
2368  }
2369 
2370  AssertPos(pos, pt0 != NULL);
2371
