2372  if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(pt0)) {
2373  Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic "
2374  "on \"%s\" type.", pt0->GetString().c_str());
2375  return NULL;
2376  }
2377  if (CastType<UndefinedStructType>(pt0->GetBaseType())) {
2378  Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic "
2379  "on undefined struct type \"%s\".", pt0->GetString().c_str());
2380  return NULL;
2381  }
2382 
2383  const Type *offsetType = g->target->is32Bit() ?
2384  AtomicType::UniformInt32 : AtomicType::UniformInt64;
2385  if (pt0->IsVaryingType())
2386  offsetType = offsetType->GetAsVaryingType();
2387  if (type1->IsVaryingType()) {
2388  arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, type0->GetAsVaryingType(),
2389  "pointer addition");
2390  offsetType = offsetType->GetAsVaryingType();
2391  AssertPos(pos, arg0 != NULL);
2392  }
2393 
2394  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, offsetType, lOpString(op));
2395  if (arg1 == NULL)
2396  return NULL;
2397 
2398  return this;
2399  }
2400 
2401  switch (op) {
2402  case Shl:
2403  case Shr:
2404  case BitAnd:
2405  case BitXor:
2406  case BitOr: {
2407  // Must have integer or bool-typed operands for these bit-related
2408  // ops; don't do any implicit conversions from floats here...
2409  if (!type0->IsIntType() && !type0->IsBoolType()) {
2410  Error(arg0->pos, "First operand to binary operator \"%s\" must be "
2411  "an integer or bool.", lOpString(op));
2412  return NULL;
2413  }
2414  if (!type1->IsIntType() && !type1->IsBoolType()) {
2415  Error(arg1->pos, "Second operand to binary operator \"%s\" must be "
2416  "an integer or bool.", lOpString(op));
2417  return NULL;
2418  }
2419 
2420  if (op == Shl || op == Shr) {
2421  bool isVarying = (type0->IsVaryingType() ||
2422  type1->IsVaryingType());
2423  if (isVarying) {
2424  arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, type0->GetAsVaryingType(),
2425  "shift operator");
2426  if (arg0 == NULL)
2427  return NULL;
2428  type0 = arg0->GetType();
2429  }
2430  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, type0, "shift operator");
2431  if (arg1 == NULL)
2432  return NULL;
2433  }
2434  else {
2435  const Type *promotedType = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, arg0->pos,
2436  "binary bit op");
2437  if (promotedType == NULL)
2438  return NULL;
2439 
2440  arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, promotedType, "binary bit op");
2441  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, promotedType, "binary bit op");
2442  if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
2443  return NULL;
2444  }
2445  return this;
2446  }
2447  case Add:
2448  case Sub:
2449  case Mul:
2450  case Div:
2451  case Mod: {
2452  // Must be numeric type for these. (And mod is special--can't be float)
2453  if (!type0->IsNumericType() || (op == Mod && type0->IsFloatType())) {
2454  Error(arg0->pos, "First operand to binary operator \"%s\" is of "
2455  "invalid type \"%s\".", lOpString(op),
2456  type0->GetString().c_str());
2457  return NULL;
2458  }
2459  if (!type1->IsNumericType() || (op == Mod && type1->IsFloatType())) {
2460  Error(arg1->pos, "First operand to binary operator \"%s\" is of "
2461  "invalid type \"%s\".", lOpString(op),
2462  type1->GetString().c_str());
2463  return NULL;
2464  }
2465 
2466  const Type *promotedType = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1,
2467  Union(arg0->pos, arg1->pos),
2468  lOpString(op));
2469  if (promotedType == NULL)
2470  return NULL;
2471 
2472  arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, promotedType, lOpString(op));
2473  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, promotedType, lOpString(op));
2474  if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
2475  return NULL;
2476  return this;
2477  }
2478  case Lt:
2479  case Gt:
2480  case Le:
2481  case Ge:
2482  case Equal:
2483  case NotEqual: {
2484  const PointerType *pt0 = CastType<PointerType>(type0);
2485  const PointerType *pt1 = CastType<PointerType>(type1);
2486 
2487  // Convert '0' in expressions where the other expression is a
2488  // pointer type to a NULL pointer.
2489  if (pt0 != NULL && lIsAllIntZeros(arg1)) {
2490  arg1 = new NullPointerExpr(pos);
2491  type1 = arg1->GetType();
2492  pt1 = CastType<PointerType>(type1);
2493  }
2494  else if (pt1 != NULL && lIsAllIntZeros(arg0)) {
2495  arg0 = new NullPointerExpr(pos);
2496  type0 = arg1->GetType();
2497  pt0 = CastType<PointerType>(type0);
2498  }
2499 
2500  if (pt0 == NULL && pt1 == NULL) {
2501  if (!type0->IsBoolType() && !type0->IsNumericType()) {
2502  Error(arg0->pos,
2503  "First operand to operator \"%s\" is of "
2504  "non-comparable type \"%s\".", lOpString(op),
2505  type0->GetString().c_str());
2506  return NULL;
2507  }
2508  if (!type1->IsBoolType() && !type1->IsNumericType()) {
2509  Error(arg1->pos,
2510  "Second operand to operator \"%s\" is of "
2511  "non-comparable type \"%s\".", lOpString(op),
2512  type1->GetString().c_str());
2513  return NULL;
2514  }
2515  }
2516 
2517  const Type *promotedType =
2518  Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, arg0->pos, lOpString(op));
2519  if (promotedType == NULL)
2520  return NULL;
2521 
2522  arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, promotedType, lOpString(op));
2523  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, promotedType, lOpString(op));
2524  if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
2525  return NULL;
2526  return this;
2527  }
2528  case LogicalAnd:
2529  case LogicalOr: {
2530  // For now, we just type convert to boolean types, of the same
2531  // variability as the original types. (When generating code, it's
2532  // useful to have preserved the uniform/varying distinction.)
2533  const AtomicType *boolType0 = type0->IsUniformType() ?
2534  AtomicType::UniformBool : AtomicType::VaryingBool;
2535  const AtomicType *boolType1 = type1->IsUniformType() ?
2536  AtomicType::UniformBool : AtomicType::VaryingBool;
2537 
2538  const Type *destType0 = NULL, *destType1 = NULL;
2539  const VectorType *vtype0 = CastType<VectorType>(type0);
2540  const VectorType *vtype1 = CastType<VectorType>(type1);
2541  if (vtype0 && vtype1) {
2542  int sz0 = vtype0->GetElementCount(), sz1 = vtype1->GetElementCount();
2543  if (sz0 != sz1) {
2544  Error(pos, "Can't do logical operation \"%s\" between vector types of "
2545  "different sizes (%d vs. %d).", lOpString(op), sz0, sz1);
2546  return NULL;
2547  }
2548  destType0 = new VectorType(boolType0, sz0);
2549  destType1 = new VectorType(boolType1, sz1);
2550  }
2551  else if (vtype0 != NULL) {
2552  destType0 = new VectorType(boolType0, vtype0->GetElementCount());
2553  destType1 = new VectorType(boolType1, vtype0->GetElementCount());
2554  }
2555  else if (vtype1 != NULL) {
2556  destType0 = new VectorType(boolType0, vtype1->GetElementCount());
2557  destType1 = new VectorType(boolType1, vtype1->GetElementCount());
2558  }
2559  else {
2560  destType0 = boolType0;
2561  destType1 = boolType1;
2562  }
2563 
2564  arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, destType0, lOpString(op));
2565  arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, destType1, lOpString(op));
2566  if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
2567  return NULL;
2568  return this;
2569  }
2570  case Comma:
2571  return this;
2572  default:
2573  FATAL("logic error");
2574  return NULL;
2575  }
2576 }
2577 
2578 
2579 int
2580 BinaryExpr::EstimateCost() const {
2581  if (dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(arg0) != NULL &&
2582  dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(arg1) != NULL)
2583  return 0;
2584 
2585  return (op == Div || op == Mod) ? COST_COMPLEX_ARITH_OP :
2586  COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
2587 }
2588 
2589 
2590 void
2591 BinaryExpr::Print() const {
2592  if (!arg0 || !arg1 || !GetType())
2593  return;
2594 
2595  printf("[ %s ] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
2596  arg0->Print();
2597  printf(" %s ", lOpString(op));
2598  arg1->Print();
2599  printf(")");
2600  pos.Print();
2601 }
2602 
2603 
2604 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2605 // AssignExpr
2606 
2607 static const char *
2608 lOpString(AssignExpr::Op op) {
2609  switch (op) {
2610  case AssignExpr::Assign: return "assignment operator";
2611  case AssignExpr::MulAssign: return "*=";
2612  case AssignExpr::DivAssign: return "/=";
2613  case AssignExpr::ModAssign: return "%%=";
2614  case AssignExpr::AddAssign: return "+=";
2615  case AssignExpr::SubAssign: return "-=";
2616  case AssignExpr::ShlAssign: return "<<=";
2617  case AssignExpr::ShrAssign: return ">>=";
2618  case AssignExpr::AndAssign: return "&=";
2619  case AssignExpr::XorAssign: return "^=";
2620  case AssignExpr::OrAssign: return "|=";
2621  default:
2622  FATAL("Missing op in lOpstring");
2623  return "";
2624  }
2625 }
2626 
2627 /** Emit code to do an "assignment + operation" operator, e.g. "+=".
2628  */
2629 static llvm::Value *
2630 lEmitOpAssign(AssignExpr::Op op, Expr *arg0, Expr *arg1, const Type *type,
2631  Symbol *baseSym, SourcePos pos, FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
2632  llvm::Value *lv = arg0->GetLValue(ctx);
2633  if (!lv) {
2634  // FIXME: I think this test is unnecessary and that this case
2635  // should be caught during typechecking
2636  Error(pos, "Can't assign to left-hand side of expression.");
2637  return NULL;
2638  }
2639  const Type *lvalueType = arg0->GetLValueType();
2640  const Type *resultType = arg0->GetType();
2641  if (lvalueType == NULL || resultType == NULL)
2642  return NULL;
2643 
2644  // Get the value on the right-hand side of the assignment+operation
2645  // operator and load the current value on the left-hand side.
2646  llvm::Value *rvalue = arg1->GetValue(ctx);
2647  llvm::Value *mask = lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx);
2648  ctx->SetDebugPos(arg0->pos);
2649  llvm::Value *oldLHS = ctx->LoadInst(lv, mask, lvalueType);
2650  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
2651 
2652  // Map the operator to the corresponding BinaryExpr::Op operator
2653  BinaryExpr::Op basicop;
2654  switch (op) {
2655  case AssignExpr::MulAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Mul; break;
2656  case AssignExpr::DivAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Div; break;
2657  case AssignExpr::ModAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Mod; break;
2658  case AssignExpr::AddAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Add; break;
2659  case AssignExpr::SubAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Sub; break;
2660  case AssignExpr::ShlAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Shl; break;
2661  case AssignExpr::ShrAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Shr; break;
2662  case AssignExpr::AndAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::BitAnd; break;
2663  case AssignExpr::XorAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::BitXor; break;
2664  case AssignExpr::OrAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::BitOr; break;
2665  default:
2666  FATAL("logic error in lEmitOpAssign()");
2667  return NULL;
2668  }
2669 
2670  // Emit the code to compute the new value
2671  llvm::Value *newValue = NULL;
2672  switch (op) {
2673  case AssignExpr::MulAssign:
2674  case AssignExpr::DivAssign:
2675  case AssignExpr::ModAssign:
2676  case AssignExpr::AddAssign:
2677  case AssignExpr::SubAssign:
2678  newValue = lEmitBinaryArith(basicop, oldLHS, rvalue, type,
2679  arg1->GetType(), ctx, pos);
2680  break;
2681  case AssignExpr::ShlAssign:
2682  case AssignExpr::ShrAssign:
2683  case AssignExpr::AndAssign:
2684  case AssignExpr::XorAssign:
2685  case AssignExpr::OrAssign:
2686  newValue = lEmitBinaryBitOp(basicop, oldLHS, rvalue,
2687  arg0->GetType()->IsUnsignedType(), ctx);
2688  break;
2689  default:
2690  FATAL("logic error in lEmitOpAssign");
2691  return NULL;
2692  }
2693 
2694  // And store the result back to the lvalue.
2695  ctx->SetDebugPos(arg0->pos);
2696  lStoreAssignResult(newValue, lv, resultType, lvalueType, ctx, baseSym);
2697 
2698  return newValue;
2699 }
2700 
2701 
2702 AssignExpr::AssignExpr(AssignExpr::Op o, Expr *a, Expr *b, SourcePos p)
2703  : Expr(p), op(o) {
2704  lvalue = a;
2705  rvalue = b;
2706 }
2707 
2708 
2709 llvm::Value *
2710 AssignExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
2711  const Type *type = NULL;
2712  if (lvalue == NULL || rvalue == NULL || (type = GetType()) == NULL)
2713  return NULL;
2714 
2715  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
2716 
2717  Symbol *baseSym = lvalue->GetBaseSymbol();
2718 
2719  switch (op) {
2720  case Assign: {
2721  llvm::Value *ptr = lvalue->GetLValue(ctx);
2722  if (ptr == NULL) {
2723  Error(lvalue->pos, "Left hand side of assignment expression can't "
2724  "be assigned to.");
2725  return NULL;
2726  }
2727  const Type *ptrType = lvalue->GetLValueType();
2728  const Type *valueType = rvalue->GetType();
2729  if (ptrType == NULL || valueType == NULL) {
2730  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
2731  return NULL;
2732  }
2733 
2734  llvm::Value *value = rvalue->GetValue(ctx);
2735  if (value == NULL) {
2736  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
2737  return NULL;
2738  }
2739 
2740  ctx->SetDebugPos(lvalue->pos);
2741 
2742  lStoreAssignResult(value, ptr, valueType, ptrType, ctx, baseSym);
2743 
2744  return value;
2745  }
2746  case MulAssign:
2747  case DivAssign:
2748  case ModAssign:
2749  case AddAssign:
2750  case SubAssign:
2751  case ShlAssign:
2752  case ShrAssign:
2753  case AndAssign:
2754  case XorAssign:
2755  case OrAssign: {
2756  // This should be caught during type checking
2757  AssertPos(pos, !CastType<ArrayType>(type) &&
2758  !CastType<StructType>(type));
2759  return lEmitOpAssign(op, lvalue, rvalue, type, baseSym, pos, ctx);
2760  }
2761  default:
2762  FATAL("logic error in AssignExpr::GetValue()");
2763  return NULL;
2764  }
2765 }
2766 
2767 
2768 Expr *
2769 AssignExpr::Optimize() {
2770  if (lvalue == NULL || rvalue == NULL)
2771  return NULL;
2772  return this;
2773 }
2774 
2775 
2776 const Type *
2777 AssignExpr::GetType() const {
2778  return lvalue ? lvalue->GetType() : NULL;
2779 }
2780 
2781 
2782 /** Recursively checks a structure type to see if it (or any struct type
2783  that it holds) has a const-qualified member. */
2784 static bool
2785 lCheckForConstStructMember(SourcePos pos, const StructType *structType,
2786  const StructType *initialType) {
2787  for (int i = 0; i < structType->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
2788  const Type *t = structType->GetElementType(i);
2789  if (t->IsConstType()) {
2790  if (structType == initialType)
2791  Error(pos, "Illegal to assign to type \"%s\" due to element "
2792  "\"%s\" with type \"%s\".", structType->GetString().c_str(),
2793  structType->GetElementName(i).c_str(),
2794  t->GetString().c_str());
2795  else
2796  Error(pos, "Illegal to assign to type \"%s\" in type \"%s\" "
2797  "due to element \"%s\" with type \"%s\".",
2798  structType->GetString().c_str(),
2799  initialType->GetString().c_str(),
2800  structType->GetElementName(i).c_str(),
2801  t->GetString().c_str());
2802  return true;
2803  }
2804 
2805  const StructType *st = CastType<StructType>(t);
2806  if (st != NULL && lCheckForConstStructMember(pos, st, initialType))
2807  return true;
2808  }
2809  return false;
2810 }
2811 
2812 
2813 Expr *
2814 AssignExpr::TypeCheck() {
2815  if (lvalue == NULL || rvalue == NULL)
2816  return NULL;
2817 
2818  bool lvalueIsReference =
2819  CastType<ReferenceType>(lvalue->GetType()) != NULL;
2820  if (lvalueIsReference)
2821  lvalue = new RefDerefExpr(lvalue, lvalue->pos);
2822 
2823  FunctionSymbolExpr *fse;
2824  if ((fse = dynamic_cast<FunctionSymbolExpr *>(rvalue)) != NULL) {
2825  // Special case to use the type of the LHS to resolve function
2826  // overloads when we're assigning a function pointer where the
2827  // function is overloaded.
2828  const Type *lvalueType = lvalue->GetType();
2829  const FunctionType *ftype;
2830  if (CastType<PointerType>(lvalueType) == NULL ||
2831  (ftype = CastType<FunctionType>(lvalueType->GetBaseType())) == NULL) {
2832  Error(lvalue->pos, "Can't assign function pointer to type \"%s\".",
2833  lvalueType ? lvalueType->GetString().c_str() : "<unknown>");
2834  return NULL;
2835  }
2836 
2837  std::vector<const Type *> paramTypes;
2838  for (int i = 0; i < ftype->GetNumParameters(); ++i)
2839  paramTypes.push_back(ftype->GetParameterType(i));
2840 
2841  if (!fse->ResolveOverloads(rvalue->pos, paramTypes)) {
2842  Error(pos, "Unable to find overloaded function for function "
2843  "pointer assignment.");
2844  return NULL;
2845  }
2846  }
2847 
2848  const Type *lhsType = lvalue->GetType();
2849  if (lhsType == NULL) {
2850  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
2851  return NULL;
2852  }
2853 
2854  if (lhsType->IsConstType()) {
2855  Error(lvalue->pos, "Can't assign to type \"%s\" on left-hand side of "
2856  "expression.", lhsType->GetString().c_str());
2857  return NULL;
2858  }
2859 
2860  if (CastType<PointerType>(lhsType) != NULL) {
2861  if (op == AddAssign || op == SubAssign) {
2862  if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(lhsType)) {
2863  Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic on \"%s\" "
2864  "type.", lhsType->GetString().c_str());
2865  return NULL;
2866  }
2867 
2868  const Type *deltaType = g->target->is32Bit() ? AtomicType::UniformInt32 :
2869  AtomicType::UniformInt64;
2870  if (lhsType->IsVaryingType())
2871  deltaType = deltaType->GetAsVaryingType();
2872  rvalue = TypeConvertExpr(rvalue, deltaType, lOpString(op));
2873  }
2874  else if (op == Assign)
2875  rvalue = TypeConvertExpr(rvalue, lhsType, "assignment");
2876  else {
2877  Error(lvalue->pos, "Assignment operator \"%s\" is illegal with pointer types.",
2878  lOpString(op));
2879  return NULL;
2880  }
2881  }
2882  else if (CastType<ArrayType>(lhsType) != NULL) {
2883  Error(lvalue->pos, "Illegal to assign to array type \"%s\".",
2884  lhsType->GetString().c_str());
2885  return NULL;
2886  }
2887  else
2888  rvalue = TypeConvertExpr(rvalue, lhsType, lOpString(op));
2889 
2890  if (rvalue == NULL)
2891  return NULL;
2892 
2893  if (lhsType->IsFloatType() == true &&
2894  (op == ShlAssign || op == ShrAssign || op == AndAssign ||
2895  op == XorAssign || op == OrAssign)) {
2896  Error(pos, "Illegal to use %s operator with floating-point "
2897  "operands.", lOpString(op));
2898  return NULL;
2899  }
2900 
2901  const StructType *st = CastType<StructType>(lhsType);
2902  if (st != NULL) {
2903  // Make sure we're not assigning to a struct that has a constant member
2904  if (lCheckForConstStructMember(pos, st, st))
2905  return NULL;
2906 
2907  if (op != Assign) {
2908  Error(lvalue->pos, "Assignment operator \"%s\" is illegal with struct "
2909  "type \"%s\".", lOpString(op), st->GetString().c_str());
2910  return NULL;
2911  }
2912  }
2913 
2914  return this;
2915 }
2916 
2917 
2918 int
2919 AssignExpr::EstimateCost() const {
2920  if (op == Assign)
2921  return COST_ASSIGN;
2922  if (op == DivAssign || op == ModAssign)
2923  return COST_ASSIGN + COST_COMPLEX_ARITH_OP;
2924  else
2925  return COST_ASSIGN + COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
2926 }
2927 
2928 
2929 void
2930 AssignExpr::Print() const {
2931  if (!lvalue || !rvalue || !GetType())
2932  return;
2933 
2934  printf("[%s] assign (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
2935  lvalue->Print();
2936  printf(" %s ", lOpString(op));
2937  rvalue->Print();
2938  printf(")");
2939  pos.Print();
2940 }
2941 
2942 
2943 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
2944 // SelectExpr
2945 
2946 SelectExpr::SelectExpr(Expr *t, Expr *e1, Expr *e2, SourcePos p)
2947  : Expr(p) {
2948  test = t;
2949  expr1 = e1;
2950  expr2 = e2;
2951 }
2952 
2953 
2954 /** Emit code to select between two varying values based on a varying test
2955  value.
2956  */
2957 static llvm::Value *
2958 lEmitVaryingSelect(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *test,
2959  llvm::Value *expr1, llvm::Value *expr2,
2960  const Type *type) {
2961  llvm::Value *resultPtr = ctx->AllocaInst(expr1->getType(), "selectexpr_tmp");
2962  // Don't need to worry about masking here
2963  ctx->StoreInst(expr2, resultPtr);
2964  // Use masking to conditionally store the expr1 values
2965  Assert(resultPtr->getType() ==
2966  PointerType::GetUniform(type)->LLVMType(g->ctx));
2967  ctx->StoreInst(expr1, resultPtr, test, type, PointerType::GetUniform(type));
2968  return ctx->LoadInst(resultPtr, "selectexpr_final");
2969 }
2970 
2971 
2972 static void
2973 lEmitSelectExprCode(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *testVal,
2974  llvm::Value *oldMask, llvm::Value *fullMask,
2975  Expr *expr, llvm::Value *exprPtr) {
2976  llvm::BasicBlock *bbEval = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("select_eval_expr");
2977  llvm::BasicBlock *bbDone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("select_done");
2978 
2979  // Check to see if the test was true for any of the currently executing
2980  // program instances.
2981  llvm::Value *testAndFullMask =
2982  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, testVal, fullMask,
2983  "test&mask");
2984  llvm::Value *anyOn = ctx->Any(testAndFullMask);
2985  ctx->BranchInst(bbEval, bbDone, anyOn);
2986 
2987  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbEval);
2988  llvm::Value *testAndMask =
2989  ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, testVal, oldMask,
2990  "test&mask");
2991  ctx->SetInternalMask(testAndMask);
2992  llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
2993  ctx->StoreInst(exprVal, exprPtr);
2994  ctx->BranchInst(bbDone);
2995 
2996  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbDone);
2997 }
2998 
2999 
3000 llvm::Value *
3001 SelectExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
3002  if (!expr1 || !expr2 || !test)
3003  return NULL;
3004 
3005  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
3006 
3007  const Type *testType = test->GetType()->GetAsNonConstType();
3008  // This should be taken care of during typechecking
3009  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(testType->GetBaseType(), AtomicType::UniformBool) ||
3010  Type::Equal(testType->GetBaseType(), AtomicType::VaryingBool));
3011 
3012  const Type *type = expr1->GetType();
3013 
3014  if (Type::Equal(testType, AtomicType::UniformBool)) {
3015  // Simple case of a single uniform bool test expression; we just
3016  // want one of the two expressions. In this case, we can be
3017  // careful to evaluate just the one of the expressions that we need
3018  // the value of so that if the other one has side-effects or
3019  // accesses invalid memory, it doesn't execute.
3020  llvm::Value *testVal = test->GetValue(ctx);
3021  llvm::BasicBlock *testTrue = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("select_true");
3022  llvm::BasicBlock *testFalse = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("select_false");
3023  llvm::BasicBlock *testDone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("select_done");
3024  ctx->BranchInst(testTrue, testFalse, testVal);
3025 
3026  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(testTrue);
3027  llvm::Value *expr1Val = expr1->GetValue(ctx);
3028  // Note that truePred won't be necessarily equal to testTrue, in
3029  // case the expr1->GetValue() call changes the current basic block.
3030  llvm::BasicBlock *truePred = ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock();
3031  ctx->BranchInst(testDone);
3032 
3033  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(testFalse);
3034  llvm::Value *expr2Val = expr2->GetValue(ctx);
3035  // See comment above truePred for why we can't just assume we're in
3036  // the testFalse basic block here.
3037  llvm::BasicBlock *falsePred = ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock();
3038  ctx->BranchInst(testDone);
3039 
3040  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(testDone);
3041  llvm::PHINode *ret = ctx->PhiNode(expr1Val->getType(), 2, "select");
3042  ret->addIncoming(expr1Val, truePred);
3043  ret->addIncoming(expr2Val, falsePred);
3044  return ret;
3045  }
3046  else if (CastType<VectorType>(testType) == NULL) {
3047  // the test is a varying bool type
3048  llvm::Value *testVal = test->GetValue(ctx);
3049  AssertPos(pos, testVal->getType() == LLVMTypes::MaskType);
3050  llvm::Value *oldMask = ctx->GetInternalMask();
3051  llvm::Value *fullMask = ctx->GetFullMask();
3052 
3053  // We don't want to incur the overhead for short-circuit evaluation
3054  // for expressions that are both computationally simple and safe to
3055  // run with an "all off" mask.
3056  bool shortCircuit1 =
3057  (::EstimateCost(expr1) > PREDICATE_SAFE_IF_STATEMENT_COST ||
3058  SafeToRunWithMaskAllOff(expr1) == false);
3059  bool shortCircuit2 =
3060  (::EstimateCost(expr2) > PREDICATE_SAFE_IF_STATEMENT_COST ||
3061  SafeToRunWithMaskAllOff(expr2) == false);
3062 
3063  Debug(expr1->pos, "%sshort circuiting evaluation for select expr",
3064  shortCircuit1 ? "" : "Not ");
3065  Debug(expr2->pos, "%sshort circuiting evaluation for select expr",
3066  shortCircuit2 ? "" : "Not ");
3067 
3068  // Temporary storage to store the values computed for each
3069  // expression, if any. (These stay as uninitialized memory if we
3070  // short circuit around the corresponding expression.)
3071  llvm::Type *exprType =
3072  expr1->GetType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
3073  llvm::Value *expr1Ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(exprType);
3074  llvm::Value *expr2Ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(exprType);
3075 
3076  if (shortCircuit1)
3077  lEmitSelectExprCode(ctx, testVal, oldMask, fullMask, expr1,
3078  expr1Ptr);
3079  else {
3080  ctx->SetInternalMaskAnd(oldMask, testVal);
3081  llvm::Value *expr1Val = expr1->GetValue(ctx);
3082  ctx->StoreInst(expr1Val, expr1Ptr);
3083  }
3084 
3085  if (shortCircuit2) {
3086  llvm::Value *notTest = ctx->NotOperator(testVal);
3087  lEmitSelectExprCode(ctx, notTest, oldMask, fullMask, expr2,
3088  expr2Ptr);
3089  }
3090  else {
3091  ctx->SetInternalMaskAndNot(oldMask, testVal);
3092  llvm::Value *expr2Val = expr2->GetValue(ctx);
3093  ctx->StoreInst(expr2Val, expr2Ptr);
3094  }
3095 
3096  ctx->SetInternalMask(oldMask);
3097  llvm::Value *expr1Val = ctx->LoadInst(expr1Ptr);
3098  llvm::Value *expr2Val = ctx->LoadInst(expr2Ptr);
3099  return lEmitVaryingSelect(ctx, testVal, expr1Val, expr2Val, type);
3100  }
3101  else {
3102  // FIXME? Short-circuiting doesn't work in the case of
3103  // vector-valued test expressions. (We could also just prohibit
3104  // these and place the issue in the user's hands...)
3105  llvm::Value *testVal = test->GetValue(ctx);
3106  llvm::Value *expr1Val = expr1->GetValue(ctx);
3107  llvm::Value *expr2Val = expr2->GetValue(ctx);
3108 
3109  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
3110  const VectorType *vt = CastType<VectorType>(type);
3111  // Things that typechecking should have caught
3112  AssertPos(pos, vt != NULL);
3113  AssertPos(pos, CastType<VectorType>(testType) != NULL &&
3114  (CastType<VectorType>(testType)->GetElementCount() ==
3115  vt->GetElementCount()));
3116 
3117  // Do an element-wise select
3118  llvm::Value *result = llvm::UndefValue::get(type->LLVMType(g->ctx));
3119  for (int i = 0; i < vt->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
3120  llvm::Value *ti = ctx->ExtractInst(testVal, i);
3121  llvm::Value *e1i = ctx->ExtractInst(expr1Val, i);
3122  llvm::Value *e2i = ctx->ExtractInst(expr2Val, i);
3123  llvm::Value *sel = NULL;
3124  if (testType->IsUniformType())
3125  sel = ctx->SelectInst(ti, e1i, e2i);
3126  else
3127  sel = lEmitVaryingSelect(ctx, ti, e1i, e2i, vt->GetElementType());
3128  result = ctx->InsertInst(result, sel, i);
3129  }
3130  return result;
3131  }
3132 }
3133 
3134 
3135 const Type *
3136 SelectExpr::GetType() const {
3137  if (!test || !expr1 || !expr2)
3138  return NULL;
3139 
3140  const Type *testType = test->GetType();
3141  const Type *expr1Type = expr1->GetType();
3142  const Type *expr2Type = expr2->GetType();
3143 
3144  if (!testType || !expr1Type || !expr2Type)
3145  return NULL;
3146 
3147  bool becomesVarying = (testType->IsVaryingType() || expr1Type->IsVaryingType() ||
3148  expr2Type->IsVaryingType());
3149  // if expr1 and expr2 have different vector sizes, typechecking should fail...
3150  int testVecSize = CastType<VectorType>(testType) != NULL ?
3151  CastType<VectorType>(testType)->GetElementCount() : 0;
3152  int expr1VecSize = CastType<VectorType>(expr1Type) != NULL ?
3153  CastType<VectorType>(expr1Type)->GetElementCount() : 0;
3154  AssertPos(pos, !(testVecSize != 0 && expr1VecSize != 0 && testVecSize != expr1VecSize));
3155 
3156  int vectorSize = std::max(testVecSize, expr1VecSize);
3157  return Type::MoreGeneralType(expr1Type, expr2Type, Union(expr1->pos, expr2->pos),
3158  "select expression", becomesVarying, vectorSize);
3159 }
3160 
3161 
3162 Expr *
3163 SelectExpr::Optimize() {
3164  if (test == NULL || expr1 == NULL || expr2 == NULL)
3165  return NULL;
3166 
3167  ConstExpr *constTest = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(test);
3168  if (constTest == NULL)
3169  return this;
3170 
3171  // The test is a constant; see if we can resolve to one of the
3172  // expressions..
3173  bool bv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3174  int count = constTest->AsBool(bv);
3175  if (count == 1)
3176  // Uniform test value; return the corresponding expression
3177  return (bv[0] == true) ? expr1 : expr2;
3178  else {
3179  // Varying test: see if all of the values are the same; if so, then
3180  // return the corresponding expression
3181  bool first = bv[0];
3182  bool mismatch = false;
3183  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
3184  if (bv[i] != first) {
3185  mismatch = true;
3186  break;
3187  }
3188  if (mismatch == false)
3189  return (bv[0] == true) ? expr1 : expr2;
3190 
3191  // Last chance: see if the two expressions are constants; if so,
3192  // then we can do an element-wise selection based on the constant
3193  // condition..
3194  ConstExpr *constExpr1 = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr1);
3195  ConstExpr *constExpr2 = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr2);
3196  if (constExpr1 == NULL || constExpr2 == NULL)
3197  return this;
3198 
3199  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(constExpr1->GetType(), constExpr2->GetType()));
3200  const Type *exprType = constExpr1->GetType()->GetAsNonConstType();
3201  AssertPos(pos, exprType->IsVaryingType());
3202 
3203  // FIXME: it's annoying to have to have all of this replicated code.
3204  // FIXME: for completeness, it would also be nice to handle 8 and
3205  // 16 bit types...
3206  if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingInt32)) {
3207  int32_t v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v2[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3208  int32_t result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3209  constExpr1->AsInt32(v1);
3210  constExpr2->AsInt32(v2);
3211  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
3212  result[i] = bv[i] ? v1[i] : v2[i];
3213  return new ConstExpr(exprType, result, pos);
3214  }
3215  if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingUInt32)) {
3216  uint32_t v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v2[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3217  uint32_t result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3218  constExpr1->AsUInt32(v1);
3219  constExpr2->AsUInt32(v2);
3220  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
3221  result[i] = bv[i] ? v1[i] : v2[i];
3222  return new ConstExpr(exprType, result, pos);
3223  }
3224  else if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingInt64)) {
3225  int64_t v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v2[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3226  int64_t result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3227  constExpr1->AsInt64(v1);
3228  constExpr2->AsInt64(v2);
3229  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
3230  result[i] = bv[i] ? v1[i] : v2[i];
3231  return new ConstExpr(exprType, result, pos);
3232  }
3233  else if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingUInt64)) {
3234  uint64_t v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v2[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3235  uint64_t result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3236  constExpr1->AsUInt64(v1);
3237  constExpr2->AsUInt64(v2);
3238  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
3239  result[i] = bv[i] ? v1[i] : v2[i];
3240  return new ConstExpr(exprType, result, pos);
3241  }
3242  else if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingFloat)) {
3243  float v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v2[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3244  float result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3245  constExpr1->AsFloat(v1);
3246  constExpr2->AsFloat(v2);
3247  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
3248  result[i] = bv[i] ? v1[i] : v2[i];
3249  return new ConstExpr(exprType, result, pos);
3250  }
3251  else if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingDouble)) {
3252  double v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v2[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3253  double result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3254  constExpr1->AsDouble(v1);
3255  constExpr2->AsDouble(v2);
3256  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
3257  result[i] = bv[i] ? v1[i] : v2[i];
3258  return new ConstExpr(exprType, result, pos);
3259  }
3260  else if (Type::Equal(exprType, AtomicType::VaryingBool)) {
3261  bool v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v2[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3262  bool result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
3263  constExpr1->AsBool(v1);
3264  constExpr2->AsBool(v2);
3265  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
3266  result[i] = bv[i] ? v1[i] : v2[i];
3267  return new ConstExpr(exprType, result, pos);
3268  }
3269 
3270  return this;
3271  }
3272 }
3273 
3274 
3275 Expr *
3276 SelectExpr::TypeCheck() {
3277  if (test == NULL || expr1 == NULL || expr2 == NULL)
3278  return NULL;
3279 
3280  const Type *type1 = expr1->GetType(), *type2 = expr2->GetType();
3281  if (!type1 || !type2)
3282  return NULL;
3283 
3284  if (const ArrayType *at1 = CastType<ArrayType>(type1)) {
3285  expr1 = TypeConvertExpr(expr1, PointerType::GetUniform(at1->GetBaseType()),
3286  "select");
3287  if (expr1 == NULL)
3288  return NULL;
3289  type1 = expr1->GetType();
3290  }
3291  if (const ArrayType *at2 = CastType<ArrayType>(type2)) {
3292  expr2 = TypeConvertExpr(expr2, PointerType::GetUniform(at2->GetBaseType()),
3293  "select");
3294  if (expr2 == NULL)
3295  return NULL;
3296  type2 = expr2->GetType();
3297  }
3298 
3299  const Type *testType = test->GetType();
3300  if (testType == NULL)
3301  return NULL;
3302  test = TypeConvertExpr(test, lMatchingBoolType(testType), "select");
3303  if (test == NULL)
3304  return NULL;
3305  testType = test->GetType();
3306 
3307  int testVecSize = CastType<VectorType>(testType) ?
3308  CastType<VectorType>(testType)->GetElementCount() : 0;
3309  const Type *promotedType =
3310  Type::MoreGeneralType(type1, type2, Union(expr1->pos, expr2->pos),
3311  "select expression", testType->IsVaryingType(), testVecSize);
3312  if (promotedType == NULL)
3313  return NULL;
3314 
3315  expr1 = TypeConvertExpr(expr1, promotedType, "select");
3316  expr2 = TypeConvertExpr(expr2, promotedType, "select");
3317  if (expr1 == NULL || expr2 == NULL)
3318  return NULL;
3319 
3320  return this;
3321 }
3322 
3323 
3324 int
3325 SelectExpr::EstimateCost() const {
3326  return COST_SELECT;
3327 }
3328 
3329 
3330 void
3331 SelectExpr::Print() const {
3332  if (!test || !expr1 || !expr2 || !GetType())
3333  return;
3334 
3335  printf("[%s] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
3336  test->Print();
3337  printf(" ? ");
3338  expr1->Print();
3339  printf(" : ");
3340  expr2->Print();
3341  printf(")");
3342  pos.Print();
3343 }
3344 
3345 
3346 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3347 // FunctionCallExpr
3348 
3349 FunctionCallExpr::FunctionCallExpr(Expr *f, ExprList *a, SourcePos p,
3350  bool il, Expr *lce)
3351  : Expr(p), isLaunch(il) {
3352  func = f;
3353  args = a;
3354  launchCountExpr = lce;
3355 }
3356 
3357 
3358 static const FunctionType *
3359 lGetFunctionType(Expr *func) {
3360  if (func == NULL)
3361  return NULL;
3362 
3363  const Type *type = func->GetType();
3364  if (type == NULL)
3365  return NULL;
3366 
3367  const FunctionType *ftype = CastType<FunctionType>(type);
3368  if (ftype == NULL) {
3369  // Not a regular function symbol--is it a function pointer?
3370  if (CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL)
3371  ftype = CastType<FunctionType>(type->GetBaseType());
3372  }
3373  return ftype;
3374 }
3375 
3376 
3377 llvm::Value *
3378 FunctionCallExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
3379  if (func == NULL || args == NULL)
3380  return NULL;
3381 
3382  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
3383 
3384  llvm::Value *callee = func->GetValue(ctx);
3385 
3386  if (callee == NULL) {
3387  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
3388  return NULL;
3389  }
3390 
3391  const FunctionType *ft = lGetFunctionType(func);
3392  AssertPos(pos, ft != NULL);
3393  bool isVoidFunc = Type::Equal(ft->GetReturnType(), AtomicType::Void);
3394 
3395  // Automatically convert function call args to references if needed.
3396  // FIXME: this should move to the TypeCheck() method... (but the
3397  // GetLValue call below needs a FunctionEmitContext, which is
3398  // problematic...)
3399  std::vector<Expr *> callargs = args->exprs;
3400  bool err = false;
3401 
3402  // Specifically, this can happen if there's an error earlier during
3403  // overload resolution.
3404  if ((int)callargs.size() > ft->GetNumParameters()) {
3405  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
3406  return NULL;
3407  }
3408 
3409  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < callargs.size(); ++i) {
3410  Expr *argExpr = callargs[i];
3411  if (argExpr == NULL)
3412  continue;
3413 
3414  const Type *paramType = ft->GetParameterType(i);
3415 
3416  const Type *argLValueType = argExpr->GetLValueType();
3417  if (argLValueType != NULL &&
3418  CastType<PointerType>(argLValueType) != NULL &&
3419  argLValueType->IsVaryingType() &&
3420  CastType<ReferenceType>(paramType) != NULL) {
3421  Error(argExpr->pos, "Illegal to pass a \"varying\" lvalue to a "
3422  "reference parameter of type \"%s\".",
3423  paramType->GetString().c_str());
3424  return NULL;
3425  }
3426 
3427  // Do whatever type conversion is needed
3428  argExpr = TypeConvertExpr(argExpr, paramType,
3429  "function call argument");
3430  if (argExpr == NULL)
3431  return NULL;
3432  callargs[i] = argExpr;
3433  }
3434  if (err)
3435  return NULL;
3436 
3437  // Fill in any default argument values needed.
3438  // FIXME: should we do this during type checking?
3439  for (int i = callargs.size(); i < ft->GetNumParameters(); ++i) {
3440  Expr *paramDefault = ft->GetParameterDefault(i);
3441  const Type *paramType = ft->GetParameterType(i);
3442  // FIXME: this type conv should happen when we create the function
3443  // type!
3444  Expr *d = TypeConvertExpr(paramDefault, paramType,
3445  "function call default argument");
3446  if (d == NULL)
3447  return NULL;
3448  callargs.push_back(d);
3449  }
3450 
3451  // Now evaluate the values of all of the parameters being passed.
3452  std::vector<llvm::Value *> argVals;
3453  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < callargs.size(); ++i) {
3454  Expr *argExpr = callargs[i];
3455  if (argExpr == NULL)
3456  // give up; we hit an error earlier
3457  return NULL;
3458 
3459  llvm::Value *argValue = argExpr->GetValue(ctx);
3460  if (argValue == NULL)
3461  // something went wrong in evaluating the argument's
3462  // expression, so give up on this
3463  return NULL;
3464 
3465  argVals.push_back(argValue);
3466  }
3467 
3468 
3469  llvm::Value *retVal = NULL;
3470  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
3471  if (ft->isTask) {
3472  AssertPos(pos, launchCountExpr != NULL);
3473  llvm::Value *launchCount = launchCountExpr->GetValue(ctx);
3474  if (launchCount != NULL)
3475  ctx->LaunchInst(callee, argVals, launchCount);
3476  }
3477  else
3478  retVal = ctx->CallInst(callee, ft, argVals,
3479  isVoidFunc ? "" : "calltmp");
3480 
3481  if (isVoidFunc)
3482  return NULL;
3483  else
3484  return retVal;
3485 }
3486 
3487 
3488 llvm::Value *
3489 FunctionCallExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
3490  if (GetLValueType() != NULL) {
3491  return GetValue(ctx);
3492  }
3493  else {
3494  // Only be a valid LValue type if the function
3495  // returns a pointer or reference.
3496  return NULL;
3497  }
3498 }
3499 
3500 
3501 const Type *
3502 FunctionCallExpr::GetType() const {
3503  const FunctionType *ftype = lGetFunctionType(func);
3504  return ftype ? ftype->GetReturnType() : NULL;
3505 }
3506 
3507 
3508 const Type *
3509 FunctionCallExpr::GetLValueType() const {
3510  const FunctionType *ftype = lGetFunctionType(func);
3511  if (ftype && (ftype->GetReturnType()->IsPointerType()
3512  || ftype->GetReturnType()->IsReferenceType())) {
3513  return ftype->GetReturnType();
3514  }
3515  else {
3516  // Only be a valid LValue type if the function
3517  // returns a pointer or reference.
3518  return NULL;
3519  }
3520 }
3521 
3522 
3523 Expr *
3524 FunctionCallExpr::Optimize() {
3525  if (func == NULL || args == NULL)
3526  return NULL;
3527  return this;
3528 }
3529 
3530 
3531 Expr *
3532 FunctionCallExpr::TypeCheck() {
3533  if (func == NULL || args == NULL)
3534  return NULL;
3535 
3536  std::vector<const Type *> argTypes;
3537  std::vector<bool> argCouldBeNULL, argIsConstant;
3538  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < args->exprs.size(); ++i) {
3539  Expr *expr = args->exprs[i];
3540 
3541  if (expr == NULL)
3542  return NULL;
3543  const Type *t = expr->GetType();
3544  if (t == NULL)
3545  return NULL;
3546 
3547  argTypes.push_back(t);
3548  argCouldBeNULL.push_back(lIsAllIntZeros(expr) ||
3549  dynamic_cast<NullPointerExpr *>(expr));
3550  argIsConstant.push_back(dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr) ||
3551  dynamic_cast<NullPointerExpr *>(expr));
3552  }
3553 
3554  FunctionSymbolExpr *fse = dynamic_cast<FunctionSymbolExpr *>(func);
3555  if (fse != NULL) {
3556  // Regular function call
3557  if (fse->ResolveOverloads(args->pos, argTypes, &argCouldBeNULL,
3558  &argIsConstant) == false)
3559  return NULL;
3560 
3561  func = ::TypeCheck(fse);
3562  if (func == NULL)
3563  return NULL;
3564 
3565  const FunctionType *ft = CastType<FunctionType>(func->GetType());
3566  if (ft == NULL) {
3567  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(func->GetType());
3568  ft = (pt == NULL) ? NULL :
3569  CastType<FunctionType>(pt->GetBaseType());
3570  }
3571 
3572  if (ft == NULL) {
3573  Error(pos, "Valid function name must be used for function call.");
3574  return NULL;
3575  }
3576 
3577  if (ft->isTask) {
3578  if (!isLaunch)
3579  Error(pos, "\"launch\" expression needed to call function "
3580  "with \"task\" qualifier.");
3581  if (!launchCountExpr)
3582  return NULL;
3583 
3584  launchCountExpr =
3585  TypeConvertExpr(launchCountExpr, AtomicType::UniformInt32,
3586  "task launch count");
3587  if (launchCountExpr == NULL)
3588  return NULL;
3589  }
3590  else {
3591  if (isLaunch) {
3592  Error(pos, "\"launch\" expression illegal with non-\"task\"-"
3593  "qualified function.");
3594  return NULL;
3595  }
3596  AssertPos(pos, launchCountExpr == NULL);
3597  }
3598  }
3599  else {
3600  // Call through a function pointer
3601  const Type *fptrType = func->GetType();
3602  if (fptrType == NULL)
3603  return NULL;
3604 
3605  // Make sure we do in fact have a function to call
3606  const FunctionType *funcType;
3607  if (CastType<PointerType>(fptrType) == NULL ||
3608  (funcType = CastType<FunctionType>(fptrType->GetBaseType())) == NULL) {
3609  Error(func->pos, "Must provide function name or function pointer for "
3610  "function call expression.");
3611  return NULL;
3612  }
3613 
3614  // Make sure we don't have too many arguments for the function
3615  if ((int)argTypes.size() > funcType->GetNumParameters()) {
3616  Error(args->pos, "Too many parameter values provided in "
3617  "function call (%d provided, %d expected).",
3618  (int)argTypes.size(), funcType->GetNumParameters());
3619  return NULL;
3620  }
3621  // It's ok to have too few arguments, as long as the function's
3622  // default parameter values have started by the time we run out
3623  // of arguments
3624  if ((int)argTypes.size() < funcType->GetNumParameters() &&
3625  funcType->GetParameterDefault(argTypes.size()) == NULL) {
3626  Error(args->pos, "Too few parameter values provided in "
3627  "function call (%d provided, %d expected).",
3628  (int)argTypes.size(), funcType->GetNumParameters());
3629  return NULL;
3630  }
3631 
3632  // Now make sure they can all type convert to the corresponding
3633  // parameter types..
3634  for (int i = 0; i < (int)argTypes.size(); ++i) {
3635  if (i < funcType->GetNumParameters()) {
3636  // make sure it can type convert
3637  const Type *paramType = funcType->GetParameterType(i);
3638  if (CanConvertTypes(argTypes[i], paramType) == false &&
3639  !(argCouldBeNULL[i] == true &&
3640  CastType<PointerType>(paramType) != NULL)) {
3641  Error(args->exprs[i]->pos, "Can't convert argument of "
3642  "type \"%s\" to type \"%s\" for function call "
3643  "argument.", argTypes[i]->GetString().c_str(),
3644  paramType->GetString().c_str());
3645  return NULL;
3646  }
3647  }
3648  else
3649  // Otherwise the parameter default saves us. It should
3650  // be there for sure, given the check right above the
3651  // for loop.
3652  AssertPos(pos, funcType->GetParameterDefault(i) != NULL);
3653  }
3654 
3655  if (fptrType->IsVaryingType()) {
3656  const Type *retType = funcType->GetReturnType();
3657  if (Type::Equal(retType, AtomicType::Void) == false &&
3658  retType->IsUniformType()) {
3659  Error(pos, "Illegal to call a varying function pointer that "
3660  "points to a function with a uniform return type \"%s\".",
3661  funcType->GetReturnType()->GetString().c_str());
3662  return NULL;
3663  }
3664  }
3665  }
3666 
3667  if (func == NULL || args == NULL)
3668  return NULL;
3669  return this;
3670 }
3671 
3672 
3673 int
3674 FunctionCallExpr::EstimateCost() const {
3675  if (isLaunch)
3676  return COST_TASK_LAUNCH;
3677 
3678  const Type *type = func->GetType();
3679  if (type == NULL)
3680  return 0;
3681 
3682  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
3683  if (pt != NULL)
3684  type = type->GetBaseType();
3685  const FunctionType *ftype = CastType<FunctionType>(type);
3686 
3687  if (ftype->costOverride > -1)
3688  return ftype->costOverride;
3689 
3690  if (pt != NULL)
3691  return pt->IsUniformType() ? COST_FUNPTR_UNIFORM : COST_FUNPTR_VARYING;
3692  else
3693  return COST_FUNCALL;
3694 }
3695 
3696 
3697 void
3698 FunctionCallExpr::Print() const {
3699  if (!func || !args || !GetType())
3700  return;
3701 
3702  printf("[%s] funcall %s ", GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
3703  isLaunch ? "launch" : "");
3704  func->Print();
3705  printf(" args (");
3706  args->Print();
3707  printf(")");
3708  pos.Print();
3709 }
3710 
3711 
3712 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3713 // ExprList
3714 
3715 llvm::Value *
3716 ExprList::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
3717  FATAL("ExprList::GetValue() should never be called");
3718  return NULL;
3719 }
3720 
3721 
3722 const Type *
3723 ExprList::GetType() const {
3724  FATAL("ExprList::GetType() should never be called");
3725  return NULL;
3726 }
3727 
3728 
3729 ExprList *
3730 ExprList::Optimize() {
3731  return this;
3732 }
3733 
3734 
3735 ExprList *
3736 ExprList::TypeCheck() {
3737  return this;
3738 }
3739 
3740 
3741 llvm::Constant *
3742 ExprList::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
3743  if (exprs.size() == 1 &&
3744  (CastType<AtomicType>(type) != NULL ||
3745  CastType<EnumType>(type) != NULL ||
3746  CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL))
3747  return exprs[0]->GetConstant(type);
3748 
3749  const CollectionType *collectionType = CastType<CollectionType>(type);
3750  if (collectionType == NULL)
3751  return NULL;
3752 
3753  std::string name;
3754  if (CastType<StructType>(type) != NULL)
3755  name = "struct";
3756  else if (CastType<ArrayType>(type) != NULL)
3757  name = "array";
3758  else if (CastType<VectorType>(type) != NULL)
3759  name = "vector";
3760  else
3761  FATAL("Unexpected CollectionType in ExprList::GetConstant()");
3762 
3763  if ((int)exprs.size() > collectionType->GetElementCount()) {
3764  Error(pos, "Initializer list for %s \"%s\" must have no more than %d "
3765  "elements (has %d).", name.c_str(),
3766  collectionType->GetString().c_str(),
3767  collectionType->GetElementCount(), (int)exprs.size());
3768  return NULL;
3769  }
3770 
3771  std::vector<llvm::Constant *> cv;
3772  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < exprs.size(); ++i) {
3773  if (exprs[i] == NULL)
3774  return NULL;
3775  const Type *elementType = collectionType->GetElementType(i);
3776 
3777  Expr *expr = exprs[i];
3778  if (dynamic_cast<ExprList *>(expr) == NULL) {
3779  // If there's a simple type conversion from the type of this
3780  // expression to the type we need, then let the regular type
3781  // conversion machinery handle it.
3782  expr = TypeConvertExpr(exprs[i], elementType, "initializer list");
3783  if (expr == NULL) {
3784  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
3785  return NULL;
3786  }
3787  // Re-establish const-ness if possible
3788  expr = ::Optimize(expr);
3789  }
3790 
3791  llvm::Constant *c = expr->GetConstant(elementType);
3792  if (c == NULL)
3793  // If this list element couldn't convert to the right constant
3794  // type for the corresponding collection member, then give up.
3795  return NULL;
3796  cv.push_back(c);
3797  }
3798 
3799  // If there are too few, then treat missing ones as if they were zero
3800  for (int i = (int)exprs.size(); i < collectionType->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
3801  const Type *elementType = collectionType->GetElementType(i);
3802  if (elementType == NULL) {
3803  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
3804  return NULL;
3805  }
3806 
3807  llvm::Type *llvmType = elementType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
3808  if (llvmType == NULL) {
3809  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
3810  return NULL;
3811  }
3812 
3813  llvm::Constant *c = llvm::Constant::getNullValue(llvmType);
3814  cv.push_back(c);
3815  }
3816 
3817  if (CastType<StructType>(type) != NULL) {
3818  llvm::StructType *llvmStructType =
3819  llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::StructType>(collectionType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
3820  AssertPos(pos, llvmStructType != NULL);
3821  return llvm::ConstantStruct::get(llvmStructType, cv);
3822  }
3823  else {
3824  llvm::Type *lt = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
3825  llvm::ArrayType *lat =
3826  llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::ArrayType>(lt);
3827  if (lat != NULL)
3828  return llvm::ConstantArray::get(lat, cv);
3829  else {
3830  // uniform short vector type
3831  AssertPos(pos, type->IsUniformType() &&
3832  CastType<VectorType>(type) != NULL);
3833 
3834  llvm::VectorType *lvt =
3835  llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::VectorType>(lt);
3836  AssertPos(pos, lvt != NULL);
3837 
3838  // Uniform short vectors are stored as vectors of length
3839  // rounded up to the native vector width. So we add additional
3840  // undef values here until we get the right size.
3841  int vectorWidth = g->target->getNativeVectorWidth();
3842  const VectorType *vt = CastType<VectorType>(type);
3843  const AtomicType *bt = vt->GetElementType();
3844 
3845  if (Type::Equal(bt->GetAsUniformType(), AtomicType::UniformInt64) ||
3846  Type::Equal(bt->GetAsUniformType(), AtomicType::UniformUInt64) ||
3847  Type::Equal(bt->GetAsUniformType(), AtomicType::UniformDouble)) {
3848  // target.nativeVectorWidth should be in terms of 32-bit
3849  // values, so for the 64-bit guys, it takes half as many of
3850  // them to fill the native width
3851  vectorWidth /= 2;
3852  }
3853 
3854  while ((cv.size() % vectorWidth) != 0) {
3855  cv.push_back(llvm::UndefValue::get(lvt->getElementType()));
3856  }
3857 
3858  return llvm::ConstantVector::get(cv);
3859  }
3860  }
3861  return NULL;
3862 }
3863 
3864 
3865 int
3866 ExprList::EstimateCost() const {
3867  return 0;
3868 }
3869 
3870 
3871 void
3872 ExprList::Print() const {
3873  printf("expr list (");
3874  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < exprs.size(); ++i) {
3875  if (exprs[i] != NULL)
3876  exprs[i]->Print();
3877  printf("%s", (i == exprs.size() - 1) ? ")" : ", ");
3878  }
3879  pos.Print();
3880 }
3881 
3882 
3883 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
3884 // IndexExpr
3885 
3886 IndexExpr::IndexExpr(Expr *a, Expr *i, SourcePos p)
3887  : Expr(p) {
3888  baseExpr = a;
3889  index = i;
3890  type = lvalueType = NULL;
3891 }
3892 
3893 
3894 /** When computing pointer values, we need to apply a per-lane offset when
3895  we have a varying pointer that is itself indexing into varying data.
3896  Consdier the following ispc code:
3897 
3898  uniform float u[] = ...;
3899  float v[] = ...;
3900  int index = ...;
3901  float a = u[index];
3902  float b = v[index];
3903 
3904  To compute the varying pointer that holds the addresses to load from
3905  for u[index], we basically just need to multiply index element-wise by
3906  sizeof(float) before doing the memory load. For v[index], we need to
3907  do the same scaling but also need to add per-lane offsets <0,
3908  sizeof(float), 2*sizeof(float), ...> so that the i'th lane loads the
3909  i'th of the varying values at its index value.
3910 
3911  This function handles figuring out when this additional offset is
3912  needed and then incorporates it in the varying pointer value.
3913  */
3914 static llvm::Value *
3915 lAddVaryingOffsetsIfNeeded(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *ptr,
3916  const Type *ptrRefType) {
3917  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(ptrRefType) != NULL)
3918  // References are uniform pointers, so no offsetting is needed
3919  return ptr;
3920 
3921  const PointerType *ptrType = CastType<PointerType>(ptrRefType);
3922  Assert(ptrType != NULL);
3923  if (ptrType->IsUniformType() || ptrType->IsSlice())
3924  return ptr;
3925 
3926  const Type *baseType = ptrType->GetBaseType();
3927  if (baseType->IsVaryingType() == false)
3928  return ptr;
3929 
3930  // must be indexing into varying atomic, enum, or pointer types
3931  if (Type::IsBasicType(baseType) == false)
3932  return ptr;
3933 
3934  // Onward: compute the per lane offsets.
3935  llvm::Value *varyingOffsets = ctx->ProgramIndexVector();
3936 
3937  // And finally add the per-lane offsets. Note that we lie to the GEP
3938  // call and tell it that the pointers are to uniform elements and not
3939  // varying elements, so that the offsets in terms of (0,1,2,...) will
3940  // end up turning into the correct step in bytes...
3941  const Type *uniformElementType = baseType->GetAsUniformType();
3942  const Type *ptrUnifType = PointerType::GetVarying(uniformElementType);
3943  return ctx->GetElementPtrInst(ptr, varyingOffsets, ptrUnifType);
3944 }
3945 
3946 
3947 /** Check to see if the given type is an array of or pointer to a varying
3948  struct type that in turn has a member with bound 'uniform' variability.
3949  Issue an error and return true if such a member is found.
3950  */
3951 static bool
3952 lVaryingStructHasUniformMember(const Type *type, SourcePos pos) {
3953  if (CastType<VectorType>(type) != NULL ||
3954  CastType<ReferenceType>(type) != NULL)
3955  return false;
3956 
3957  const StructType *st = CastType<StructType>(type);
3958  if (st == NULL) {
3959  const ArrayType *at = CastType<ArrayType>(type);
3960  if (at != NULL)
3961  st = CastType<StructType>(at->GetElementType());
3962  else {
3963  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
3964  if (pt == NULL)
3965  return false;
3966 
3967  st = CastType<StructType>(pt->GetBaseType());
3968  }
3969 
3970  if (st == NULL)
3971  return false;
3972  }
3973 
3974  if (st->IsVaryingType() == false)
3975  return false;
3976 
3977  for (int i = 0; i < st->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
3978  const Type *eltType = st->GetElementType(i);
3979  if (eltType == NULL) {
3980  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
3981  continue;
3982  }
3983 
3984  if (CastType<StructType>(eltType) != NULL) {
3985  // We know that the enclosing struct is varying at this point,
3986  // so push that down to the enclosed struct before makign the
3987  // recursive call.
3988  eltType = eltType->GetAsVaryingType();
3989  if (lVaryingStructHasUniformMember(eltType, pos))
3990  return true;
3991  }
3992  else if (eltType->IsUniformType()) {
3993  Error(pos, "Gather operation is impossible due to the presence of "
3994  "struct member \"%s\" with uniform type \"%s\" in the "
3995  "varying struct type \"%s\".",
3996  st->GetElementName(i).c_str(), eltType->GetString().c_str(),
3997  st->GetString().c_str());
3998  return true;
3999  }
4000  }
4001 
4002  return false;
4003 }
4004 
4005 
4006 llvm::Value *
4007 IndexExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
4008  const Type *indexType, *returnType;
4009  if (baseExpr == NULL || index == NULL ||
4010  ((indexType = index->GetType()) == NULL) ||
4011  ((returnType = GetType()) == NULL)) {
4012  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4013  return NULL;
4014  }
4015 
4016  // If this is going to be a gather, make sure that the varying return
4017  // type can represent the result (i.e. that we don't have a bound
4018  // 'uniform' member in a varying struct...)
4019  if (indexType->IsVaryingType() &&
4020  lVaryingStructHasUniformMember(returnType, pos))
4021  return NULL;
4022 
4023  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4024 
4025  llvm::Value *ptr = GetLValue(ctx);
4026  llvm::Value *mask = NULL;
4027  const Type *lvType = GetLValueType();
4028  if (ptr == NULL) {
4029  // We may be indexing into a temporary that hasn't hit memory, so
4030  // get the full value and stuff it into temporary alloca'd space so
4031  // that we can index from there...
4032  const Type *baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType();
4033  llvm::Value *val = baseExpr->GetValue(ctx);
4034  if (baseExprType == NULL || val == NULL) {
4035  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4036  return NULL;
4037  }
4038  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4039  llvm::Value *tmpPtr = ctx->AllocaInst(baseExprType->LLVMType(g->ctx),
4040  "array_tmp");
4041  ctx->StoreInst(val, tmpPtr);
4042 
4043  // Get a pointer type to the underlying elements
4044  const SequentialType *st = CastType<SequentialType>(baseExprType);
4045  if (st == NULL) {
4046  Assert(m->errorCount > 0);
4047  return NULL;
4048  }
4049  lvType = PointerType::GetUniform(st->GetElementType());
4050 
4051  // And do the indexing calculation into the temporary array in memory
4052  ptr = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(tmpPtr, LLVMInt32(0), index->GetValue(ctx),
4053  PointerType::GetUniform(baseExprType));
4054  ptr = lAddVaryingOffsetsIfNeeded(ctx, ptr, lvType);
4055 
4056  mask = LLVMMaskAllOn;
4057  }
4058  else {
4059  Symbol *baseSym = GetBaseSymbol();
4060  if (dynamic_cast<FunctionCallExpr *>(baseExpr) == NULL) {
4061  // Only check for non-function calls
4062  AssertPos(pos, baseSym != NULL);
4063  }
4064  mask = lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx);
4065  }
4066 
4067  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4068  return ctx->LoadInst(ptr, mask, lvType);
4069 }
4070 
4071 
4072 const Type *
4073 IndexExpr::GetType() const {
4074  if (type != NULL)
4075  return type;
4076 
4077  const Type *baseExprType, *indexType;
4078  if (!baseExpr || !index ||
4079  ((baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType()) == NULL) ||
4080  ((indexType = index->GetType()) == NULL))
4081  return NULL;
4082 
4083  const Type *elementType = NULL;
4084  const PointerType *pointerType = CastType<PointerType>(baseExprType);
4085  if (pointerType != NULL)
4086  // ptr[index] -> type that the pointer points to
4087  elementType = pointerType->GetBaseType();
4088  else {
4089  // sequential type[index] -> element type of the sequential type
4090  const SequentialType *sequentialType =
4091  CastType<SequentialType>(baseExprType->GetReferenceTarget());
4092  // Typechecking should have caught this...
4093  AssertPos(pos, sequentialType != NULL);
4094  elementType = sequentialType->GetElementType();
4095  }
4096 
4097  // If we're indexing into a sequence of SOA types, the result type is
4098  // actually the underlying type, as a uniform or varying. Get the
4099  // uniform variant of it for starters, then below we'll make it varying
4100  // if the index is varying.
4101  // (If we ever provide a way to index into SOA types and get an entire
4102  // SOA'd struct out of the array, then we won't want to do this in that
4103  // case..)
4104  if (elementType->IsSOAType())
4105  elementType = elementType->GetAsUniformType();
4106 
4107  // If either the index is varying or we're indexing into a varying
4108  // pointer, then the result type is the varying variant of the indexed
4109  // type.
4110  if (indexType->IsUniformType() &&
4111  (pointerType == NULL || pointerType->IsUniformType()))
4112  type = elementType;
4113  else
4114  type = elementType->GetAsVaryingType();
4115 
4116  return type;
4117 }
4118 
4119 
4120 Symbol *
4121 IndexExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
4122  return baseExpr ? baseExpr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
4123 }
4124 
4125 
4126 /** Utility routine that takes a regualr pointer (either uniform or
4127  varying) and returns a slice pointer with zero offsets.
4128  */
4129 static llvm::Value *
4130 lConvertToSlicePointer(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *ptr,
4131  const PointerType *slicePtrType) {
4132  llvm::Type *llvmSlicePtrType =
4133  slicePtrType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
4134  llvm::StructType *sliceStructType =
4135  llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::StructType>(llvmSlicePtrType);
4136  Assert(sliceStructType != NULL &&
4137  sliceStructType->getElementType(0) == ptr->getType());
4138 
4139  // Get a null-initialized struct to take care of having zeros for the
4140  // offsets
4141  llvm::Value *result = llvm::Constant::getNullValue(sliceStructType);
4142  // And replace the pointer in the struct with the given pointer
4143  return ctx->InsertInst(result, ptr, 0, LLVMGetName(ptr, "_slice"));
4144 }
4145 
4146 
4147 /** If the given array index is a compile time constant, check to see if it
4148  value/values don't go past the end of the array; issue a warning if
4149  so.
4150 */
4151 static void
4152 lCheckIndicesVersusBounds(const Type *baseExprType, Expr *index) {
4153  const SequentialType *seqType = CastType<SequentialType>(baseExprType);
4154  if (seqType == NULL)
4155  return;
4156 
4157  int nElements = seqType->GetElementCount();
4158  if (nElements == 0)
4159  // Unsized array...
4160  return;
4161 
4162  // If it's an array of soa<> items, then the number of elements to
4163  // worry about w.r.t. index values is the product of the array size and
4164  // the soa width.
4165  int soaWidth = seqType->GetElementType()->GetSOAWidth();
4166  if (soaWidth > 0)
4167  nElements *= soaWidth;
4168 
4169  ConstExpr *ce = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(index);
4170  if (ce == NULL)
4171  return;
4172 
4173  int32_t indices[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
4174  int count = ce->AsInt32(indices);
4175  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i) {
4176  if (indices[i] < 0 || indices[i] >= nElements)
4177  Warning(index->pos, "Array index \"%d\" may be out of bounds for %d "
4178  "element array.", indices[i], nElements);
4179  }
4180 }
4181 
4182 
4183 /** Converts the given pointer value to a slice pointer if the pointer
4184  points to SOA'ed data.
4185 */
4186 static llvm::Value *
4187 lConvertPtrToSliceIfNeeded(FunctionEmitContext *ctx,
4188  llvm::Value *ptr, const Type **type) {
4189  Assert(*type != NULL);
4190  const PointerType *ptrType = CastType<PointerType>(*type);
4191  bool convertToSlice = (ptrType->GetBaseType()->IsSOAType() &&
4192  ptrType->IsSlice() == false);
4193  if (convertToSlice == false)
4194  return ptr;
4195 
4196  *type = ptrType->GetAsSlice();
4197  return lConvertToSlicePointer(ctx, ptr, ptrType->GetAsSlice());
4198 }
4199 
4200 
4201 llvm::Value *
4202 IndexExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
4203  const Type *baseExprType;
4204  if (baseExpr == NULL || index == NULL ||
4205  ((baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType()) == NULL)) {
4206  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4207  return NULL;
4208  }
4209 
4210  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4211  llvm::Value *indexValue = index->GetValue(ctx);
4212  if (indexValue == NULL) {
4213  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4214  return NULL;
4215  }
4216 
4217  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4218  if (CastType<PointerType>(baseExprType) != NULL) {
4219  // We're indexing off of a pointer
4220  llvm::Value *basePtrValue = baseExpr->GetValue(ctx);
4221  if (basePtrValue == NULL) {
4222  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4223  return NULL;
4224  }
4225  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4226 
4227  // Convert to a slice pointer if we're indexing into SOA data
4228  basePtrValue = lConvertPtrToSliceIfNeeded(ctx, basePtrValue,
4229  &baseExprType);
4230 
4231  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(basePtrValue, indexValue,
4232  baseExprType,
4233  LLVMGetName(basePtrValue, "_offset"));
4234  return lAddVaryingOffsetsIfNeeded(ctx, ptr, GetLValueType());
4235  }
4236 
4237  // Not a pointer: we must be indexing an array or vector (and possibly
4238  // a reference thereuponfore.)
4239  llvm::Value *basePtr = NULL;
4240  const PointerType *basePtrType = NULL;
4241  if (CastType<ArrayType>(baseExprType) ||
4242  CastType<VectorType>(baseExprType)) {
4243  basePtr = baseExpr->GetLValue(ctx);
4244  basePtrType = CastType<PointerType>(baseExpr->GetLValueType());
4245  if (baseExpr->GetLValueType()) AssertPos(pos, basePtrType != NULL);
4246  }
4247  else {
4248  baseExprType = baseExprType->GetReferenceTarget();
4249  AssertPos(pos, CastType<ArrayType>(baseExprType) ||
4250  CastType<VectorType>(baseExprType));
4251  basePtr = baseExpr->GetValue(ctx);
4252  basePtrType = PointerType::GetUniform(baseExprType);
4253  }
4254  if (!basePtr)
4255  return NULL;
4256 
4257  // If possible, check the index value(s) against the size of the array
4258  lCheckIndicesVersusBounds(baseExprType, index);
4259 
4260  // Convert to a slice pointer if indexing into SOA data
4261  basePtr = lConvertPtrToSliceIfNeeded(ctx, basePtr,
4262  (const Type **)&basePtrType);
4263 
4264  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4265 
4266  // And do the actual indexing calculation..
4267  llvm::Value *ptr =
4268  ctx->GetElementPtrInst(basePtr, LLVMInt32(0), indexValue,
4269  basePtrType, LLVMGetName(basePtr, "_offset"));
4270  return lAddVaryingOffsetsIfNeeded(ctx, ptr, GetLValueType());
4271 }
4272 
4273 
4274 const Type *
4275 IndexExpr::GetLValueType() const {
4276  if (lvalueType != NULL)
4277  return lvalueType;
4278 
4279  const Type *baseExprType, *baseExprLValueType, *indexType;
4280  if (baseExpr == NULL || index == NULL ||
4281  ((baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType()) == NULL) ||
4282  ((baseExprLValueType = baseExpr->GetLValueType()) == NULL) ||
4283  ((indexType = index->GetType()) == NULL))
4284  return NULL;
4285 
4286  // regularize to a PointerType
4287  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(baseExprLValueType) != NULL) {
4288  const Type *refTarget = baseExprLValueType->GetReferenceTarget();
4289  baseExprLValueType = PointerType::GetUniform(refTarget);
4290  }
4291  AssertPos(pos, CastType<PointerType>(baseExprLValueType) != NULL);
4292 
4293  // Find the type of thing that we're indexing into
4294  const Type *elementType;
4295  const SequentialType *st =
4296  CastType<SequentialType>(baseExprLValueType->GetBaseType());
4297  if (st != NULL)
4298  elementType = st->GetElementType();
4299  else {
4300  const PointerType *pt =
4301  CastType<PointerType>(baseExprLValueType->GetBaseType());
4302  // This assertion seems overly strict.
4303  // Why does it need to be a pointer to a pointer?
4304  // AssertPos(pos, pt != NULL);
4305 
4306  if (pt != NULL) {
4307  elementType = pt->GetBaseType();
4308  }
4309  else {
4310  elementType = baseExprLValueType->GetBaseType();
4311  }
4312  }
4313 
4314  // Are we indexing into a varying type, or are we indexing with a
4315  // varying pointer?
4316  bool baseVarying;
4317  if (CastType<PointerType>(baseExprType) != NULL)
4318  baseVarying = baseExprType->IsVaryingType();
4319  else
4320  baseVarying = baseExprLValueType->IsVaryingType();
4321 
4322  // The return type is uniform iff. the base is a uniform pointer / a
4323  // collection of uniform typed elements and the index is uniform.
4324  if (baseVarying == false && indexType->IsUniformType())
4325  lvalueType = PointerType::GetUniform(elementType);
4326  else
4327  lvalueType = PointerType::GetVarying(elementType);
4328 
4329  // Finally, if we're indexing into an SOA type, then the resulting
4330  // pointer must (currently) be a slice pointer; we don't allow indexing
4331  // the soa-width-wide structs directly.
4332  if (elementType->IsSOAType())
4333  lvalueType = lvalueType->GetAsSlice();
4334 
4335  return lvalueType;
4336 }
4337 
4338 
4339 Expr *
4340 IndexExpr::Optimize() {
4341  if (baseExpr == NULL || index == NULL)
4342  return NULL;
4343  return this;
4344 }
4345 
4346 
4347 Expr *
4348 IndexExpr::TypeCheck() {
4349  const Type *indexType;
4350  if (baseExpr == NULL || index == NULL ||
4351  ((indexType = index->GetType()) == NULL)) {
4352  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4353  return NULL;
4354  }
4355 
4356  const Type *baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType();
4357  if (baseExprType == NULL) {
4358  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4359  return NULL;
4360  }
4361 
4362  if (!CastType<SequentialType>(baseExprType->GetReferenceTarget())) {
4363  if (const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(baseExprType)) {
4364  if (Type::Equal(AtomicType::Void, pt->GetBaseType())) {
4365  Error(pos, "Illegal to dereference void pointer type \"%s\".",
4366  baseExprType->GetString().c_str());
4367  return NULL;
4368  }
4369  }
4370  else {
4371  Error(pos, "Trying to index into non-array, vector, or pointer "
4372  "type \"%s\".", baseExprType->GetString().c_str());
4373  return NULL;
4374  }
4375  }
4376 
4377  bool isUniform = (index->GetType()->IsUniformType() &&
4378  !g->opt.disableUniformMemoryOptimizations);
4379 
4380  if (!isUniform) {
4381  // Unless we have an explicit 64-bit index and are compiling to a
4382  // 64-bit target with 64-bit addressing, convert the index to an int32
4383  // type.
4384  // The range of varying index is limited to [0,2^31) as a result.
4385  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(indexType->GetAsUniformType(),
4386  AtomicType::UniformInt64) == false ||
4387  g->target->is32Bit() ||
4388  g->opt.force32BitAddressing) {
4389  const Type *indexType = AtomicType::VaryingInt32;
4390  index = TypeConvertExpr(index, indexType, "array index");
4391  if (index == NULL)
4392  return NULL;
4393  }
4394  } else { // isUniform
4395  // For 32-bit target:
4396  // force the index to 32 bit.
4397  // For 64-bit target:
4398  // We don't want to limit the index range.
4399  // We sxt/zxt the index to 64 bit right here because
4400  // LLVM doesn't distinguish unsigned from signed (both are i32)
4401  //
4402  // However, the index can be still truncated to signed int32 if
4403  // the index type is 64 bit and --addressing=32.
4404  bool force_32bit = g->target->is32Bit() ||
4405  (g->opt.force32BitAddressing &&
4406  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(indexType->GetAsUniformType(),
4407  AtomicType::UniformInt64));
4408  const Type *indexType = force_32bit ?
4409  AtomicType::UniformInt32 : AtomicType::UniformInt64;
4410  index = TypeConvertExpr(index, indexType, "array index");
4411  if (index == NULL)
4412  return NULL;
4413  }
4414 
4415  return this;
4416 }
4417 
4418 
4419 int
4420 IndexExpr::EstimateCost() const {
4421  if (index == NULL || baseExpr == NULL)
4422  return 0;
4423 
4424  const Type *indexType = index->GetType();
4425  const Type *baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType();
4426 
4427  if ((indexType != NULL && indexType->IsVaryingType()) ||
4428  (CastType<PointerType>(baseExprType) != NULL &&
4429  baseExprType->IsVaryingType()))
4430  // be pessimistic; some of these will later turn out to be vector
4431  // loads/stores, but it's too early for us to know that here.
4432  return COST_GATHER;
4433  else
4434  return COST_LOAD;
4435 }
4436 
4437 
4438 void
4439 IndexExpr::Print() const {
4440  if (!baseExpr || !index || !GetType())
4441  return;
4442 
4443  printf("[%s] index ", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
4444  baseExpr->Print();
4445  printf("[");
4446  index->Print();
4447  printf("]");
4448  pos.Print();
4449 }
4450 
4451 
4452 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
4453 // MemberExpr
4454 
4455 /** Map one character ids to vector element numbers. Allow a few different
4456  conventions--xyzw, rgba, uv.
4457 */
4458 static int
4459 lIdentifierToVectorElement(char id) {
4460  switch (id) {
4461  case 'x':
4462  case 'r':
4463  case 'u':
4464  return 0;
4465  case 'y':
4466  case 'g':
4467  case 'v':
4468  return 1;
4469  case 'z':
4470  case 'b':
4471  return 2;
4472  case 'w':
4473  case 'a':
4474  return 3;
4475  default:
4476  return -1;
4477  }
4478 }
4479 
4480 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
4481 // StructMemberExpr
4482 
4483 class StructMemberExpr : public MemberExpr
4484 {
4485 public:
4486  StructMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
4487  SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue);
4488 
4489  const Type *GetType() const;
4490  const Type *GetLValueType() const;
4491  int getElementNumber() const;
4492  const Type *getElementType() const;
4493 
4494 private:
4495  const StructType *getStructType() const;
4496 };
4497 
4498 
4499 StructMemberExpr::StructMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
4500  SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue)
4501  : MemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, derefLValue) {
4502 }
4503 
4504 
4505 const Type *
4506 StructMemberExpr::GetType() const {
4507  if (type != NULL)
4508  return type;
4509 
4510  // It's a struct, and the result type is the element type, possibly
4511  // promoted to varying if the struct type / lvalue is varying.
4512  const Type *exprType, *lvalueType;
4513  const StructType *structType;
4514  if (expr == NULL ||
4515  ((exprType = expr->GetType()) == NULL) ||
4516  ((structType = getStructType()) == NULL) ||
4517  ((lvalueType = GetLValueType()) == NULL)) {
4518  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4519  return NULL;
4520  }
4521 
4522  const Type *elementType = structType->GetElementType(identifier);
4523  if (elementType == NULL) {
4524  Error(identifierPos,
4525  "Element name \"%s\" not present in struct type \"%s\".%s",
4526  identifier.c_str(), structType->GetString().c_str(),
4527  getCandidateNearMatches().c_str());
4528  return NULL;
4529  }
4530  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(lvalueType->GetBaseType(), elementType));
4531 
4532  bool isSlice = (CastType<PointerType>(lvalueType) &&
4533  CastType<PointerType>(lvalueType)->IsSlice());
4534  if (isSlice) {
4535  // FIXME: not true if we allow bound unif/varying for soa<>
4536  // structs?...
4537  AssertPos(pos, elementType->IsSOAType());
4538 
4539  // If we're accessing a member of an soa structure via a uniform
4540  // slice pointer, then the result type is the uniform variant of
4541  // the element type.
4542  if (lvalueType->IsUniformType())
4543  elementType = elementType->GetAsUniformType();
4544  }
4545 
4546  if (lvalueType->IsVaryingType())
4547  // If the expression we're getting the member of has an lvalue that
4548  // is a varying pointer type (be it slice or non-slice), then the
4549  // result type must be the varying version of the element type.
4550  elementType = elementType->GetAsVaryingType();
4551 
4552  type = elementType;
4553  return type;
4554 }
4555 
4556 
4557 const Type *
4558 StructMemberExpr::GetLValueType() const {
4559  if (lvalueType != NULL)
4560  return lvalueType;
4561 
4562  if (expr == NULL) {
4563  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4564  return NULL;
4565  }
4566 
4567  const Type *exprLValueType = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetType() :
4568  expr->GetLValueType();
4569  if (exprLValueType == NULL) {
4570  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4571  return NULL;
4572  }
4573 
4574  // The pointer type is varying if the lvalue type of the expression is
4575  // varying (and otherwise uniform)
4576  const PointerType *ptrType =
4577  (exprLValueType->IsUniformType() ||
4578  CastType<ReferenceType>(exprLValueType) != NULL) ?
4579  PointerType::GetUniform(getElementType()) :
4580  PointerType::GetVarying(getElementType());
4581 
4582  // If struct pointer is a slice pointer, the resulting member pointer
4583  // needs to be a frozen slice pointer--i.e. any further indexing with
4584  // the result shouldn't modify the minor slice offset, but it should be
4585  // left unchanged until we get to a leaf SOA value.
4586  if (CastType<PointerType>(exprLValueType) &&
4587  CastType<PointerType>(exprLValueType)->IsSlice())
4588  ptrType = ptrType->GetAsFrozenSlice();
4589 
4590  lvalueType = ptrType;
4591  return lvalueType;
4592 }
4593 
4594 
4595 int
4596 StructMemberExpr::getElementNumber() const {
4597  const StructType *structType = getStructType();
4598  if (structType == NULL)
4599  return -1;
4600 
4601  int elementNumber = structType->GetElementNumber(identifier);
4602  if (elementNumber == -1)
4603  Error(identifierPos,
4604  "Element name \"%s\" not present in struct type \"%s\".%s",
4605  identifier.c_str(), structType->GetString().c_str(),
4606  getCandidateNearMatches().c_str());
4607 
4608  return elementNumber;
4609 }
4610 
4611 
4612 const Type *
4613 StructMemberExpr::getElementType() const {
4614  const StructType *structType = getStructType();
4615  if (structType == NULL)
4616  return NULL;
4617 
4618  return structType->GetElementType(identifier);
4619 }
4620 
4621 
4622 /** Returns the type of the underlying struct that we're returning a member
4623  of. */
4624 const StructType *
4625 StructMemberExpr::getStructType() const {
4626  const Type *type = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetType() :
4627  expr->GetLValueType();
4628  if (type == NULL)
4629  return NULL;
4630 
4631  const Type *structType;
4632  const ReferenceType *rt = CastType<ReferenceType>(type);
4633  if (rt != NULL)
4634  structType = rt->GetReferenceTarget();
4635  else {
4636  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
4637  AssertPos(pos, pt != NULL);
4638  structType = pt->GetBaseType();
4639  }
4640 
4641  const StructType *ret = CastType<StructType>(structType);
4642  AssertPos(pos, ret != NULL);
4643  return ret;
4644 }
4645 
4646 
4647 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
4648 // VectorMemberExpr
4649 
4650 class VectorMemberExpr : public MemberExpr
4651 {
4652 public:
4653  VectorMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
4654  SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue);
4655 
4656  llvm::Value *GetValue(FunctionEmitContext* ctx) const;
4657  llvm::Value *GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext* ctx) const;
4658  const Type *GetType() const;
4659  const Type *GetLValueType() const;
4660 
4661  int getElementNumber() const;
4662  const Type *getElementType() const;
4663 
4664 private:
4665  const VectorType *exprVectorType;
4666  const VectorType *memberType;
4667 };
4668 
4669 
4670 VectorMemberExpr::VectorMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
4671  SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue)
4672  : MemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, derefLValue) {
4673  const Type *exprType = e->GetType();
4674  exprVectorType = CastType<VectorType>(exprType);
4675  if (exprVectorType == NULL) {
4676  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(exprType);
4677  if (pt != NULL)
4678  exprVectorType = CastType<VectorType>(pt->GetBaseType());
4679  else {
4680  AssertPos(pos, CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType) != NULL);
4681  exprVectorType =
4682  CastType<VectorType>(exprType->GetReferenceTarget());
4683  }
4684  AssertPos(pos, exprVectorType != NULL);
4685  }
4686  memberType = new VectorType(exprVectorType->GetElementType(),
4687  identifier.length());
4688 }
4689 
4690 
4691 const Type *
4692 VectorMemberExpr::GetType() const {
4693  if (type != NULL)
4694  return type;
4695 
4696  // For 1-element expressions, we have the base vector element
4697  // type. For n-element expressions, we have a shortvec type
4698  // with n > 1 elements. This can be changed when we get
4699  // type<1> -> type conversions.
4700  type = (identifier.length() == 1) ?
4701  (const Type *)exprVectorType->GetElementType() :
4702  (const Type *)memberType;
4703 
4704  const Type *lvType = GetLValueType();
4705  if (lvType != NULL) {
4706  bool isSlice = (CastType<PointerType>(lvType) &&
4707  CastType<PointerType>(lvType)->IsSlice());
4708  if (isSlice) {
4709 //CO AssertPos(pos, type->IsSOAType());
4710  if (lvType->IsUniformType())
4711  type = type->GetAsUniformType();
4712  }
4713 
4714  if (lvType->IsVaryingType())
4715  type = type->GetAsVaryingType();
4716  }
4717 
4718  return type;
4719 }
4720 
4721 
4722 llvm::Value *
4723 VectorMemberExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext* ctx) const {
4724  if (identifier.length() == 1) {
4725  return MemberExpr::GetLValue(ctx);
4726  } else {
4727  return NULL;
4728  }
4729 }
4730 
4731 
4732 const Type *
4733 VectorMemberExpr::GetLValueType() const {
4734  if (lvalueType != NULL)
4735  return lvalueType;
4736 
4737  if (identifier.length() == 1) {
4738  if (expr == NULL) {
4739  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4740  return NULL;
4741  }
4742 
4743  const Type *exprLValueType = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetType() :
4744  expr->GetLValueType();
4745  if (exprLValueType == NULL)
4746  return NULL;
4747 
4748  const VectorType *vt = NULL;
4749  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprLValueType) != NULL)
4750  vt = CastType<VectorType>(exprLValueType->GetReferenceTarget());
4751  else
4752  vt = CastType<VectorType>(exprLValueType->GetBaseType());
4753  AssertPos(pos, vt != NULL);
4754 
4755  // we don't want to report that it's e.g. a pointer to a float<1>,
