4756  // but a pointer to a float, etc.
4757  const Type *elementType = vt->GetElementType();
4758  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprLValueType) != NULL)
4759  lvalueType = new ReferenceType(elementType);
4760  else {
4761  const PointerType *ptrType = exprLValueType->IsUniformType() ?
4762  PointerType::GetUniform(elementType) :
4763  PointerType::GetVarying(elementType);
4764  // FIXME: replicated logic with structmemberexpr....
4765  if (CastType<PointerType>(exprLValueType) &&
4766  CastType<PointerType>(exprLValueType)->IsSlice())
4767  ptrType = ptrType->GetAsFrozenSlice();
4768  lvalueType = ptrType;
4769  }
4770  }
4771 
4772  return lvalueType;
4773 }
4774 
4775 
4776 llvm::Value *
4777 VectorMemberExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
4778  if (identifier.length() == 1) {
4779  return MemberExpr::GetValue(ctx);
4780  }
4781  else {
4782  std::vector<int> indices;
4783 
4784  for (size_t i = 0; i < identifier.size(); ++i) {
4785  int idx = lIdentifierToVectorElement(identifier[i]);
4786  if (idx == -1)
4787  Error(pos,
4788  "Invalid swizzle charcter '%c' in swizzle \"%s\".",
4789  identifier[i], identifier.c_str());
4790 
4791  indices.push_back(idx);
4792  }
4793 
4794  llvm::Value *basePtr = NULL;
4795  const Type *basePtrType = NULL;
4796  if (dereferenceExpr) {
4797  basePtr = expr->GetValue(ctx);
4798  basePtrType = expr->GetType();
4799  }
4800  else {
4801  basePtr = expr->GetLValue(ctx);
4802  basePtrType = expr->GetLValueType();
4803  }
4804 
4805  if (basePtr == NULL || basePtrType == NULL) {
4806  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4807  return NULL;
4808  }
4809 
4810  // Allocate temporary memory to tore the result
4811  llvm::Value *resultPtr = ctx->AllocaInst(memberType->LLVMType(g->ctx),
4812  "vector_tmp");
4813 
4814  // FIXME: we should be able to use the internal mask here according
4815  // to the same logic where it's used elsewhere
4816  llvm::Value *elementMask = ctx->GetFullMask();
4817 
4818  const Type *elementPtrType = basePtrType->IsUniformType() ?
4819  PointerType::GetUniform(exprVectorType->GetElementType()) :
4820  PointerType::GetVarying(exprVectorType->GetElementType());
4821 
4822  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4823  for (size_t i = 0; i < identifier.size(); ++i) {
4824  char idStr[2] = { identifier[i], '\0' };
4825  llvm::Value *elementPtr = ctx->AddElementOffset(basePtr, indices[i],
4826  basePtrType,
4827  LLVMGetName(basePtr, idStr));
4828  llvm::Value *elementValue =
4829  ctx->LoadInst(elementPtr, elementMask, elementPtrType);
4830 
4831  const char *resultName = LLVMGetName(resultPtr, idStr);
4832  llvm::Value *ptmp = ctx->AddElementOffset(resultPtr, i, NULL, resultName);
4833  ctx->StoreInst(elementValue, ptmp);
4834  }
4835 
4836  return ctx->LoadInst(resultPtr, LLVMGetName(basePtr, "_swizzle"));
4837  }
4838 }
4839 
4840 
4841 int
4842 VectorMemberExpr::getElementNumber() const {
4843  int elementNumber = lIdentifierToVectorElement(identifier[0]);
4844  if (elementNumber == -1)
4845  Error(pos, "Vector element identifier \"%s\" unknown.",
4846  identifier.c_str());
4847  return elementNumber;
4848 }
4849 
4850 
4851 const Type *
4852 VectorMemberExpr::getElementType() const {
4853  return memberType;
4854 }
4855 
4856 
4857 
4858 MemberExpr *
4859 MemberExpr::create(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p, SourcePos idpos,
4860  bool derefLValue) {
4861  // FIXME: we need to call TypeCheck() here so that we can call
4862  // e->GetType() in the following. But really we just shouldn't try to
4863  // resolve this now but just have a generic MemberExpr type that
4864  // handles all cases so that this is unnecessary.
4865  e = ::TypeCheck(e);
4866 
4867  const Type *exprType;
4868  if (e == NULL || (exprType = e->GetType()) == NULL)
4869  return NULL;
4870 
4871  const ReferenceType *referenceType = CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType);
4872  if (referenceType != NULL) {
4873  e = new RefDerefExpr(e, e->pos);
4874  exprType = e->GetType();
4875  Assert(exprType != NULL);
4876  }
4877 
4878  const PointerType *pointerType = CastType<PointerType>(exprType);
4879  if (pointerType != NULL)
4880  exprType = pointerType->GetBaseType();
4881 
4882  if (derefLValue == true && pointerType == NULL) {
4883  const Type *targetType = exprType->GetReferenceTarget();
4884  if (CastType<StructType>(targetType) != NULL)
4885  Error(p, "Member operator \"->\" can't be applied to non-pointer "
4886  "type \"%s\". Did you mean to use \".\"?",
4887  exprType->GetString().c_str());
4888  else
4889  Error(p, "Member operator \"->\" can't be applied to non-struct "
4890  "pointer type \"%s\".", exprType->GetString().c_str());
4891  return NULL;
4892  }
4893  if (derefLValue == false && pointerType != NULL &&
4894  CastType<StructType>(pointerType->GetBaseType()) != NULL) {
4895  Error(p, "Member operator \".\" can't be applied to pointer "
4896  "type \"%s\". Did you mean to use \"->\"?",
4897  exprType->GetString().c_str());
4898  return NULL;
4899  }
4900 
4901  if (CastType<StructType>(exprType) != NULL)
4902  return new StructMemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, derefLValue);
4903  else if (CastType<VectorType>(exprType) != NULL)
4904  return new VectorMemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, derefLValue);
4905  else if (CastType<UndefinedStructType>(exprType)) {
4906  Error(p, "Member operator \"%s\" can't be applied to declared "
4907  "but not defined struct type \"%s\".", derefLValue ? "->" : ".",
4908  exprType->GetString().c_str());
4909  return NULL;
4910  }
4911  else {
4912  Error(p, "Member operator \"%s\" can't be used with expression of "
4913  "\"%s\" type.", derefLValue ? "->" : ".",
4914  exprType->GetString().c_str());
4915  return NULL;
4916  }
4917 }
4918 
4919 
4920 MemberExpr::MemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p, SourcePos idpos,
4921  bool derefLValue)
4922  : Expr(p), identifierPos(idpos) {
4923  expr = e;
4924  identifier = id;
4925  dereferenceExpr = derefLValue;
4926  type = lvalueType = NULL;
4927 }
4928 
4929 
4930 llvm::Value *
4931 MemberExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
4932  if (!expr)
4933  return NULL;
4934 
4935  llvm::Value *lvalue = GetLValue(ctx);
4936  const Type *lvalueType = GetLValueType();
4937 
4938  llvm::Value *mask = NULL;
4939  if (lvalue == NULL) {
4940  if (m->errorCount > 0)
4941  return NULL;
4942 
4943  // As in the array case, this may be a temporary that hasn't hit
4944  // memory; get the full value and stuff it into a temporary array
4945  // so that we can index from there...
4946  llvm::Value *val = expr->GetValue(ctx);
4947  if (!val) {
4948  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
4949  return NULL;
4950  }
4951  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4952  const Type *exprType = expr->GetType();
4953  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(exprType->LLVMType(g->ctx),
4954  "struct_tmp");
4955  ctx->StoreInst(val, ptr);
4956 
4957  int elementNumber = getElementNumber();
4958  if (elementNumber == -1)
4959  return NULL;
4960 
4961  lvalue = ctx->AddElementOffset(ptr, elementNumber,
4962  PointerType::GetUniform(exprType));
4963  lvalueType = PointerType::GetUniform(GetType());
4964  mask = LLVMMaskAllOn;
4965  }
4966  else {
4967  Symbol *baseSym = GetBaseSymbol();
4968  AssertPos(pos, baseSym != NULL);
4969  mask = lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx);
4970  }
4971 
4972  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
4973  std::string suffix = std::string("_") + identifier;
4974  return ctx->LoadInst(lvalue, mask, lvalueType,
4975  LLVMGetName(lvalue, suffix.c_str()));
4976 }
4977 
4978 
4979 const Type *
4980 MemberExpr::GetType() const {
4981  return NULL;
4982 }
4983 
4984 
4985 Symbol *
4986 MemberExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
4987  return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
4988 }
4989 
4990 
4991 int
4992 MemberExpr::getElementNumber() const {
4993  return -1;
4994 }
4995 
4996 
4997 llvm::Value *
4998 MemberExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
4999  const Type *exprType;
5000  if (!expr || ((exprType = expr->GetType()) == NULL))
5001  return NULL;
5002 
5003  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
5004  llvm::Value *basePtr = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetValue(ctx) :
5005  expr->GetLValue(ctx);
5006  if (!basePtr)
5007  return NULL;
5008 
5009  int elementNumber = getElementNumber();
5010  if (elementNumber == -1)
5011  return NULL;
5012 
5013  const Type *exprLValueType = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetType() :
5014  expr->GetLValueType();
5015  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
5016  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AddElementOffset(basePtr, elementNumber,
5017  exprLValueType,
5018  basePtr->getName().str().c_str());
5019  if (ptr == NULL) {
5020  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
5021  return NULL;
5022  }
5023 
5024  ptr = lAddVaryingOffsetsIfNeeded(ctx, ptr, GetLValueType());
5025 
5026  return ptr;
5027 }
5028 
5029 
5030 Expr *
5031 MemberExpr::TypeCheck() {
5032  return expr ? this : NULL;
5033 }
5034 
5035 
5036 Expr *
5037 MemberExpr::Optimize() {
5038  return expr ? this : NULL;
5039 }
5040 
5041 
5042 int
5043 MemberExpr::EstimateCost() const {
5044  const Type *lvalueType = GetLValueType();
5045  if (lvalueType != NULL && lvalueType->IsVaryingType())
5046  return COST_GATHER + COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
5047  else
5048  return COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
5049 }
5050 
5051 
5052 void
5053 MemberExpr::Print() const {
5054  if (!expr || !GetType())
5055  return;
5056 
5057  printf("[%s] member (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
5058  expr->Print();
5059  printf(" . %s)", identifier.c_str());
5060  pos.Print();
5061 }
5062 
5063 
5064 /** There is no structure member with the name we've got in "identifier".
5065  Use the approximate string matching routine to see if the identifier is
5066  a minor misspelling of one of the ones that is there.
5067  */
5068 std::string
5069 MemberExpr::getCandidateNearMatches() const {
5070  const StructType *structType = CastType<StructType>(expr->GetType());
5071  if (!structType)
5072  return "";
5073 
5074  std::vector<std::string> elementNames;
5075  for (int i = 0; i < structType->GetElementCount(); ++i)
5076  elementNames.push_back(structType->GetElementName(i));
5077  std::vector<std::string> alternates = MatchStrings(identifier, elementNames);
5078  if (!alternates.size())
5079  return "";
5080 
5081  std::string ret = " Did you mean ";
5082  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < alternates.size(); ++i) {
5083  ret += std::string("\"") + alternates[i] + std::string("\"");
5084  if (i < alternates.size() - 1) ret += ", or ";
5085  }
5086  ret += "?";
5087  return ret;
5088 }
5089 
5090 
5091 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5092 // ConstExpr
5093 
5094 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(const Type *t, int8_t i, SourcePos p)
5095  : Expr(p) {
5096  type = t;
5097  type = type->GetAsConstType();
5098  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt8->GetAsConstType()));
5099  int8Val[0] = i;
5100 }
5101 
5102 
5103 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(const Type *t, int8_t *i, SourcePos p)
5104  : Expr(p) {
5105  type = t;
5106  type = type->GetAsConstType();
5107  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt8->GetAsConstType()) ||
5108  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt8->GetAsConstType()));
5109  for (int j = 0; j < Count(); ++j)
5110  int8Val[j] = i[j];
5111 }

5118  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt8->GetAsConstType()));
5119  uint8Val[0] = u;

5306 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(const Type *t, bool *b, SourcePos p)
5307  : Expr(p) {
5308  type = t;
5309  type = type->GetAsConstType();
5310  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformBool->GetAsConstType()) ||
5311  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingBool->GetAsConstType()));
5312  for (int j = 0; j < Count(); ++j)
5313  boolVal[j] = b[j];
5314 }
5315 
5316 
5317 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(ConstExpr *old, double *v)
5318  : Expr(old->pos) {
5319  type = old->type;
5320 
5321  AtomicType::BasicType basicType = getBasicType();
5322 
5323  switch (basicType) {
5324  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5325  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5326  boolVal[i] = (v[i] != 0.);
5327  break;
5328  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5329  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5330  int8Val[i] = (int)v[i];
5331  break;
5332  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5333  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5334  uint8Val[i] = (unsigned int)v[i];
5335  break;
5336  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5337  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5338  int16Val[i] = (int)v[i];
5339  break;
5340  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5341  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5342  uint16Val[i] = (unsigned int)v[i];
5343  break;
5344  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5345  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5346  int32Val[i] = (int)v[i];
5347  break;
5348  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5349  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5350  uint32Val[i] = (unsigned int)v[i];
5351  break;
5352  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5353  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5354  floatVal[i] = (float)v[i];
5355  break;
5356  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5357  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5358  doubleVal[i] = v[i];
5359  break;
5360  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5361  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5362  // For now, this should never be reached
5363  FATAL("fixme; we need another constructor so that we're not trying to pass "
5364  "double values to init an int64 type...");
5365  default:
5366  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5367  }
5368 }
5369 
5370 
5371 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(ConstExpr *old, SourcePos p)
5372  : Expr(p) {
5373  type = old->type;
5374 
5375  AtomicType::BasicType basicType = getBasicType();
5376 
5377  switch (basicType) {
5378  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5379  memcpy(boolVal, old->boolVal, Count() * sizeof(bool));
5380  break;
5381  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5382  memcpy(int8Val, old->int8Val, Count() * sizeof(int8_t));
5383  break;
5384  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5385  memcpy(uint8Val, old->uint8Val, Count() * sizeof(uint8_t));
5386  break;
5387  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5388  memcpy(int16Val, old->int16Val, Count() * sizeof(int16_t));
5389  break;
5390  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5391  memcpy(uint16Val, old->uint16Val, Count() * sizeof(uint16_t));
5392  break;
5393  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5394  memcpy(int32Val, old->int32Val, Count() * sizeof(int32_t));
5395  break;
5396  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5397  memcpy(uint32Val, old->uint32Val, Count() * sizeof(uint32_t));
5398  break;
5399  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5400  memcpy(floatVal, old->floatVal, Count() * sizeof(float));
5401  break;
5402  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5403  memcpy(doubleVal, old->doubleVal, Count() * sizeof(double));
5404  break;
5405  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5406  memcpy(int64Val, old->int64Val, Count() * sizeof(int64_t));
5407  break;
5408  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5409  memcpy(uint64Val, old->uint64Val, Count() * sizeof(uint64_t));
5410  break;
5411  default:
5412  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5413  }
5414 
5415 }
5416 
5417 
5418 AtomicType::BasicType
5419 ConstExpr::getBasicType() const {
5420  const AtomicType *at = CastType<AtomicType>(type);
5421  if (at != NULL)
5422  return at->basicType;
5423  else {
5424  AssertPos(pos, CastType<EnumType>(type) != NULL);
5425  return AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32;
5426  }
5427 }
5428 
5429 
5430 const Type *
5431 ConstExpr::GetType() const {
5432  return type;
5433 }
5434 
5435 
5436 llvm::Value *
5437 ConstExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
5438  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
5439  bool isVarying = type->IsVaryingType();
5440 
5441  AtomicType::BasicType basicType = getBasicType();
5442 
5443  switch (basicType) {
5444  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5445  if (isVarying)
5446  return LLVMBoolVector(boolVal);
5447  else
5448  return boolVal[0] ? LLVMTrue : LLVMFalse;
5449  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5450  return isVarying ? LLVMInt8Vector(int8Val) :
5451  LLVMInt8(int8Val[0]);
5452  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5453  return isVarying ? LLVMUInt8Vector(uint8Val) :
5454  LLVMUInt8(uint8Val[0]);
5455  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5456  return isVarying ? LLVMInt16Vector(int16Val) :
5457  LLVMInt16(int16Val[0]);
5458  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5459  return isVarying ? LLVMUInt16Vector(uint16Val) :
5460  LLVMUInt16(uint16Val[0]);
5461  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5462  return isVarying ? LLVMInt32Vector(int32Val) :
5463  LLVMInt32(int32Val[0]);
5464  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5465  return isVarying ? LLVMUInt32Vector(uint32Val) :
5466  LLVMUInt32(uint32Val[0]);
5467  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5468  return isVarying ? LLVMFloatVector(floatVal) :
5469  LLVMFloat(floatVal[0]);
5470  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5471  return isVarying ? LLVMInt64Vector(int64Val) :
5472  LLVMInt64(int64Val[0]);
5473  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5474  return isVarying ? LLVMUInt64Vector(uint64Val) :
5475  LLVMUInt64(uint64Val[0]);
5476  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5477  return isVarying ? LLVMDoubleVector(doubleVal) :
5478  LLVMDouble(doubleVal[0]);
5479  default:
5480  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5481  return NULL;
5482  }
5483 }
5484 
5485 
5486 /* Type conversion templates: take advantage of C++ function overloading
5487  rules to get the one we want to match. */
5488 
5489 /* First the most general case, just use C++ type conversion if nothing
5490  else matches */
5491 template <typename From, typename To> static inline void
5492 lConvertElement(From from, To *to) {
5493  *to = (To)from;
5494 }
5495 
5496 
5497 /** When converting from bool types to numeric types, make sure the result
5498  is one or zero.
5499  */
5500 template <typename To> static inline void
5501 lConvertElement(bool from, To *to) {
5502  *to = from ? (To)1 : (To)0;
5503 }
5504 
5505 
5506 /** When converting numeric types to bool, compare to zero. (Do we
5507  actually need this one??) */
5508 template <typename From> static inline void
5509 lConvertElement(From from, bool *to) {
5510  *to = (from != 0);
5511 }
5512 
5513 
5514 /** And bool -> bool is just assignment */
5515 static inline void
5516 lConvertElement(bool from, bool *to) {
5517  *to = from;
5518 }
5519 
5520 
5521 /** Type conversion utility function
5522  */
5523 template <typename From, typename To> static void
5524 lConvert(const From *from, To *to, int count, bool forceVarying) {
5525  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
5526  lConvertElement(from[i], &to[i]);
5527 
5528  if (forceVarying && count == 1)
5529  for (int i = 1; i < g->target->getVectorWidth(); ++i)
5530  to[i] = to[0];
5531 }
5532 
5533 
5534 int
5535 ConstExpr::AsInt64(int64_t *ip, bool forceVarying) const {
5536  switch (getBasicType()) {
5537  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5538  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5539  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5540  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5541  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5542  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5543  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5544  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5545  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5546  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5547  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5548  default:
5549  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5550  }
5551  return Count();
5552 }
5553 
5554 
5555 int
5556 ConstExpr::AsUInt64(uint64_t *up, bool forceVarying) const {
5557  switch (getBasicType()) {
5558  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5559  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5560  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5561  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5562  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5563  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5564  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5565  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5566  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5567  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5568  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5569  default:
5570  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5571  }
5572  return Count();
5573 }
5574 
5575 
5576 int
5577 ConstExpr::AsDouble(double *d, bool forceVarying) const {
5578  switch (getBasicType()) {
5579  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5580  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5581  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5582  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5583  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5584  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5585  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5586  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5587  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5588  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5589  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, d, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5590  default:
5591  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5592  }
5593  return Count();
5594 }
5595 
5596 
5597 int
5598 ConstExpr::AsFloat(float *fp, bool forceVarying) const {
5599  switch (getBasicType()) {
5600  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5601  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5602  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5603  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5604  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5605  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5606  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5607  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5608  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5609  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5610  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, fp, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5611  default:
5612  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5613  }
5614  return Count();
5615 }
5616

5618 int
5619 ConstExpr::AsBool(bool *b, bool forceVarying) const {
5620  switch (getBasicType()) {
5621  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5622  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5623  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5624  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5625  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5626  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5627  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5628  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5629  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5630  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5631  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, b, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5632  default:
5633  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5634  }
5635  return Count();
5636 }

5639 int
5640 ConstExpr::AsInt8(int8_t *ip, bool forceVarying) const {
5641  switch (getBasicType()) {
5642  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5643  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5644  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5645  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5646  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5647  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5648  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5649  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5650  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5651  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5652  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5653  default:
5654  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5655  }
5656  return Count();
5657 }

5660 int
5661 ConstExpr::AsUInt8(uint8_t *up, bool forceVarying) const {
5662  switch (getBasicType()) {
5663  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5664  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5665  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5666  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5667  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5668  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5669  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5670  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5671  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5672  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5673  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5674  default:
5675  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5676  }
5677  return Count();
5678 }
5679 
5680 
5681 int
5682 ConstExpr::AsInt16(int16_t *ip, bool forceVarying) const {
5683  switch (getBasicType()) {
5684  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5685  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5686  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5687  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5688  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5689  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5690  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5691  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5692  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5693  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5694  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5695  default:
5696  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5697  }
5698  return Count();
5699 }
5700 
5701 
5702 int
5703 ConstExpr::AsUInt16(uint16_t *up, bool forceVarying) const {
5704  switch (getBasicType()) {
5705  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5706  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5707  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5708  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5709  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5710  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5711  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5712  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5713  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5714  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5715  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5716  default:
5717  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5718  }
5719  return Count();
5720 }
5721 
5722 
5723 int
5724 ConstExpr::AsInt32(int32_t *ip, bool forceVarying) const {
5725  switch (getBasicType()) {
5726  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5727  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5728  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5729  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5730  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5731  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5732  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5733  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5734  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5735  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5736  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5737  default:
5738  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5739  }
5740  return Count();
5741 }
5742 
5743 
5744 int
5745 ConstExpr::AsUInt32(uint32_t *up, bool forceVarying) const {
5746  switch (getBasicType()) {
5747  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: lConvert(boolVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5748  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: lConvert(int8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5749  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: lConvert(uint8Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5750  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: lConvert(int16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5751  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5752  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: lConvert(int32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5753  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5754  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: lConvert(floatVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5755  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5756  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: lConvert(int64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5757  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
5758  default:
5759  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5760  }
5761  return Count();
5762 }
5763 
5764 
5765 int
5766 ConstExpr::Count() const {
5767  return GetType()->IsVaryingType() ? g->target->getVectorWidth() : 1;
5768 }
5769 
5770 
5771 llvm::Constant *
5772 ConstExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
5773  // Caller shouldn't be trying to stuff a varying value here into a
5774  // constant type.
5775  if (type->IsUniformType())
5776  AssertPos(pos, Count() == 1);
5777 
5778  type = type->GetAsNonConstType();
5779  if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformBool) ||
5780  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingBool)) {
5781  bool bv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5782  AsBool(bv, type->IsVaryingType());
5783  if (type->IsUniformType())
5784  return bv[0] ? LLVMTrue : LLVMFalse;
5785  else
5786  return LLVMBoolVector(bv);
5787  }
5788  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt8) ||
5789  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt8)) {
5790  int8_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5791  AsInt8(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
5792  if (type->IsUniformType())
5793  return LLVMInt8(iv[0]);
5794  else
5795  return LLVMInt8Vector(iv);
5796  }
5797  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt8) ||
5798  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt8)) {
5799  uint8_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5800  AsUInt8(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
5801  if (type->IsUniformType())
5802  return LLVMUInt8(uiv[0]);
5803  else
5804  return LLVMUInt8Vector(uiv);
5805  }
5806  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt16) ||
5807  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt16)) {
5808  int16_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5809  AsInt16(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
5810  if (type->IsUniformType())
5811  return LLVMInt16(iv[0]);
5812  else
5813  return LLVMInt16Vector(iv);
5814  }
5815  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt16) ||
5816  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt16)) {
5817  uint16_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5818  AsUInt16(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
5819  if (type->IsUniformType())
5820  return LLVMUInt16(uiv[0]);
5821  else
5822  return LLVMUInt16Vector(uiv);
5823  }
5824  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt32) ||
5825  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt32)) {
5826  int32_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5827  AsInt32(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
5828  if (type->IsUniformType())
5829  return LLVMInt32(iv[0]);
5830  else
5831  return LLVMInt32Vector(iv);
5832  }
5833  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt32) ||
5834  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt32) ||
5835  CastType<EnumType>(type) != NULL) {
5836  uint32_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5837  AsUInt32(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
5838  if (type->IsUniformType())
5839  return LLVMUInt32(uiv[0]);
5840  else
5841  return LLVMUInt32Vector(uiv);
5842  }
5843  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformFloat) ||
5844  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingFloat)) {
5845  float fv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5846  AsFloat(fv, type->IsVaryingType());
5847  if (type->IsUniformType())
5848  return LLVMFloat(fv[0]);
5849  else
5850  return LLVMFloatVector(fv);
5851  }
5852  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformInt64) ||
5853  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingInt64)) {
5854  int64_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5855  AsInt64(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
5856  if (type->IsUniformType())
5857  return LLVMInt64(iv[0]);
5858  else
5859  return LLVMInt64Vector(iv);
5860  }
5861  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformUInt64) ||
5862  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingUInt64)) {
5863  uint64_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5864  AsUInt64(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
5865  if (type->IsUniformType())
5866  return LLVMUInt64(uiv[0]);
5867  else
5868  return LLVMUInt64Vector(uiv);
5869  }
5870  else if (Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::UniformDouble) ||
5871  Type::Equal(type, AtomicType::VaryingDouble)) {
5872  double dv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5873  AsDouble(dv, type->IsVaryingType());
5874  if (type->IsUniformType())
5875  return LLVMDouble(dv[0]);
5876  else
5877  return LLVMDoubleVector(dv);
5878  }
5879  else if (CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL) {
5880  // The only time we should get here is if we have an integer '0'
5881  // constant that should be turned into a NULL pointer of the
5882  // appropriate type.
5883  llvm::Type *llvmType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
5884  if (llvmType == NULL) {
5885  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
5886  return NULL;
5887  }
5888 
5889  int64_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
5890  AsInt64(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
5891  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
5892  if (iv[i] != 0)
5893  // We'll issue an error about this later--trying to assign
5894  // a constant int to a pointer, without a typecast.
5895  return NULL;
5896 
5897  return llvm::Constant::getNullValue(llvmType);
5898  }
5899  else {
5900  Debug(pos, "Unable to handle type \"%s\" in ConstExpr::GetConstant().",
5901  type->GetString().c_str());
5902  return NULL;
5903  }
5904 }
5905 
5906 
5907 Expr *
5908 ConstExpr::Optimize() {
5909  return this;
5910 }
5911 
5912 
5913 Expr *
5914 ConstExpr::TypeCheck() {
5915  return this;
5916 }
5917 
5918 
5919 int
5920 ConstExpr::EstimateCost() const {
5921  return 0;
5922 }
5923 
5924 
5925 void
5926 ConstExpr::Print() const {
5927  printf("[%s] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
5928  for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i) {
5929  switch (getBasicType()) {
5930  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
5931  printf("%s", boolVal[i] ? "true" : "false");
5932  break;
5933  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
5934  printf("%d", (int)int8Val[i]);
5935  break;
5936  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
5937  printf("%u", (int)uint8Val[i]);
5938  break;
5939  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
5940  printf("%d", (int)int16Val[i]);
5941  break;
5942  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
5943  printf("%u", (int)uint16Val[i]);
5944  break;
5945  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
5946  printf("%d", int32Val[i]);
5947  break;
5948  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
5949  printf("%u", uint32Val[i]);
5950  break;
5951  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
5952  printf("%f", floatVal[i]);
5953  break;
5954  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
5955  printf("%"PRId64, int64Val[i]);
5956  break;
5957  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
5958  printf("%"PRIu64, uint64Val[i]);
5959  break;
5960  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
5961  printf("%f", doubleVal[i]);
5962  break;
5963  default:
5964  FATAL("unimplemented const type");
5965  }
5966  if (i != Count() - 1)
5967  printf(", ");
5968  }
5969  printf(")");
5970  pos.Print();
5971 }
5972 
5973 
5974 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
5975 // TypeCastExpr
5976 
5977 TypeCastExpr::TypeCastExpr(const Type *t, Expr *e, SourcePos p)
5978  : Expr(p) {
5979  type = t;
5980  expr = e;
5981 }
5982 
5983 
5984 /** Handle all the grungy details of type conversion between atomic types.
5985  Given an input value in exprVal of type fromType, convert it to the
5986  llvm::Value with type toType.
5987  */
5988 static llvm::Value *
5989 lTypeConvAtomic(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *exprVal,
5990  const AtomicType *toType, const AtomicType *fromType,
5991  SourcePos pos) {
5992  llvm::Value *cast = NULL;
5993 
5994  std::string opName = exprVal->getName().str();
5995  switch (toType->basicType) {
5996  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: opName += "_to_bool"; break;
5997  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: opName += "_to_int8"; break;
5998  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: opName += "_to_uint8"; break;
5999  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: opName += "_to_int16"; break;
6000  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: opName += "_to_uint16"; break;
6001  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: opName += "_to_int32"; break;
6002  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: opName += "_to_uint32"; break;
6003  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: opName += "_to_int64"; break;
6004  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: opName += "_to_uint64"; break;
6005  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: opName += "_to_float"; break;
6006  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: opName += "_to_double"; break;
6007  default: FATAL("Unimplemented");
6008  }
6009  const char *cOpName = opName.c_str();
6010 
6011  switch (toType->basicType) {
6012  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
6013  llvm::Type *targetType =
6014  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::FloatType :
6015  LLVMTypes::FloatVectorType;
6016  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6017  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6018  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6019  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
6020  // If we have a bool vector of i32 elements, first truncate
6021  // down to a single bit
6022  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6023  // And then do an unisgned int->float cast
6024  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int
6025  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6026  break;
6027  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6028  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6029  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6030  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6031  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::SIToFP, // signed int to float
6032  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6033  break;
6034  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6035  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6036  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6037  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6038  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6039  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from unsigned int to float is slow. "
6040  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6041  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int to float
6042  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6043  break;
6044  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6045  // No-op cast.
6046  cast = exprVal;
6047  break;
6048  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6049  cast = ctx->FPCastInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6050  break;
6051  default:
6052  FATAL("unimplemented");
6053  }
6054  break;
6055  }
6056  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
6057  llvm::Type *targetType =
6058  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::DoubleType :
6059  LLVMTypes::DoubleVectorType;
6060  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6061  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6062  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6063  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
6064  // truncate i32 bool vector values to i1s
6065  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6066  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int to double
6067  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6068  break;
6069  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6070  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6071  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6072  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6073  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::SIToFP, // signed int
6074  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6075  break;
6076  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6077  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6078  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6079  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6080  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int
6081  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6082  break;
6083  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6084  cast = ctx->FPCastInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6085  break;
6086  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6087  cast = exprVal;
6088  break;
6089  default:
6090  FATAL("unimplemented");
6091  }
6092  break;
6093  }
6094  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: {
6095  llvm::Type *targetType =
6096  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int8Type :
6097  LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType;
6098  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6099  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6100  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6101  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
6102  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6103  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6104  break;
6105  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6106  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6107  cast = exprVal;
6108  break;
6109  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6110  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6111  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6112  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6113  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6114  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6115  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6116  break;
6117  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6118  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6119  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6120  break;
6121  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6122  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6123  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6124  break;
6125  default:
6126  FATAL("unimplemented");
6127  }
6128  break;
6129  }
6130  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
6131  llvm::Type *targetType =
6132  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int8Type :
6133  LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType;
6134  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6135  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6136  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6137  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
6138  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6139  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6140  break;
6141  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6142  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6143  cast = exprVal;
6144  break;
6145  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6146  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6147  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6148  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6149  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6150  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6151  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6152  break;
6153  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6154  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6155  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
6156  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6157  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6158  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6159  break;
6160  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6161  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6162  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
6163  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6164  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6165  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6166  break;
6167  default:
6168  FATAL("unimplemented");
6169  }
6170  break;
6171  }
6172  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: {
6173  llvm::Type *targetType =
6174  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int16Type :
6175  LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType;
6176  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6177  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6178  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6179  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
6180  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6181  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6182  break;
6183  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6184  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6185  break;
6186  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6187  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6188  break;
6189  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6190  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6191  cast = exprVal;
6192  break;
6193  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6194  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6195  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6196  break;
6197  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6198  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6199  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6200  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6201  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6202  break;
6203  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6204  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6205  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6206  break;
6207  default:
6208  FATAL("unimplemented");
6209  }
6210  break;
6211  }
6212  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
6213  llvm::Type *targetType =
6214  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int16Type :
6215  LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType;
6216  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6217  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6218  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6219  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
6220  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6221  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6222  break;
6223  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6224  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6225  break;
6226  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6227  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6228  break;
6229  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6230  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6231  cast = exprVal;
6232  break;
6233  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6234  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6235  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
6236  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6237  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6238  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6239  break;
6240  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6241  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6242  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6243  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6244  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6245  break;
6246  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6247  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6248  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
6249  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6250  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6251  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6252  break;
6253  default:
6254  FATAL("unimplemented");
6255  }
6256  break;
6257  }
6258  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: {
6259  llvm::Type *targetType =
6260  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int32Type :
6261  LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
6262  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6263  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6264  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6265  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
6266  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6267  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6268  break;
6269  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6270  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6271  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6272  break;
6273  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6274  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6275  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6276  break;
6277  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6278  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6279  cast = exprVal;
6280  break;
6281  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6282  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6283  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6284  break;
6285  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6286  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6287  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6288  break;
6289  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6290  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6291  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6292  break;
6293  default:
6294  FATAL("unimplemented");
6295  }
6296  break;
6297  }
6298  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
6299  llvm::Type *targetType =
6300  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int32Type :
6301  LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
6302  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6303  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6304  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6305  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
6306  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6307  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6308  break;
6309  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6310  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6311  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6312  break;
6313  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6314  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6315  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6316  break;
6317  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6318  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6319  cast = exprVal;
6320  break;
6321  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6322  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6323  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
6324  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6325  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6326  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6327  break;
6328  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6329  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6330  cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6331  break;
6332  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6333  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6334  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
6335  "Use \"int\" if possible");
6336  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
6337  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6338  break;
6339  default:
6340  FATAL("unimplemented");
6341  }
6342  break;
6343  }
6344  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: {
6345  llvm::Type *targetType =
6346  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int64Type :
6347  LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType;
6348  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6349  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6350  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6351  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
6352  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6353  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6354  break;
6355  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6356  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6357  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6358  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6359  break;
6360  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6361  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6362  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6363  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6364  break;
6365  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6366  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6367  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6368  break;
6369  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6370  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6371  cast = exprVal;
6372  break;
6373  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6374  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
6375  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6376  break;
6377  default:
6378  FATAL("unimplemented");
6379  }
6380  break;
6381  }
6382  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
6383  llvm::Type *targetType =
6384  fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int64Type :
6385  LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType;
6386  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6387  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6388  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
6389  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
6390  exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, cOpName);
6391  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6392  break;
6393  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6394  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6395  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6396  cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6397  break;
6398  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
6399  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
6400  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
6401  cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6402  break;
6403  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
6404  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6405  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int64 is slow. "
6406  "Use \"int64\" if possible");
6407  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // signed int
6408  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6409  break;
6410  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6411  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
6412  cast = exprVal;
6413  break;
6414  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
6415  if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && g->target->getISA() != Target::GENERIC)
6416  PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int64 is slow. "
6417  "Use \"int64\" if possible");
6418  cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // signed int
6419  exprVal, targetType, cOpName);
6420  break;
6421  default:
6422  FATAL("unimplemented");
6423  }
6424  break;
6425  }
6426  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: {
6427  switch (fromType->basicType) {
6428  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
6429  cast = exprVal;
6430  break;
6431  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
6432  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
6433  llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt8(0) :
6434  (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt8Vector((int8_t)0);
6435  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
6436  exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6437  break;
6438  }
6439  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
6440  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
6441  llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt16(0) :
6442  (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt16Vector((int16_t)0);
6443  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
6444  exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6445  break;
6446  }
6447  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
6448  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
6449  llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt32(0) :
6450  (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt32Vector(0);
6451  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
6452  exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6453  break;
6454  }
6455  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
6456  llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMFloat(0.f) :
6457  (llvm::Value *)LLVMFloatVector(0.f);
6458  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::FCmp, llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ONE,
6459  exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6460  break;
6461  }
6462  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
6463  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
6464  llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt64(0) :
6465  (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt64Vector((int64_t)0);
6466  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
6467  exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6468  break;
6469  }
6470  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
6471  llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMDouble(0.) :
6472  (llvm::Value *)LLVMDoubleVector(0.);
6473  cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::FCmp, llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ONE,
6474  exprVal, zero, cOpName);
6475  break;
6476  }
6477  default:
6478  FATAL("unimplemented");
6479  }
6480 
6481  if (fromType->IsUniformType()) {
6482  if (toType->IsVaryingType() &&
6483  LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType) {
6484  // extend out to i32 bool values from i1 here. then we'll
6485  // turn into a vector below, the way it does for everyone
6486  // else...
6487  cast = ctx->SExtInst(cast, LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType->getElementType(),
6488  LLVMGetName(cast, "to_i32bool"));
6489  }
6490  }
6491  else
6492  // fromType->IsVaryingType())
6493  cast = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(cast);
6494 
6495  break;
6496  }
6497  default:
6498  FATAL("unimplemented");
6499  }
6500 
6501  // If we also want to go from uniform to varying, replicate out the
6502  // value across the vector elements..
6503  if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
6504  return ctx->SmearUniform(cast);
6505  else
6506  return cast;
6507 }
6508 
6509 
6510 // FIXME: fold this into the FunctionEmitContext::SmearUniform() method?
6511 
6512 /** Converts the given value of the given type to be the varying
6513  equivalent, returning the resulting value.
6514  */
6515 static llvm::Value *
6516 lUniformValueToVarying(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *value,
6517  const Type *type) {
6518  // nothing to do if it's already varying
6519  if (type->IsVaryingType())
6520  return value;
6521 
6522  // for structs/arrays/vectors, just recursively make their elements
6523  // varying (if needed) and populate the return value.
6524  const CollectionType *collectionType = CastType<CollectionType>(type);
6525  if (collectionType != NULL) {
6526  llvm::Type *llvmType =
6527  type->GetAsVaryingType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6528  llvm::Value *retValue = llvm::UndefValue::get(llvmType);
6529 
6530  for (int i = 0; i < collectionType->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
6531  llvm::Value *v = ctx->ExtractInst(value, i, "get_element");
6532  v = lUniformValueToVarying(ctx, v, collectionType->GetElementType(i));
6533  retValue = ctx->InsertInst(retValue, v, i, "set_element");
6534  }
6535  return retValue;
6536  }
6537 
6538  // Otherwise we must have a uniform atomic or pointer type, so smear
6539  // its value across the vector lanes.
6540  Assert(CastType<AtomicType>(type) != NULL ||
6541  CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL);
6542  return ctx->SmearUniform(value);
6543 }
6544 
6545 
6546 llvm::Value *
6547 TypeCastExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
6548  if (!expr)
6549  return NULL;
6550 
6551  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
6552  const Type *toType = GetType(), *fromType = expr->GetType();
6553  if (toType == NULL || fromType == NULL) {
6554  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
6555  return NULL;
6556  }
6557 
6558  if (Type::Equal(toType, AtomicType::Void)) {
6559  // emit the code for the expression in case it has side-effects but
6560  // then we're done.
6561  (void)expr->GetValue(ctx);
6562  return NULL;
6563  }
6564 
6565  const PointerType *fromPointerType = CastType<PointerType>(fromType);
6566  const PointerType *toPointerType = CastType<PointerType>(toType);
6567  const ArrayType *toArrayType = CastType<ArrayType>(toType);
6568  const ArrayType *fromArrayType = CastType<ArrayType>(fromType);
6569  if (fromPointerType != NULL) {
6570  if (toArrayType != NULL) {
6571  return expr->GetValue(ctx);
6572  }
6573  else if (toPointerType != NULL) {
6574  llvm::Value *value = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6575  if (value == NULL)
6576  return NULL;
6577 
6578  if (fromPointerType->IsSlice() == false &&
6579  toPointerType->IsSlice() == true) {
6580  // Convert from a non-slice pointer to a slice pointer by
6581  // creating a slice pointer structure with zero offsets.
6582  if (fromPointerType->IsUniformType())
6583  value = ctx->MakeSlicePointer(value, LLVMInt32(0));
6584  else
6585  value = ctx->MakeSlicePointer(value, LLVMInt32Vector(0));
6586 
6587  // FIXME: avoid error from unnecessary bitcast when all we
6588  // need to do is the slice conversion and don't need to
6589  // also do unif->varying conversions. But this is really
6590  // ugly logic.
6591  if (value->getType() == toType->LLVMType(g->ctx))
6592  return value;
6593  }
6594 
6595  if (fromType->IsUniformType() && toType->IsUniformType())
6596  // bitcast to the actual pointer type
6597  return ctx->BitCastInst(value, toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
6598  else if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && toType->IsVaryingType()) {
6599  // both are vectors of ints already, nothing to do at the IR
6600  // level
6601  return value;
6602  }
6603  else {
6604  // Uniform -> varying pointer conversion
6605  AssertPos(pos, fromType->IsUniformType() && toType->IsVaryingType());
6606  if (fromPointerType->IsSlice()) {
6607  // For slice pointers, we need to smear out both the
6608  // pointer and the offset vector
6609  AssertPos(pos, toPointerType->IsSlice());
6610  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->ExtractInst(value, 0);
6611  llvm::Value *offset = ctx->ExtractInst(value, 1);
6612  ptr = ctx->PtrToIntInst(ptr);
6613  ptr = ctx->SmearUniform(ptr);
6614  offset = ctx->SmearUniform(offset);
6615  return ctx->MakeSlicePointer(ptr, offset);
6616  }
6617  else {
6618  // Otherwise we just bitcast it to an int and smear it
6619  // out to a vector
6620  value = ctx->PtrToIntInst(value);
6621  return ctx->SmearUniform(value);
6622  }
6623  }
6624  }
6625  else {
6626  AssertPos(pos, CastType<AtomicType>(toType) != NULL);
6627  if (toType->IsBoolType()) {
6628  // convert pointer to bool
6629  llvm::Type *lfu =
6630  fromType->GetAsUniformType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6631  llvm::PointerType *llvmFromUnifType =
6632  llvm::dyn_cast<llvm::PointerType>(lfu);
6633 
6634  llvm::Value *nullPtrValue =
6635  llvm::ConstantPointerNull::get(llvmFromUnifType);
6636  if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
6637  nullPtrValue = ctx->SmearUniform(nullPtrValue);
6638 
6639  llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6640  llvm::Value *cmp =
6641  ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
6642  exprVal, nullPtrValue, "ptr_ne_NULL");
6643 
6644  if (toType->IsVaryingType()) {
6645  if (fromType->IsUniformType())
6646  cmp = ctx->SmearUniform(cmp);
6647  cmp = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(cmp);
6648  }
6649 
6650  return cmp;
6651  }
6652  else {
6653  // ptr -> int
6654  llvm::Value *value = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6655  if (value == NULL)
6656  return NULL;
6657 
6658  if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
6659  value = ctx->SmearUniform(value);
6660 
6661  llvm::Type *llvmToType = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6662  if (llvmToType == NULL)
6663  return NULL;
6664  return ctx->PtrToIntInst(value, llvmToType, "ptr_typecast");
6665  }
6666  }
6667  }
6668 
6669  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toType, fromType))
6670  // There's nothing to do, just return the value. (LLVM's type
6671  // system doesn't worry about constiness.)
6672  return expr->GetValue(ctx);
6673 
6674  if (fromArrayType != NULL && toPointerType != NULL) {
6675  // implicit array to pointer to first element
6676  Expr *arrayAsPtr = lArrayToPointer(expr);
6677  if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arrayAsPtr->GetType(), toPointerType) == false) {
6678  AssertPos(pos, PointerType::IsVoidPointer(toPointerType) ||
6679  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arrayAsPtr->GetType()->GetAsVaryingType(),
6680  toPointerType) == true);
6681  arrayAsPtr = new TypeCastExpr(toPointerType, arrayAsPtr, pos);
6682  arrayAsPtr = ::TypeCheck(arrayAsPtr);
6683  AssertPos(pos, arrayAsPtr != NULL);
6684  arrayAsPtr = ::Optimize(arrayAsPtr);
6685  AssertPos(pos, arrayAsPtr != NULL);
6686  }
6687  AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arrayAsPtr->GetType(), toPointerType));
6688  return arrayAsPtr->GetValue(ctx);
6689  }
6690 
6691  // This also should be caught during typechecking
6692  AssertPos(pos, !(toType->IsUniformType() && fromType->IsVaryingType()));
6693 
6694  if (toArrayType != NULL && fromArrayType != NULL) {
6695  // cast array pointer from [n x foo] to [0 x foo] if needed to be able
6696  // to pass to a function that takes an unsized array as a parameter
6697  if (toArrayType->GetElementCount() != 0 &&
6698  (toArrayType->GetElementCount() != fromArrayType->GetElementCount()))
6699  Warning(pos, "Type-converting array of length %d to length %d",
6700  fromArrayType->GetElementCount(), toArrayType->GetElementCount());
6701  AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toArrayType->GetBaseType(),
6702  fromArrayType->GetBaseType()));
6703  llvm::Value *v = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6704  llvm::Type *ptype = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6705  return ctx->BitCastInst(v, ptype); //, "array_cast_0size");
6706  }
6707 
6708  const ReferenceType *toReference = CastType<ReferenceType>(toType);
6709  const ReferenceType *fromReference = CastType<ReferenceType>(fromType);
6710  if (toReference && fromReference) {
6711  const Type *toTarget = toReference->GetReferenceTarget();
6712  const Type *fromTarget = fromReference->GetReferenceTarget();
6713 
6714  const ArrayType *toArray = CastType<ArrayType>(toTarget);
6715  const ArrayType *fromArray = CastType<ArrayType>(fromTarget);
6716  if (toArray && fromArray) {
6717  // cast array pointer from [n x foo] to [0 x foo] if needed to be able
6718  // to pass to a function that takes an unsized array as a parameter
6719  if(toArray->GetElementCount() != 0 &&
6720  (toArray->GetElementCount() != fromArray->GetElementCount()))
6721  Warning(pos, "Type-converting array of length %d to length %d",
6722  fromArray->GetElementCount(), toArray->GetElementCount());
6723  AssertPos(pos, Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toArray->GetBaseType(),
6724  fromArray->GetBaseType()));
6725  llvm::Value *v = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6726  llvm::Type *ptype = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6727  return ctx->BitCastInst(v, ptype); //, "array_cast_0size");
6728  }
6729 
6730  AssertPos(pos, Type::Equal(toTarget, fromTarget) ||
6731  Type::Equal(toTarget, fromTarget->GetAsConstType()));
6732  return expr->GetValue(ctx);
6733  }
6734 
6735  const StructType *toStruct = CastType<StructType>(toType);
6736  const StructType *fromStruct = CastType<StructType>(fromType);
6737  if (toStruct && fromStruct) {
6738  // The only legal type conversions for structs are to go from a
6739  // uniform to a varying instance of the same struct type.
6740  AssertPos(pos, toStruct->IsVaryingType() && fromStruct->IsUniformType() &&
6741  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toStruct,
6742  fromStruct->GetAsVaryingType()));
6743 
6744  llvm::Value *origValue = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6745  if (!origValue)
6746  return NULL;
6747  return lUniformValueToVarying(ctx, origValue, fromType);
6748  }
6749 
6750  const VectorType *toVector = CastType<VectorType>(toType);
6751  const VectorType *fromVector = CastType<VectorType>(fromType);
6752  if (toVector && fromVector) {
6753  // this should be caught during typechecking
6754  AssertPos(pos, toVector->GetElementCount() == fromVector->GetElementCount());
6755 
6756  llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6757  if (!exprVal)
6758  return NULL;
6759 
6760  // Emit instructions to do type conversion of each of the elements
6761  // of the vector.
6762  // FIXME: since uniform vectors are represented as
6763  // llvm::VectorTypes, we should just be able to issue the
6764  // corresponding vector type convert, which should be more
6765  // efficient by avoiding serialization!
6766  llvm::Value *cast = llvm::UndefValue::get(toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
6767  for (int i = 0; i < toVector->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
6768  llvm::Value *ei = ctx->ExtractInst(exprVal, i);
6769 
6770  llvm::Value *conv = lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, ei, toVector->GetElementType(),
6771  fromVector->GetElementType(), pos);
6772  if (!conv)
6773  return NULL;
6774  cast = ctx->InsertInst(cast, conv, i);
6775  }
6776  return cast;
6777  }
6778 
6779  llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
6780  if (!exprVal)
6781  return NULL;
6782 
6783  const EnumType *fromEnum = CastType<EnumType>(fromType);
6784  const EnumType *toEnum = CastType<EnumType>(toType);
6785  if (fromEnum)
6786  // treat it as an uint32 type for the below and all will be good.
6787  fromType = fromEnum->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformUInt32 :
6788  AtomicType::VaryingUInt32;
6789  if (toEnum)
6790  // treat it as an uint32 type for the below and all will be good.
6791  toType = toEnum->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformUInt32 :
6792  AtomicType::VaryingUInt32;
6793 
6794  const AtomicType *fromAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(fromType);
6795  // at this point, coming from an atomic type is all that's left...
6796  AssertPos(pos, fromAtomic != NULL);
6797 
6798  if (toVector) {
6799  // scalar -> short vector conversion
6800  llvm::Value *conv = lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, exprVal, toVector->GetElementType(),
6801  fromAtomic, pos);
6802  if (!conv)
6803  return NULL;
6804 
6805  llvm::Value *cast = NULL;
6806  llvm::Type* toTypeLLVM = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6807  if (llvm::isa<llvm::VectorType>(toTypeLLVM)) {
6808  // Example uniform float => uniform float<3>
6809  cast = ctx->BroadcastValue(conv, toTypeLLVM);
6810  }
6811  else if (llvm::isa<llvm::ArrayType>(toTypeLLVM)) {
6812  // Example varying float => varying float<3>
6813  cast = llvm::UndefValue::get(toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
6814  for (int i = 0; i < toVector->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
6815  // Here's InsertInst produces InsertValueInst.
6816  cast = ctx->InsertInst(cast, conv, i);
6817  }
6818  }
6819  else {
6820  FATAL("TypeCastExpr::GetValue: problem with cast");
6821  }
6822 
6823  return cast;
6824  }
6825  else if (toPointerType != NULL) {
6826  // int -> ptr
6827  if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
6828  exprVal = ctx->SmearUniform(exprVal);
6829 
6830  llvm::Type *llvmToType = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
6831  if (llvmToType == NULL)
6832  return NULL;
6833 
6834  return ctx->IntToPtrInst(exprVal, llvmToType, "int_to_ptr");
6835  }
6836  else {
6837  const AtomicType *toAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(toType);
6838  // typechecking should ensure this is the case
6839  AssertPos(pos, toAtomic != NULL);
6840 
6841  return lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, exprVal, toAtomic, fromAtomic, pos);
6842  }
6843 }
6844 
6845 
6846 llvm::Value *
6847 TypeCastExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
6848  if (GetLValueType() != NULL) {
6849  return GetValue(ctx);
6850  }
6851  else {
6852  return NULL;
6853  }
6854 }
6855 
6856 
6857 const Type *
6858 TypeCastExpr::GetType() const {
6859  AssertPos(pos, type->HasUnboundVariability() == false);
6860  return type;
6861 }
6862 
6863 
6864 const Type *
6865 TypeCastExpr::GetLValueType() const {
6866  AssertPos(pos, type->HasUnboundVariability() == false);
6867  if (CastType<PointerType>(GetType()) != NULL) {
6868  return type;
6869  }
6870  else {
6871  return NULL;
6872  }
6873 }
6874 
6875 
6876 static const Type *
6877 lDeconstifyType(const Type *t) {
6878  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(t);
6879  if (pt != NULL)
6880  return new PointerType(lDeconstifyType(pt->GetBaseType()),
6881  pt->GetVariability(), false);
6882  else
6883  return t->GetAsNonConstType();
6884 }
6885 
6886 
6887 Expr *
6888 TypeCastExpr::TypeCheck() {
6889  if (expr == NULL)
6890  return NULL;
6891 
6892  const Type *toType = type, *fromType = expr->GetType();
6893  if (toType == NULL || fromType == NULL)
6894  return NULL;
6895 
6896  if (toType->HasUnboundVariability() && fromType->IsUniformType()) {
6897  TypeCastExpr *tce = new TypeCastExpr(toType->GetAsUniformType(),
6898  expr, pos);
6899  return ::TypeCheck(tce);
6900  }
6901  type = toType = type->ResolveUnboundVariability(Variability::Varying);
6902 
6903  fromType = lDeconstifyType(fromType);
6904  toType = lDeconstifyType(toType);
6905 
6906  // Anything can be cast to void...
6907  if (Type::Equal(toType, AtomicType::Void))
6908  return this;
6909 
6910  if (Type::Equal(fromType, AtomicType::Void) ||
6911  (fromType->IsVaryingType() && toType->IsUniformType())) {
6912  Error(pos, "Can't type cast from type \"%s\" to type \"%s\"",
6913  fromType->GetString().c_str(), toType->GetString().c_str());
6914  return NULL;
6915  }
6916 
6917  // First some special cases that we allow only with an explicit type cast
6918  const PointerType *fromPtr = CastType<PointerType>(fromType);
6919  const PointerType *toPtr = CastType<PointerType>(toType);
6920  if (fromPtr != NULL && toPtr != NULL)
6921  // allow explicit typecasts between any two different pointer types
6922  return this;
6923 
6924  const AtomicType *fromAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(fromType);
6925  const AtomicType *toAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(toType);
6926  const EnumType *fromEnum = CastType<EnumType>(fromType);
6927  const EnumType *toEnum = CastType<EnumType>(toType);
6928  if ((fromAtomic || fromEnum) && (toAtomic || toEnum))
6929  // Allow explicit casts between all of these
6930  return this;
6931 
6932  // ptr -> int type casts
6933  if (fromPtr != NULL && toAtomic != NULL && toAtomic->IsIntType()) {
6934  bool safeCast = (toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 ||
6935  toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64);
6936  if (g->target->is32Bit())
6937  safeCast |= (toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT32 ||
6938  toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32);
6939  if (safeCast == false)
6940  Warning(pos, "Pointer type cast of type \"%s\" to integer type "
6941  "\"%s\" may lose information.",
6942  fromType->GetString().c_str(),
6943  toType->GetString().c_str());
6944  return this;
6945  }
6946 
6947  // int -> ptr
6948  if (fromAtomic != NULL && fromAtomic->IsIntType() && toPtr != NULL)
6949  return this;
6950 
6951  // And otherwise see if it's one of the conversions allowed to happen
6952  // implicitly.
6953  if (CanConvertTypes(fromType, toType, "type cast expression", pos) == false)
6954  return NULL;
6955 
6956  return this;
6957 }
6958 
6959 
6960 Expr *
6961 TypeCastExpr::Optimize() {
6962  ConstExpr *constExpr = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr);
6963  if (constExpr == NULL)
6964  // We can't do anything if this isn't a const expr
6965  return this;
6966 
6967  const Type *toType = GetType();
6968  const AtomicType *toAtomic = CastType<AtomicType>(toType);
6969  const EnumType *toEnum = CastType<EnumType>(toType);
6970  // If we're not casting to an atomic or enum type, we can't do anything
6971  // here, since ConstExprs can only represent those two types. (So
6972  // e.g. we're casting from an int to an int<4>.)
6973  if (toAtomic == NULL && toEnum == NULL)
6974  return this;
6975 
6976  bool forceVarying = toType->IsVaryingType();
6977 
6978  // All of the type conversion smarts we need is already in the
6979  // ConstExpr::AsBool(), etc., methods, so we just need to call the
6980  // appropriate one for the type that this cast is converting to.
6981  AtomicType::BasicType basicType = toAtomic ? toAtomic->basicType :
6982  AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32;
6983  switch (basicType) {
6984  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: {
6985  bool bv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6986  constExpr->AsBool(bv, forceVarying);
6987  return new ConstExpr(toType, bv, pos);
6988  }
6989  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: {
6990  int8_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6991  constExpr->AsInt8(iv, forceVarying);
6992  return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
6993  }
6994  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
6995  uint8_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
6996  constExpr->AsUInt8(uv, forceVarying);
6997  return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
6998  }
6999  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: {
7000  int16_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7001  constExpr->AsInt16(iv, forceVarying);
7002  return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
7003  }
7004  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
7005  uint16_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7006  constExpr->AsUInt16(uv, forceVarying);
7007  return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
7008  }
7009  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: {
7010  int32_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7011  constExpr->AsInt32(iv, forceVarying);
7012  return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
7013  }
7014  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
7015  uint32_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7016  constExpr->AsUInt32(uv, forceVarying);
7017  return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
7018  }
7019  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
7020  float fv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7021  constExpr->AsFloat(fv, forceVarying);
7022  return new ConstExpr(toType, fv, pos);
7023  }
7024  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: {
7025  int64_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7026  constExpr->AsInt64(iv, forceVarying);
7027  return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
7028  }
7029  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
7030  uint64_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7031  constExpr->AsUInt64(uv, forceVarying);
7032  return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
7033  }
7034  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
7035  double dv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
7036  constExpr->AsDouble(dv, forceVarying);
7037  return new ConstExpr(toType, dv, pos);
7038  }
7039  default:
7040  FATAL("unimplemented");
7041  }
7042  return this;
7043 }
7044 
7045 
7046 int
7047 TypeCastExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7048  if (dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr) != NULL)
7049  return 0;
7050 
7051  // FIXME: return COST_TYPECAST_COMPLEX when appropriate
7052  return COST_TYPECAST_SIMPLE;
7053 }
7054 
7055 
7056 void
7057 TypeCastExpr::Print() const {
7058  printf("[%s] type cast (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
7059  expr->Print();
7060  printf(")");
7061  pos.Print();
7062 }
7063 
7064 
7065 Symbol *
7066 TypeCastExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
7067  return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
7068 }
7069 
7070 
7071 static
7072 llvm::Constant *
7073 lConvertPointerConstant(llvm::Constant *c, const Type *constType) {
7074  if (c == NULL || constType->IsUniformType())
7075  return c;
7076 
7077  // Handle conversion to int and then to vector of int or array of int
7078  // (for varying and soa types, respectively)
7079  llvm::Constant *intPtr =
7080  llvm::ConstantExpr::getPtrToInt(c, LLVMTypes::PointerIntType);
7081  Assert(constType->IsVaryingType() || constType->IsSOAType());
7082  int count = constType->IsVaryingType() ? g->target->getVectorWidth() :
7083  constType->GetSOAWidth();
7084 
7085  std::vector<llvm::Constant *> smear;
7086  for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
7087  smear.push_back(intPtr);
7088 
7089  if (constType->IsVaryingType())
7090  return llvm::ConstantVector::get(smear);
7091  else {
7092  llvm::ArrayType *at =
7093  llvm::ArrayType::get(LLVMTypes::PointerIntType, count);
7094  return llvm::ConstantArray::get(at, smear);
7095  }
7096 }
7097 
7098 
7099 llvm::Constant *
7100 TypeCastExpr::GetConstant(const Type *constType) const {
7101  // We don't need to worry about most the basic cases where the type
7102  // cast can resolve to a constant here, since the
7103  // TypeCastExpr::Optimize() method generally ends up doing the type
7104  // conversion and returning a ConstExpr, which in turn will have its
7105  // GetConstant() method called. However, because ConstExpr currently
7106  // can't represent pointer values, we have to handle a few cases
7107  // related to pointers here:
7108  //
7109  // 1. Null pointer (NULL, 0) valued initializers
7110  // 2. Converting function types to pointer-to-function types
7111  // 3. And converting these from uniform to the varying/soa equivalents.
7112  //
7113  if (CastType<PointerType>(constType) == NULL)
7114  return NULL;
7115 
7116  llvm::Constant *c = expr->GetConstant(constType->GetAsUniformType());
7117  return lConvertPointerConstant(c, constType);
7118 }
7119 
7120
