7121 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7122 // ReferenceExpr
7123 
7124 ReferenceExpr::ReferenceExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
7125  : Expr(p) {
7126  expr = e;
7127 }
7128 
7129 
7130 llvm::Value *
7131 ReferenceExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7132  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7133  if (expr == NULL) {
7134  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7135  return NULL;
7136  }
7137 
7138  llvm::Value *value = expr->GetLValue(ctx);
7139  if (value != NULL)
7140  return value;
7141 
7142  // value is NULL if the expression is a temporary; in this case, we'll
7143  // allocate storage for it so that we can return the pointer to that...
7144  const Type *type;
7145  llvm::Type *llvmType;
7146  if ((type = expr->GetType()) == NULL ||
7147  (llvmType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx)) == NULL) {
7148  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7149  return NULL;
7150  }
7151 
7152  value = expr->GetValue(ctx);
7153  if (value == NULL) {
7154  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7155  return NULL;
7156  }
7157 
7158  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(llvmType);
7159  ctx->StoreInst(value, ptr);
7160  return ptr;
7161 }
7162 
7163 
7164 Symbol *
7165 ReferenceExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
7166  return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
7167 }
7168 
7169 
7170 const Type *
7171 ReferenceExpr::GetType() const {
7172  if (!expr)
7173  return NULL;
7174 
7175  const Type *type = expr->GetType();
7176  if (!type)
7177  return NULL;
7178 
7179  return new ReferenceType(type);
7180 }
7181 
7182 
7183 const Type *
7184 ReferenceExpr::GetLValueType() const {
7185  if (!expr)
7186  return NULL;
7187 
7188  const Type *type = expr->GetType();
7189  if (!type)
7190  return NULL;
7191 
7192  return PointerType::GetUniform(type);
7193 }
7194 
7195 
7196 Expr *
7197 ReferenceExpr::Optimize() {
7198  if (expr == NULL)
7199  return NULL;
7200  return this;
7201 }
7202 
7203 
7204 Expr *
7205 ReferenceExpr::TypeCheck() {
7206  if (expr == NULL)
7207  return NULL;
7208  return this;
7209 }
7210 
7211 
7212 int
7213 ReferenceExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7214  return 0;
7215 }
7216 
7217 
7218 void
7219 ReferenceExpr::Print() const {
7220  if (expr == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
7221  return;
7222 
7223  printf("[%s] &(", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
7224  expr->Print();
7225  printf(")");
7226  pos.Print();
7227 }
7228 
7229 
7230 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7231 // DerefExpr
7232 
7233 DerefExpr::DerefExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
7234  : Expr(p) {
7235  expr = e;
7236 }
7237 
7238 
7239 llvm::Value *
7240 DerefExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7241  if (expr == NULL)
7242  return NULL;
7243  llvm::Value *ptr = expr->GetValue(ctx);
7244  if (ptr == NULL)
7245  return NULL;
7246  const Type *type = expr->GetType();
7247  if (type == NULL)
7248  return NULL;
7249 
7250  if (lVaryingStructHasUniformMember(type, pos))
7251  return NULL;
7252 
7253  Symbol *baseSym = expr->GetBaseSymbol();
7254  llvm::Value *mask = baseSym ? lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx) :
7255  ctx->GetFullMask();
7256 
7257  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7258  return ctx->LoadInst(ptr, mask, type);
7259 }
7260 
7261 
7262 llvm::Value *
7263 DerefExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7264  if (expr == NULL)
7265  return NULL;
7266  return expr->GetValue(ctx);
7267 }
7268 
7269 
7270 const Type *
7271 DerefExpr::GetLValueType() const {
7272  if (expr == NULL)
7273  return NULL;
7274  return expr->GetType();
7275 }
7276 
7277 
7278 Symbol *
7279 DerefExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
7280  return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
7281 }
7282 
7283 
7284 Expr *
7285 DerefExpr::Optimize() {
7286  if (expr == NULL)
7287  return NULL;
7288  return this;
7289 }
7290 
7291 
7292 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7293 // PtrDerefExpr
7294 
7295 PtrDerefExpr::PtrDerefExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
7296  : DerefExpr(e, p) {
7297 }
7298 
7299 
7300 const Type *
7301 PtrDerefExpr::GetType() const {
7302  const Type *type;
7303  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7304  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7305  return NULL;
7306  }
7307  AssertPos(pos, CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL);
7308 
7309  if (type->IsUniformType())
7310  return type->GetBaseType();
7311  else
7312  return type->GetBaseType()->GetAsVaryingType();
7313 }
7314 
7315 
7316 Expr *
7317 PtrDerefExpr::TypeCheck() {
7318  const Type *type;
7319  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7320  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7321  return NULL;
7322  }
7323 
7324  if (const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type)) {
7325  if (Type::Equal(AtomicType::Void, pt->GetBaseType())) {
7326  Error(pos, "Illegal to dereference void pointer type \"%s\".",
7327  type->GetString().c_str());
7328  return NULL;
7329  }
7330  }
7331  else {
7332  Error(pos, "Illegal to dereference non-pointer type \"%s\".",
7333  type->GetString().c_str());
7334  return NULL;
7335  }
7336 
7337  return this;
7338 }
7339 
7340 
7341 int
7342 PtrDerefExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7343  const Type *type;
7344  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7345  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7346  return 0;
7347  }
7348 
7349  if (type->IsVaryingType())
7350  // Be pessimistic; some of these will later be optimized into
7351  // vector loads/stores..
7352  return COST_GATHER + COST_DEREF;
7353  else
7354  return COST_DEREF;
7355 }
7356 
7357 
7358 void
7359 PtrDerefExpr::Print() const {
7360  if (expr == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
7361  return;
7362 
7363  printf("[%s] *(", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
7364  expr->Print();
7365  printf(")");
7366  pos.Print();
7367 }
7368 
7369 
7370 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7371 // RefDerefExpr
7372 
7373 RefDerefExpr::RefDerefExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
7374  : DerefExpr(e, p) {
7375 }
7376 
7377 
7378 const Type *
7379 RefDerefExpr::GetType() const {
7380  const Type *type;
7381  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7382  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7383  return NULL;
7384  }
7385 
7386  AssertPos(pos, CastType<ReferenceType>(type) != NULL);
7387  return type->GetReferenceTarget();
7388 }
7389 
7390 
7391 Expr *
7392 RefDerefExpr::TypeCheck() {
7393  const Type *type;
7394  if (expr == NULL || (type = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7395  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7396  return NULL;
7397  }
7398 
7399  // We only create RefDerefExprs internally for references in
7400  // expressions, so we should never create one with a non-reference
7401  // expression...
7402  AssertPos(pos, CastType<ReferenceType>(type) != NULL);
7403 
7404  return this;
7405 }
7406 
7407 
7408 int
7409 RefDerefExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7410  if (expr == NULL)
7411  return 0;
7412 
7413  return COST_DEREF;
7414 }
7415 
7416 
7417 void
7418 RefDerefExpr::Print() const {
7419  if (expr == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
7420  return;
7421 
7422  printf("[%s] deref-reference (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
7423  expr->Print();
7424  printf(")");
7425  pos.Print();
7426 }
7427 
7428 
7429 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7430 // AddressOfExpr
7431 
7432 AddressOfExpr::AddressOfExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
7433  : Expr(p), expr(e) {
7434 }
7435 
7436 
7437 llvm::Value *
7438 AddressOfExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7439  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7440  if (expr == NULL)
7441  return NULL;
7442 
7443  const Type *exprType = expr->GetType();
7444  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType) != NULL ||
7445  CastType<FunctionType>(exprType) != NULL)
7446  return expr->GetValue(ctx);
7447  else
7448  return expr->GetLValue(ctx);
7449 }
7450 
7451 
7452 const Type *
7453 AddressOfExpr::GetType() const {
7454  if (expr == NULL)
7455  return NULL;
7456 
7457  const Type *exprType = expr->GetType();
7458  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType) != NULL)
7459  return PointerType::GetUniform(exprType->GetReferenceTarget());
7460 
7461  const Type *t = expr->GetLValueType();
7462  if (t != NULL)
7463  return t;
7464  else {
7465  t = expr->GetType();
7466  if (t == NULL) {
7467  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7468  return NULL;
7469  }
7470  return PointerType::GetUniform(t);
7471  }
7472 }
7473 
7474 
7475 Symbol *
7476 AddressOfExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
7477  return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
7478 }
7479 
7480 
7481 void
7482 AddressOfExpr::Print() const {
7483  printf("&(");
7484  if (expr)
7485  expr->Print();
7486  else
7487  printf("NULL expr");
7488  printf(")");
7489  pos.Print();
7490 }
7491 
7492 
7493 Expr *
7494 AddressOfExpr::TypeCheck() {
7495  const Type *exprType;
7496  if (expr == NULL || (exprType = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7497  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7498  return NULL;
7499  }
7500 
7501  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(exprType) != NULL ||
7502  CastType<FunctionType>(exprType) != NULL) {
7503  return this;
7504  }
7505 
7506  if (expr->GetLValueType() != NULL)
7507  return this;
7508 
7509  Error(expr->pos, "Illegal to take address of non-lvalue or function.");
7510  return NULL;
7511 }
7512 
7513 
7514 Expr *
7515 AddressOfExpr::Optimize() {
7516  return this;
7517 }
7518 
7519 
7520 int
7521 AddressOfExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7522  return 0;
7523 }
7524 
7525 
7526 llvm::Constant *
7527 AddressOfExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
7528  const Type *exprType;
7529  if (expr == NULL || (exprType = expr->GetType()) == NULL) {
7530  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
7531  return NULL;
7532  }
7533 
7534  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
7535  if (pt == NULL)
7536  return NULL;
7537 
7538  const FunctionType *ft = CastType<FunctionType>(pt->GetBaseType());
7539  if (ft != NULL) {
7540  llvm::Constant *c = expr->GetConstant(ft);
7541  return lConvertPointerConstant(c, type);
7542  }
7543  else
7544  return NULL;
7545 }
7546 
7547 
7548 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7549 // SizeOfExpr
7550 
7551 SizeOfExpr::SizeOfExpr(Expr *e, SourcePos p)
7552  : Expr(p), expr(e), type(NULL) {
7553 }
7554 
7555 
7556 SizeOfExpr::SizeOfExpr(const Type *t, SourcePos p)
7557  : Expr(p), expr(NULL), type(t) {
7558  type = type->ResolveUnboundVariability(Variability::Varying);
7559 }
7560 
7561 
7562 llvm::Value *
7563 SizeOfExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7564  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7565  const Type *t = expr ? expr->GetType() : type;
7566  if (t == NULL)
7567  return NULL;
7568 
7569  llvm::Type *llvmType = t->LLVMType(g->ctx);
7570  if (llvmType == NULL)
7571  return NULL;
7572 
7573  return g->target->SizeOf(llvmType, ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
7574 }
7575 
7576 
7577 const Type *
7578 SizeOfExpr::GetType() const {
7579  return (g->target->is32Bit() || g->opt.force32BitAddressing) ?
7580  AtomicType::UniformUInt32 : AtomicType::UniformUInt64;
7581 }
7582 
7583 
7584 void
7585 SizeOfExpr::Print() const {
7586  printf("Sizeof (");
7587  if (expr != NULL)
7588  expr->Print();
7589  const Type *t = expr ? expr->GetType() : type;
7590  if (t != NULL)
7591  printf(" [type %s]", t->GetString().c_str());
7592  printf(")");
7593  pos.Print();
7594 }
7595 
7596 
7597 Expr *
7598 SizeOfExpr::TypeCheck() {
7599  // Can't compute the size of a struct without a definition
7600  if (type != NULL &&
7601  CastType<UndefinedStructType>(type) != NULL) {
7602  Error(pos, "Can't compute the size of declared but not defined "
7603  "struct type \"%s\".", type->GetString().c_str());
7604  return NULL;
7605  }
7606 
7607  return this;
7608 }
7609 
7610 
7611 Expr *
7612 SizeOfExpr::Optimize() {
7613  return this;
7614 }
7615 
7616 
7617 int
7618 SizeOfExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7619  return 0;
7620 }
7621 
7622 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7623 // SymbolExpr
7624 
7625 SymbolExpr::SymbolExpr(Symbol *s, SourcePos p)
7626  : Expr(p) {
7627  symbol = s;
7628 }
7629 
7630 
7631 llvm::Value *
7632 SymbolExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7633  // storagePtr may be NULL due to an earlier compilation error
7634  if (!symbol || !symbol->storagePtr)
7635  return NULL;
7636  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7637 
7638  std::string loadName = symbol->name + std::string("_load");
7639  return ctx->LoadInst(symbol->storagePtr, loadName.c_str());
7640 }
7641 
7642 
7643 llvm::Value *
7644 SymbolExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7645  if (symbol == NULL)
7646  return NULL;
7647  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
7648  return symbol->storagePtr;
7649 }
7650 
7651 
7652 const Type *
7653 SymbolExpr::GetLValueType() const {
7654  if (symbol == NULL)
7655  return NULL;
7656 
7657  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(symbol->type) != NULL)
7658  return PointerType::GetUniform(symbol->type->GetReferenceTarget());
7659  else
7660  return PointerType::GetUniform(symbol->type);
7661 }
7662 
7663 
7664 Symbol *
7665 SymbolExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
7666  return symbol;
7667 }
7668 
7669 
7670 const Type *
7671 SymbolExpr::GetType() const {
7672  return symbol ? symbol->type : NULL;
7673 }
7674 
7675 
7676 Expr *
7677 SymbolExpr::TypeCheck() {
7678  return this;
7679 }
7680 
7681 
7682 Expr *
7683 SymbolExpr::Optimize() {
7684  if (symbol == NULL)
7685  return NULL;
7686  else if (symbol->constValue != NULL) {
7687  AssertPos(pos, GetType()->IsConstType());
7688  return new ConstExpr(symbol->constValue, pos);
7689  }
7690  else
7691  return this;
7692 }
7693 
7694 
7695 int
7696 SymbolExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7697  // Be optimistic and assume it's in a register or can be used as a
7698  // memory operand..
7699  return 0;
7700 }
7701 
7702 
7703 void
7704 SymbolExpr::Print() const {
7705  if (symbol == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
7706  return;
7707 
7708  printf("[%s] sym: (%s)", GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
7709  symbol->name.c_str());
7710  pos.Print();
7711 }
7712 
7713 
7714 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
7715 // FunctionSymbolExpr
7716 
7717 FunctionSymbolExpr::FunctionSymbolExpr(const char *n,
7718  const std::vector<Symbol *> &candidates,
7719  SourcePos p)
7720  : Expr(p) {
7721  name = n;
7722  candidateFunctions = candidates;
7723  matchingFunc = (candidates.size() == 1) ? candidates[0] : NULL;
7724  triedToResolve = false;
7725 }
7726 
7727 
7728 const Type *
7729 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetType() const {
7730  if (triedToResolve == false && matchingFunc == NULL) {
7731  Error(pos, "Ambiguous use of overloaded function \"%s\".",
7732  name.c_str());
7733  return NULL;
7734  }
7735 
7736  return matchingFunc ? matchingFunc->type : NULL;
7737 }
7738 
7739 
7740 llvm::Value *
7741 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
7742  return matchingFunc ? matchingFunc->function : NULL;
7743 }
7744 
7745 
7746 Symbol *
7747 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
7748  return matchingFunc;
7749 }
7750 
7751 
7752 Expr *
7753 FunctionSymbolExpr::TypeCheck() {
7754  return this;
7755 }
7756 
7757 
7758 Expr *
7759 FunctionSymbolExpr::Optimize() {
7760  return this;
7761 }
7762 
7763 
7764 int
7765 FunctionSymbolExpr::EstimateCost() const {
7766  return 0;
7767 }
7768 
7769 
7770 void
7771 FunctionSymbolExpr::Print() const {
7772  if (!matchingFunc || !GetType())
7773  return;
7774 
7775  printf("[%s] fun sym (%s)", GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
7776  matchingFunc->name.c_str());
7777  pos.Print();
7778 }
7779 
7780 
7781 llvm::Constant *
7782 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
7783  if (matchingFunc == NULL || matchingFunc->function == NULL)
7784  return NULL;
7785 
7786  const FunctionType *ft = CastType<FunctionType>(type);
7787  if (ft == NULL)
7788  return NULL;
7789 
7790  if (Type::Equal(type, matchingFunc->type) == false) {
7791  Error(pos, "Type of function symbol \"%s\" doesn't match expected type "
7792  "\"%s\".", matchingFunc->type->GetString().c_str(),
7793  type->GetString().c_str());
7794  return NULL;
7795  }
7796 
7797  return matchingFunc->function;
7798 }
7799 
7800 
7801 static std::string
7802 lGetOverloadCandidateMessage(const std::vector<Symbol *> &funcs,
7803  const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes,
7804  const std::vector<bool> *argCouldBeNULL) {
7805  std::string message = "Passed types: (";
7806  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argTypes.size(); ++i) {
7807  if (argTypes[i] != NULL)
7808  message += argTypes[i]->GetString();
7809  else
7810  message += "(unknown type)";
7811  message += (i < argTypes.size()-1) ? ", " : ")\n";
7812  }
7813 
7814  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < funcs.size(); ++i) {
7815  const FunctionType *ft = CastType<FunctionType>(funcs[i]->type);
7816  Assert(ft != NULL);
7817  message += "Candidate: ";
7818  message += ft->GetString();
7819  if (i < funcs.size() - 1)
7820  message += "\n";
7821  }
7822  return message;
7823 }
7824 
7825 
7826 static bool
7827 lIsMatchToNonConstReference(const Type *callType, const Type *funcArgType) {
7828  return (CastType<ReferenceType>(funcArgType) &&
7829  (funcArgType->IsConstType() == false) &&
7830  Type::Equal(callType, funcArgType->GetReferenceTarget()));
7831 }
7832 
7833 
7834 static bool
7835 lIsMatchToNonConstReferenceUnifToVarying(const Type *callType,
7836  const Type *funcArgType) {
7837  return (CastType<ReferenceType>(funcArgType) &&
7838  (funcArgType->IsConstType() == false) &&
7839  Type::Equal(callType->GetAsVaryingType(),
7840  funcArgType->GetReferenceTarget()));
7841 }
7842 
7843 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns true if
7844  converting the argument to the call type only requires a type
7845  conversion that won't lose information. Otherwise return false.
7846  */
7847 static bool
7848 lIsMatchWithTypeWidening(const Type *callType, const Type *funcArgType) {
7849  const AtomicType *callAt = CastType<AtomicType>(callType);
7850  const AtomicType *funcAt = CastType<AtomicType>(funcArgType);
7851  if (callAt == NULL || funcAt == NULL)
7852  return false;
7853 
7854  if (callAt->IsUniformType() != funcAt->IsUniformType())
7855  return false;
7856 
7857  switch (callAt->basicType) {
7858  case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
7859  return true;
7860  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
7861  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
7862  return (funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL);
7863  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
7864  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
7865  return (funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL &&
7866  funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_INT8 &&
7867  funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8);
7868  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
7869  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
7870  return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT32 ||
7871  funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32 ||
7872  funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 ||
7873  funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64);
7874  case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
7875  return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE);
7876  case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
7877  case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
7878  return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 ||
7879  funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64);
7880  case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
7881  return false;
7882  default:
7883  FATAL("Unhandled atomic type");
7884  return false;
7885  }
7886 }
7887 
7888 
7889 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns true if
7890  the call argument type and the function argument type match if we only
7891  do a uniform -> varying type conversion but otherwise have exactly the
7892  same type.
7893  */
7894 static bool
7895 lIsMatchWithUniformToVarying(const Type *callType, const Type *funcArgType) {
7896  return (callType->IsUniformType() &&
7897  funcArgType->IsVaryingType() &&
7898  Type::EqualIgnoringConst(callType->GetAsVaryingType(), funcArgType));
7899 }
7900 
7901 
7902 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns true if
7903  we can type convert from the call argument type to the function
7904  argument type, but without doing a uniform -> varying conversion.
7905  */
7906 static bool
7907 lIsMatchWithTypeConvSameVariability(const Type *callType,
7908  const Type *funcArgType) {
7909  return (CanConvertTypes(callType, funcArgType) &&
7910  (callType->GetVariability() == funcArgType->GetVariability()));
7911 }
7912 
7913 
7914 /* Returns the set of function overloads that are potential matches, given
7915  argCount values being passed as arguments to the function call.
7916  */
7917 std::vector<Symbol *>
7918 FunctionSymbolExpr::getCandidateFunctions(int argCount) const {
7919  std::vector<Symbol *> ret;
7920  for (int i = 0; i < (int)candidateFunctions.size(); ++i) {
7921  const FunctionType *ft =
7922  CastType<FunctionType>(candidateFunctions[i]->type);
7923  AssertPos(pos, ft != NULL);
7924 
7925  // There's no way to match if the caller is passing more arguments
7926  // than this function instance takes.
7927  if (argCount > ft->GetNumParameters())
7928  continue;
7929 
7930  // Not enough arguments, and no default argument value to save us
7931  if (argCount < ft->GetNumParameters() &&
7932  ft->GetParameterDefault(argCount) == NULL)
7933  continue;
7934 
7935  // Success
7936  ret.push_back(candidateFunctions[i]);
7937  }
7938  return ret;
7939 }
7940 
7941 
7942 static bool
7943 lArgIsPointerType(const Type *type) {
7944  if (CastType<PointerType>(type) != NULL)
7945  return true;
7946 
7947  const ReferenceType *rt = CastType<ReferenceType>(type);
7948  if (rt == NULL)
7949  return false;
7950 
7951  const Type *t = rt->GetReferenceTarget();
7952  return (CastType<PointerType>(t) != NULL);
7953 }
7954 
7955 
7956 /** This function computes the value of a cost function that represents the
7957  cost of calling a function of the given type with arguments of the
7958  given types. If it's not possible to call the function, regardless of
7959  any type conversions applied, a cost of -1 is returned.
7960  */
7961 int
7962 FunctionSymbolExpr::computeOverloadCost(const FunctionType *ftype,
7963  const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes,
7964  const std::vector<bool> *argCouldBeNULL,
7965  const std::vector<bool> *argIsConstant) {
7966  int costSum = 0;
7967 
7968  // In computing the cost function, we only worry about the actual
7969  // argument types--using function default parameter values is free for
7970  // the purposes here...
7971  for (int i = 0; i < (int)argTypes.size(); ++i) {
7972  // The cost imposed by this argument will be a multiple of
7973  // costScale, which has a value set so that for each of the cost
7974  // buckets, even if all of the function arguments undergo the next
7975  // lower-cost conversion, the sum of their costs will be less than
7976  // a single instance of the next higher-cost conversion.
7977  int costScale = argTypes.size() + 1;
7978 
7979  const Type *fargType = ftype->GetParameterType(i);
7980  const Type *callType = argTypes[i];
7981 
7982  if (Type::Equal(callType, fargType))
7983  // Perfect match: no cost
7984  costSum += 0;
7985  else if (argCouldBeNULL && (*argCouldBeNULL)[i] &&
7986  lArgIsPointerType(fargType))
7987  // Passing NULL to a pointer-typed parameter is also a no-cost
7988  // operation
7989  costSum += 0;
7990  else {
7991  // If the argument is a compile-time constant, we'd like to
7992  // count the cost of various conversions as much lower than the
7993  // cost if it wasn't--so scale up the cost when this isn't the
7994  // case..
7995  if (argIsConstant == NULL || (*argIsConstant)[i] == false)
7996  costScale *= 128;
7997 
7998  // For convenience, normalize to non-const types (except for
7999  // references, where const-ness matters). For all other types,
8000  // we're passing by value anyway, so const doesn't matter.
8001  const Type *callTypeNC = callType, *fargTypeNC = fargType;
8002  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(callType) == NULL)
8003  callTypeNC = callType->GetAsNonConstType();
8004  if (CastType<ReferenceType>(fargType) == NULL)
8005  fargTypeNC = fargType->GetAsNonConstType();
8006 
8007  if (Type::Equal(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC))
8008  // Exact match (after dealing with references, above)
8009  costSum += 1 * costScale;
8010  // note: orig fargType for the next two...
8011  else if (lIsMatchToNonConstReference(callTypeNC, fargType))
8012  costSum += 2 * costScale;
8013  else if (lIsMatchToNonConstReferenceUnifToVarying(callTypeNC, fargType))
8014  costSum += 4 * costScale;
8015  else if (lIsMatchWithTypeWidening(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC))
8016  costSum += 8 * costScale;
8017  else if (lIsMatchWithUniformToVarying(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC))
8018  costSum += 16 * costScale;
8019  else if (lIsMatchWithTypeConvSameVariability(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC))
8020  costSum += 32 * costScale;
8021  else if (CanConvertTypes(callTypeNC, fargTypeNC))
8022  costSum += 64 * costScale;
8023  else
8024  // Failure--no type conversion possible...
8025  return -1;
8026  }
8027  }
8028 
8029  return costSum;
8030 }
8031 
8032 
8033 bool
8034 FunctionSymbolExpr::ResolveOverloads(SourcePos argPos,
8035  const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes,
8036  const std::vector<bool> *argCouldBeNULL,
8037  const std::vector<bool> *argIsConstant) {
8038  const char *funName = candidateFunctions.front()->name.c_str();
8039 
8040  triedToResolve = true;
8041 
8042  // Functions with names that start with "__" should only be various
8043  // builtins. For those, we'll demand an exact match, since we'll
8044  // expect whichever function in stdlib.ispc is calling out to one of
8045  // those to be matching the argument types exactly; this is to be a bit
8046  // extra safe to be sure that the expected builtin is in fact being
8047  // called.
8048  bool exactMatchOnly = (name.substr(0,2) == "__");
8049 
8050  // First, find the subset of overload candidates that take the same
8051  // number of arguments as have parameters (including functions that
8052  // take more arguments but have defaults starting no later than after
8053  // our last parameter).
8054  std::vector<Symbol *> actualCandidates =
8055  getCandidateFunctions(argTypes.size());
8056 
8057  int bestMatchCost = 1<<30;
8058  std::vector<Symbol *> matches;
8059  std::vector<int> candidateCosts;
8060 
8061  if (actualCandidates.size() == 0)
8062  goto failure;
8063 
8064  // Compute the cost for calling each of the candidate functions
8065  for (int i = 0; i < (int)actualCandidates.size(); ++i) {
8066  const FunctionType *ft =
8067  CastType<FunctionType>(actualCandidates[i]->type);
8068  AssertPos(pos, ft != NULL);
8069  candidateCosts.push_back(computeOverloadCost(ft, argTypes,
8070  argCouldBeNULL,
8071  argIsConstant));
8072  }
8073 
8074  // Find the best cost, and then the candidate or candidates that have
8075  // that cost.
8076  for (int i = 0; i < (int)candidateCosts.size(); ++i) {
8077  if (candidateCosts[i] != -1 && candidateCosts[i] < bestMatchCost)
8078  bestMatchCost = candidateCosts[i];
8079  }
8080  // None of the candidates matched
8081  if (bestMatchCost == (1<<30))
8082  goto failure;
8083  for (int i = 0; i < (int)candidateCosts.size(); ++i) {
8084  if (candidateCosts[i] == bestMatchCost)
8085  matches.push_back(actualCandidates[i]);
8086  }
8087 
8088  if (matches.size() == 1) {
8089  // Only one match: success
8090  matchingFunc = matches[0];
8091  return true;
8092  }
8093  else if (matches.size() > 1) {
8094  // Multiple matches: ambiguous
8095  std::string candidateMessage =
8096  lGetOverloadCandidateMessage(matches, argTypes, argCouldBeNULL);
8097  Error(pos, "Multiple overloaded functions matched call to function "
8098  "\"%s\"%s.\n%s", funName,
8099  exactMatchOnly ? " only considering exact matches" : "",
8100  candidateMessage.c_str());
8101  return false;
8102  }
8103  else {
8104  // No matches at all
8105  failure:
8106  std::string candidateMessage =
8107  lGetOverloadCandidateMessage(matches, argTypes, argCouldBeNULL);
8108  Error(pos, "Unable to find any matching overload for call to function "
8109  "\"%s\"%s.\n%s", funName,
8110  exactMatchOnly ? " only considering exact matches" : "",
8111  candidateMessage.c_str());
8112  return false;
8113  }
8114 }
8115 
8116 
8117 Symbol *
8118 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetMatchingFunction() {
8119  return matchingFunc;
8120 }
8121

8127 SyncExpr::GetType() const {
8128  return AtomicType::Void;
8129 }

8133 SyncExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
8134  ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
8135  ctx->SyncInst();
8136  return NULL;
8137 }

8141 SyncExpr::EstimateCost() const {
8142  return COST_SYNC;
8143 }

8171 }

8191 
8192 llvm::Constant *
8193 NullPointerExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
8194  const PointerType *pt = CastType<PointerType>(type);
8195  if (pt == NULL)
8196  return NULL;
8197 
8198  llvm::Type *llvmType = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
8199  if (llvmType == NULL) {
8200  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
8201  return NULL;
8202  }
8203 
8204  return llvm::Constant::getNullValue(llvmType);
8205 }

8211  pos.Print();
8212 }

8216 NullPointerExpr::EstimateCost() const {
8217  return 0;
8218 }
8219 
8220 
8221 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
8222 // NewExpr
8223 
8224 NewExpr::NewExpr(int typeQual, const Type *t, Expr *init, Expr *count,
8225  SourcePos tqPos, SourcePos p)
8226  : Expr(p) {
8227  allocType = t;
8228 
8229  initExpr = init;
8230  countExpr = count;
8231 
8232  /* (The below cases actually should be impossible, since the parser
8233  doesn't allow more than a single type qualifier before a "new".) */
8234  if ((typeQual & ~(TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM | TYPEQUAL_VARYING)) != 0) {
8235  Error(tqPos, "Illegal type qualifiers in \"new\" expression (only "
8236  "\"uniform\" and \"varying\" are allowed.");
8237  isVarying = false;
8238  }
8239  else if ((typeQual & TYPEQUAL_UNIFORM) != 0 &&
8240  (typeQual & TYPEQUAL_VARYING) != 0) {
8241  Error(tqPos, "Illegal to provide both \"uniform\" and \"varying\" "
8242  "qualifiers to \"new\" expression.");
8243  isVarying = false;
8244  }
8245  else
8246  // If no type qualifier is given before the 'new', treat it as a
8247  // varying new.
8248  isVarying = (typeQual == 0) || (typeQual & TYPEQUAL_VARYING);
8249 
8250  if (allocType != NULL)
8251  allocType = allocType->ResolveUnboundVariability(Variability::Uniform);
8252 }
8253 
8254 
8255 llvm::Value *
8256 NewExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
8257  bool do32Bit = (g->target->is32Bit() || g->opt.force32BitAddressing);
8258 
8259  // Determine how many elements we need to allocate. Note that this
8260  // will be a varying value if this is a varying new.
8261  llvm::Value *countValue;
8262  if (countExpr != NULL) {
8263  countValue = countExpr->GetValue(ctx);
8264  if (countValue == NULL) {
8265  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
8266  return NULL;
8267  }
8268  }
8269  else {
8270  if (isVarying) {
8271  if (do32Bit) countValue = LLVMInt32Vector(1);
8272  else countValue = LLVMInt64Vector(1);
8273  }
8274  else {
8275  if (do32Bit) countValue = LLVMInt32(1);
8276  else countValue = LLVMInt64(1);
8277  }
8278  }
8279 
8280  // Compute the total amount of memory to allocate, allocSize, as the
8281  // product of the number of elements to allocate and the size of a
8282  // single element.
8283  llvm::Value *eltSize = g->target->SizeOf(allocType->LLVMType(g->ctx),
8284  ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock());
8285  if (isVarying)
8286  eltSize = ctx->SmearUniform(eltSize, "smear_size");
8287  llvm::Value *allocSize = ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Mul, countValue,
8288  eltSize, "alloc_size");
8289 
8290  // Determine which allocation builtin function to call: uniform or
8291  // varying, and taking 32-bit or 64-bit allocation counts.
8292  llvm::Function *func;
8293  if (isVarying) {
8294  if (g->target->is32Bit()) {
8295  func = m->module->getFunction("__new_varying32_32rt");
8296  } else if (g->opt.force32BitAddressing) {
8297  func = m->module->getFunction("__new_varying32_64rt");
8298  } else {
8299  func = m->module->getFunction("__new_varying64_64rt");
8300  }
8301  }
8302  else {
8303  // FIXME: __new_uniform_32rt should take i32
8304  if (allocSize->getType() != LLVMTypes::Int64Type)
8305  allocSize = ctx->SExtInst(allocSize, LLVMTypes::Int64Type,
8306  "alloc_size64");
8307  if (g->target->is32Bit()) {
8308  func = m->module->getFunction("__new_uniform_32rt");
8309  } else {
8310  func = m->module->getFunction("__new_uniform_64rt");
8311  }
8312  }
8313  AssertPos(pos, func != NULL);
8314 
8315  // Make the call for the the actual allocation.
8316  llvm::Value *ptrValue = ctx->CallInst(func, NULL, allocSize, "new");
8317 
8318  // Now handle initializers and returning the right type for the result.
8319  const Type *retType = GetType();
8320  if (retType == NULL)
8321  return NULL;
8322  if (isVarying) {
8323  if (g->target->is32Bit())
8324  // Convert i64 vector values to i32 if we are compiling to a
8325  // 32-bit target.
8326  ptrValue = ctx->TruncInst(ptrValue, LLVMTypes::VoidPointerVectorType,
8327  "ptr_to_32bit");
8328 
8329  if (initExpr != NULL) {
8330  // If we have an initializer expression, emit code that checks
8331  // to see if each lane is active and if so, runs the code to do
8332  // the initialization. Note that we're we're taking advantage
8333  // of the fact that the __new_varying*() functions are
8334  // implemented to return NULL for program instances that aren't
8335  // executing; more generally, we should be using the current
8336  // execution mask for this...
8337  for (int i = 0; i < g->target->getVectorWidth(); ++i) {
8338  llvm::BasicBlock *bbInit = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("init_ptr");
8339  llvm::BasicBlock *bbSkip = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("skip_init");
8340  llvm::Value *p = ctx->ExtractInst(ptrValue, i);
8341  llvm::Value *nullValue = g->target->is32Bit() ? LLVMInt32(0) :
8342  LLVMInt64(0);
8343  // Is the pointer for the current lane non-zero?
8344  llvm::Value *nonNull = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp,
8345  llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
8346  p, nullValue, "non_null");
8347  ctx->BranchInst(bbInit, bbSkip, nonNull);
8348 
8349  // Initialize the memory pointed to by the pointer for the
8350  // current lane.
8351  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbInit);
8352  llvm::Type *ptrType =
8353  retType->GetAsUniformType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
8354  llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->IntToPtrInst(p, ptrType);
8355  InitSymbol(ptr, allocType, initExpr, ctx, pos);
8356  ctx->BranchInst(bbSkip);
8357 
8358  ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(bbSkip);
8359  }
8360  }
8361 
8362  return ptrValue;
8363  }
8364  else {
8365  // For uniform news, we just need to cast the void * to be a
8366  // pointer of the return type and to run the code for initializers,
8367  // if present.
8368  llvm::Type *ptrType = retType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
8369  ptrValue = ctx->BitCastInst(ptrValue, ptrType,
8370  LLVMGetName(ptrValue, "_cast_ptr"));
8371 
8372  if (initExpr != NULL)
8373  InitSymbol(ptrValue, allocType, initExpr, ctx, pos);
8374 
8375  return ptrValue;
8376  }
8377 }
8378 
8379 
8380 const Type *
8381 NewExpr::GetType() const {
8382  if (allocType == NULL)
8383  return NULL;
8384 
8385  return isVarying ? PointerType::GetVarying(allocType) :
8386  PointerType::GetUniform(allocType);
8387 }
8388 
8389 
8390 Expr *
8391 NewExpr::TypeCheck() {
8392  // It's illegal to call new with an undefined struct type
8393  if (allocType == NULL) {
8394  AssertPos(pos, m->errorCount > 0);
8395  return NULL;
8396  }
8397  if (CastType<UndefinedStructType>(allocType) != NULL) {
8398  Error(pos, "Can't dynamically allocate storage for declared "
8399  "but not defined type \"%s\".", allocType->GetString().c_str());
8400  return NULL;
8401  }
8402 
8403  // Otherwise we only need to make sure that if we have an expression
8404  // giving a number of elements to allocate that it can be converted to
8405  // an integer of the appropriate variability.
8406  if (countExpr == NULL)
8407  return this;
8408 
8409  const Type *countType;
8410  if ((countType = countExpr->GetType()) == NULL)
8411  return NULL;
8412 
8413  if (isVarying == false && countType->IsVaryingType()) {
8414  Error(pos, "Illegal to provide \"varying\" allocation count with "
8415  "\"uniform new\" expression.");
8416  return NULL;
8417  }
8418 
8419  // Figure out the type that the allocation count should be
8420  const Type *t = (g->target->is32Bit() || g->opt.force32BitAddressing) ?
8421  AtomicType::UniformUInt32 : AtomicType::UniformUInt64;
8422  if (isVarying)
8423  t = t->GetAsVaryingType();
8424 
8425  countExpr = TypeConvertExpr(countExpr, t, "item count");
8426  if (countExpr == NULL)
8427  return NULL;
8428 
8429  return this;
8430 }
8431 
8432 
8433 Expr *
8434 NewExpr::Optimize() {
8435  return this;
8436 }
8437 
8438 
8439 void
8440 NewExpr::Print() const {
8441  printf("new (%s)", allocType ? allocType->GetString().c_str() : "NULL");
8442 }
8443 
8444 
8445 int
8446 NewExpr::EstimateCost() const {
8447  return COST_NEW;
8448 }
Generated on Sat Jul 20 2013 05:53:14 for Intel SPMD Program Compiler by   1.8.1.2
